story:
Short Summary

Welcome!

My name is Chantal Cherry. I'm a dancer, choreographer, yoga instructor, and travel junkie. I've been practicing yoga since 2007 - first for fitness, then for flexibility, and now for good ol' wholesome living -- among all the other perks!

Yoga is a fantastic source of fulfillment for all kinds of people. Oftentimes a limiting factor is placed on class attendance, such as schedule, budget, or even weather. A solution: look online for classes. CarpeYoga.com will offer an all-round remarkable, cinematic experience that will transport you from your screen to these beautiful locations.

My aim is to raise funds in order to create this online yoga website on which subscribers will be able to follow beginner, intermediate and advanced classes, all of which will be set in varying awe-inspiring, outdoor spots around the world.

By supporting this campaign, contributors will enable me to produce these high definition, well-made films of yoga classes and tutorials.


What I Need & What You Get

Here's the deal:

  • The goal is to raise $10 000. This capital will go towards hiring people and equipment to produce the videos (really well!); creating an efficient, attractive, user-friendly website; and rewarding the glorious contributors investing in the project (you).
  • Rewards for contributing range from free subscriptions to CarpeYoga.com and Carpe Yoga merchandise, to family photo shoots and two original watercolor paintings.
  • My budget would afford me the ability to create this product at an extremely high standard. If I do not reach my goal, I will work harder and run a second campaign!


The Impact

  • CarpeYoga.com will bring inspiring, quality yoga classes to everyman.
  • Classes will be affordable and convenient.
  • More humans doing yoga means healthier, happier, friendlier, calmer, stronger, sexier, more flexible do-gooders. We need those.


Risks & Challenges

Really good film making is not an easy feat. In order to tackle it, I have practiced by filming outdoor yoga classes for myself for the past two years. This has developed in me a strong sense of the style and quality that I now envision for CarpeYoga.com.

Being original, specific and inspiring is a challenge that all yoga instructors face. I have  been practicing yoga since 2007 and received a one-on-one teacher training in 2013 from a yogi I consider to be the best of the best. I have since been teaching privates and studio classes, which has helped me solidify a strong teaching practice in good preparation for CarpeYoga.com.


Other Ways You Can Support

  • For those of you who are unable to support CarpeYoga.com financially, you can help spread the word  and make some noise about this campaign, the reward for which is an inscription on the CarpeYoga.com Hall Of Fame! When you share, tag the campaign (#CarpeYoga) so that we can keep track and ensure your stardom! Just use the Indiegogo share tools and you're good to go.

Let's go out there and get us some support!

story:
Unexpectedly Louise has been diagnosed with pancreatic cancer  and is trying a variety of approaches that resulted in reducing the growth of the tumour.

Louise has practiced and taught acupuncture and massage therapy and believes in Natural Health Care . Her services over the years have helped heal many others  but now it is our time to help her.

Your contribution will be used to continue with treatment and purchase the needed equipment which is maintaining her quality of life. 
Your help  will enable these treatments to continue.

Please  consider a donation and share this request for support to others .

Louise's story
I was diagnosed on October 30, 2014 with a very aggressive non operable stage 4 pancreatic cancer. Chemotherapy was my only option. After 12 rounds of treatment my tumor shrunk by almost half. The results are positive, but unfortunately it left me with a lot of nerve damage.

While undergoing chemotherapy I added holistic treatments. I believe they are working for me as my original eight week chemo break was recently extended. Although the tumor showed a slight increase in size and mild spreading after eight weeks, it was felt I was well enough to wait until the end August for more follow up tests. I continue to do these complementary treatments and have recently added Far Infar Red Saunas.

My osteopath suggested trying electrotherapy for the nerve damage and the viruses associated with cancer.
After extensive research I discovered when the immune system is not strong it allows the viruses to grow and mutate. Electrotherapy ('Frequency Therapy' ) is often used in Europe to kill the viruses associated with cancer rather than drugs. To be effective the treatment should be done twice daily. At present I am able to do this therapy four times a week at the home of a colleague who has graciously offered to give me use of his equipment.

We are doing a fundraiser to purchase this equipment and continue the therapy daily at home.
This is a very difficult thing for me to do, to ask for help.

Thank you for your support
Louise Danieli

story: By the end of the year 2013, after her wedding, my sister Olga Ulinici (Haretonenco) was diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia at only 25. The wish to have a happy and healthy family, to become a mother, to have kids and enjoy life… all that was gone… Two years of treatment for leukemia at The Institute of Oncology from Chisinau, Republic of Moldova remained without any positive results. We felt that the world in crumbling, because when someone you love has such a disease, you share the pain, the suffering and the hopes, but none of us was going to give up. So on 8 July 2015 she was hospitalized in the Clinical Institute Fundeni in Bucharest Romania, at the Center of hematology and bone marrow transplantation. We have put all our hope and found there a rescue and acure for Olga. The doctors have taken the decision to save my sisters life and we are very grateful for being given such a chance. I was ready to do anything for her – my sister, my best friend, my childhood adventure partner, my support and my role model. We were blessed and the results of the analysis of my stem cell research were good, it turned out that I am a 100% compatible donor, so Olga can get a transplantation of the bone marrow from me. I remembered seeing her on her wedding day – how beautiful and happy she was. How she hold her husband’s hand, dreaming of a life she now might never have. I remembered her telling me about the plans that they made together - having a boy and a girl, a nice, cosy home, succeeding as a good jurist, as she is tremendously talented. But the disease stole it all from her. It was the best news in the world for our family and Olga’s husband, but soon we found that stem cell transplantation is a complicated and risky procedure and a very expensive at the same time. In the previous years our family has not only sleepless nights, but also incurred huge expenses. We can’t afford this procedure on our own. Olga is not a Romanian citizen, so she doesn’t have a medical insurance that could have covered at least some expenses. All I want is to bring back Olga’s smile and now it is possible, but I can’t do it on my own. I need help… I need your help. Saving Olga, you will not only save a young woman, you will save us – her family, her future children, her friends and all other people in her life she influenced in a good way and inspired. We believe… We hope

story:
What is Prompt?

Prompt is an initiative to start a conversation about mental health in the tech community, and today we are excited to be part of the Travis Foundation, a not-for-profit organization dedicated to improving Open Source for everyone.

Mental Health in Tech is an issue most people would prefer not to recognize.  People in tech, which includes developers, designers, sys admins - everyone under the tech umbrella - are one of the highest career group to be effected by Mental Health issues.  These issues can include depression, anxiety, eating disorders, ADD/ADHD, bipolar, or a myriad of other issues.  Yet, for some reason, we often stigmatize having issues with our brains.  People in tech don't want to admit there are issues being ignored.  Instead of going away, ignoring the issues had meant the loss of people who could have been helped.

Mental Health is a delicate subject.  People involved in the tech sector generally try to solve their own problems instead of seeking much needed help.  We want to open the door and say it's okay to have issues and it's okay to reach out for help.  Many people are suffering in silence and they don't need to.

The goal is simple: take speakers who talk about mental health from various perspectives and give them money so they can do just that. On top of that, offering support and coaching for speakers, as well as helping organizations get in touch with speakers on the topics surrounding Mental Health as it applies to workers in the Technology field.

What We Need & What You Get

While Prompt was created under the tutelage of Eamon Leonard and the Community Team at Engine Yard, it has grown much larger than one company.

  • We need funding to get our speakers to conferences.
  • Helping out helps out all of the tech community.
  • Funds are focused on travel costs and accommodations for our speakers to go where they are needed.  

The Impact

To get an understanding of Prompt and how it works, take a look at this panel from Distill 2014 featuring the first four Prompt speakers discussing their issues.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get involved!!  If you can't contribute, invite a speaker to your event, or ask us for help to learn how to speak about an issue you have had that you are overcoming.

story:
Short Summary

"I want to make handSteady affordable and available" Chris Peacock - Inventor

A successful campaign will allow me to place a much larger factory order dramatically reducing the price of handSteady to £15 per cup (approx $23 US), bringing the joy of a comfortable, hot and safe cuppa within reach of the elderly, seniors and thousands of people with Essential Tremor, Multiple Sclerosis (MS) symptoms, Arthritis, wrist weakness, Stroke, Muscular Dystrophy, Parkinson's, MND and other conditions.

US NBC News highlights the passion behind the handSteady invention.

"I always admired great design and the challenge of a family member suffering Parkinson's inspired me to gain an Industrial Design Engineering Masters at the Royal College of Art where I invented the handSteady solution, supported by Guys and St. Thomas's Charity", Chris Peacock

  
Hundreds of happy handSteady customers, charities, support organisations and the papers love it!




What We Need & What You Get

Well it's really simple, a successful campaign will allow me to place a much larger factory order bringing the price right down from £40 to £15! So, by supporting the campaign you will ensure that many, many more people benefit from handSteady at an affordable price.

Our PERKS offer you the first ever handSteady cups at the new, lower price of £15 - Better than half price!! (available elsewhere at £40).

Not only can you obtain a new low price handSteady for yourself or a loved one, maybe as the perfect gift promise for Mothers Day, but how about the ultimate gift of Tea at The Ritz with your own handSteady cup for you or a group of 7 friends and the inventor Chris Peacock, or a super generous gift of handSteady cups to your local care home or favourite charity who could distribute handSteady to their members?

Please feel free to ask any questions about the Perks or the Campaign.


The Impact

Great news, the more we overfund our target, the more people will once again enjoy a hot cuppa safely and without pain. 

"It’s really good. I have limited dexterity and swallowing difficulties. I like the handle because I can put all of my fingers into it and it doesn’t drop." Vincent, Norwich

"All the participants who had used handSteady regularly felt that it offered a beneficial alternative to a static traditional mug handle" Health Design & Technology Institute independent trial finding


Risks & Challenges

If we don't hit our target I will still deliver the promised handSteady perks as we have to many, many satisfied customers to date. 

"On this you have my word, trackrecord and testimonials or a Full Money Back Guarantee protecting you from non-delivery", Chris Peacock, Inventor
Please feel free to ask any questions about the Perks or the Campaign.


Next Steps & Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help please select from the amazing Perks on offer and look forward to a confirmation email and delivery within the timescales promised.

Even if you are unable to contribute to our campaign please tell anybody you know and use the Social Media share buttons to help more people enjoy a hot cuppa, safely and without pain.

We welcome any questions you may have.

Also, we really appreciate those who support us through the thank you pledges and we will draw 10 thank you perk pledges out of a hat and give them or a friend a handSteady cup - with our compliments!

Thank you so much for reading and taking an interest in handSteady, Chris Peacock

story:
One People. One Aim. One Destiny.

Camp Pumziko is a national camp that serves multi-gendered youth ages six through seventeen and is a program of Community Aid Development (CAD), the New Afrikan People's Organization and the Malcolm X Grassroots Movement. The activities offered teach political, cultural and historical subjects while incorporating outdoor camping skills. CAD’s Camp Pumziko has been training youth for twenty years to become activists in their respective communities.  Because the coordinators are veteran liberation movement activists themselves, the young people gain a unique insight into the Civil Rights Movement and the subsequent movements, allowing them to analyze the strengths and challenges of individuals and organizations.

We are members of the Community Aid Development (CAD) New Afrikan People's Organization (NAPO), the Malcolm X Grassroots Movement (MXGM), New Afrikan Scout Organization (NASO) and activists in our communities that teach our youth about wilderness survival, self-determination and sustainability of culture and community from an African-centered perspective, all while having fun! Our staff of volunteers fly and drive in from around the nation to support the consistency and growth of our camp.

A vast majority of our campers rely on donations and sponsorship from the community to get them to camp. Our entire staff consists of volunteers and a large number of them take off a week from work in order to attend camp.

That's Why We Need You!

Our goal is $5,000. That amount covers half of the administrative costs including space, activities, supplies, equipment and food. The camp is fully staffed with volunteers and we have children come from cities around the nation. We have had children and staff attend from Georgia, Mississippi, Louisiana, Texas, Alabama, Michigan, California, Connecticut, NY and more.

Your donations will help us rent a host camp facility, purchase insurance for the week of camp, buy supplies for activities, procure food and provide scholarships to campers with financial need.

If we are unable to reach our goal, we will still be able to offer some scholarships to campers in need.

How You Can Help!

We want to encourage donations of any amount! We appreciate the words of encouragement that have come and the support of donations big and small. To let you know how much your contribution is appreciated, we offer small incentives as our thanks. The groups at camp are separated into ages by these names, Pakas (6-8 yrs), Chuis (9 and 10 yrs), Simbas (11 and 12 yrs) and Panthers (13-17 yrs). Our perks reflect our age groups and include notable mentions, photos, t-shirts and scrapbooks.

Even if you can’t contribute with a monetary donation, you can still help by spreading the word on your social network pages, via email and word of mouth using the Indiegogo share tools on this page.

Visit us on our website at www.cadnational.org or on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/CampPumziko

story:
Description

Transnational Medicine is a Network of Doctors who provide medical care for people without an insurance and a local passport or visa, free of charge.
The network provides rapid access to informations on the location and availability of medical services without the fear of prosecution.

Medical issues and the need of medical care can happen to everyone, everyday. This includes people who had to flee from their country, recently moved to another one, lost their jobs or lost everything and are living on the streets. To be totally honest it can happen to anybody. This is why Transnational Medicine is providing free of charge information and medical care for these persons. 

Please care about this issue and share this!

How you can help

Here are some points how you can get active and help us and others:

  • You can become a part of our network if you are a doctor, pharmacists, psychologist or a medical professional.
  • You can donate food, clothes, medical supplies and medical instruments.
  • Everything you donate goes directly into specific projects all around Europe.
  • Last but not least you can donate money. We have an efficiency unseen in other  NGOs. Out of every Euro you donate, 96 cent go directly to a specific project.

How your donation helps

Ok, so lets see what will happen with your money:

  • It goes directly to a project in Europe. 
  • It will pay the hard costs for the medical treatment of refugees, immigrants without medical insurance, homeless people and other humans in need.
  • One of our next main projects will be the medical relief for refugees of IS in northern Irak and Syria and at the southern border of Turkey.

Challenges and Opportunities

Through our network of doctors, pharmacists, psychologists and medical professionals we provide the medical treatment for persons in need. Your money is mainly used for this standing project. Here your money can change the life of humans very directly and profound.

  • For the planed projects your money and other donations, will be used in refugee camps to provide most needed medical aid.
  • One of the future projects will be at the refugee camps for Yazidi, Christians, Moslems and every other refugee group in Turkey, northern Irak and northern Syria.

Other ways to support us

Here are some ways you can help us:

  • Share this campaign with your friends, family and coworkers.
  • Use the tool from IndieGoGo.
  • Share this on Facebook, Twitter, your own Homepage, to the press and other social networks.
  • Tell your doctor about our network, and explain to him that his expenses will be paid when he treats a person in need.
  • Go to our website: www.transnational-medicine.org

Thank you for your support. We and the humans you support love you!
story_txt:
Description 
Transnational Medicine is a Network of Doctors who provide medical care for people without an insurance and a local passport or visa, free of charge.The network provides rapid access to informations on the location and availability of medical services without the fear of prosecution.
Medical issues and the need of medical care can happen to everyone, everyday. This includes people who had to flee from their country, recently moved to another one, lost their jobs or lost everything and are living on the streets. To be totally honest it can happen to anybody. This is why Transnational Medicine is providing free of charge information and medical care for these persons. Please care about this issue and share this!
   
How you can help
 Here are some points how you can get active and help us and others:  You can become a part of our network if you are a doctor, pharmacists, psychologist or a medical professional. You can donate food, clothes, medical supplies and medical instruments. Everything you donate goes directly into specific projects all around Europe.
Last but not least you can donate money. We have an efficiency unseen in other  NGOs. Out of every Euro you donate, 96 cent go directly to a specific project.    How your donation helps Ok, so lets see what will happen with your money:  It goes directly to a project in Europe.  It will pay the hard costs for the medical treatment of refugees, immigrants without medical insurance, homeless people and other humans in need. One of our next main projects will be the medical relief for refugees of IS in northern Irak and Syria and at the southern border of Turkey.    Challenges and Opportunities  Through our network of doctors, pharmacists, psychologists and medical professionals we provide the medical treatment for persons in need. Your money is mainly used for this standing project. Here your money can change the life of humans very directly and profound.  For the planed projects your money and other donations, will be used in refugee camps to provide most needed medical aid. One of the future projects will be at the refugee camps for Yazidi, Christians, Moslems and every other refugee group in Turkey, northern Irak and northern Syria.    Other ways to support us Here are some ways you can help us:  
Share this campaign with your friends, family and coworkers. Use the tool from IndieGoGo.
Share this on Facebook, Twitter, your own Homepage, to the press and other social networks.

Tell your doctor about our network, and explain to him that his expenses will be paid when he treats a person in need.
Go to our website: www.transnational-medicine.org
   Thank you for your support. We and the humans you support love you!

story:
When a child loses a loved one to cancer, their world changes forever.

They may feel angry, sad, confused, and above all else, alone.

CancerCare’s free Healing Hearts Family Bereavement Camp allows families who have experienced the loss of a loved one to cancer to come together for a weekend retreat. Each year, families spend three days at a working dude ranch in the beautiful Poconos. Fun activities like swimming, horseback riding, and fishing are combined with therapeutic grief activities led by CancerCare professional oncology social workers.

“The camp is a place where the families can come together and not feel different,” explains CancerCare’s Claire Grainger, LCSW. “The kids meet others who have experienced a similar loss and they don’t have to explain anything to one another…There are a lot of tears, but there is also so much laughter. They’ve all found new friends – people that understand.”

Less than three months after losing her husband Tom to cancer, Jenny and her daughter signed up for the camp. Jenny shares, “I was nervous about going since our loss was still so raw, but we’ve now attended the Camp for the past four years and it really means so much to us to be with others who have experienced a similar loss. It is a wonderful way for all of us to be together to honor our loved ones. We know that everyone there understands how we feel and we’re safe to cry or laugh with no fear, no judgment.”

Like all of CancerCare’s services, the Healing Hearts Family Bereavement Camp is offered to families completely free of charge. That’s why we need your support to help us offer the camp to even more families who have lost a loved one to cancer.

  • A gift of $10 can help us buy marshmallows for the kids to enjoy by campfire.

  • A donation of $25 can provide a family of four with enough art supplies to last the entire weekend.

  • A gift of $36 can pay for an hour of line-dancing lessons (taught by a real cowboy!).

  • A $100 contribution can give a family of 4 an hour of horseback riding.

  • And a donation of $1,000 will cover all expenses for a family of four to attend the camp.

Even if you can’t make a donation at this time, we encourage you to help share our campaign with your friends and colleagues. There are a few ways to do this, including:

  • Copying the campaign URL and paste it into an email or social media update

  • Click on the Facebook, Google Plus or Twitter icons to share through your social media networks

Or add a widget to your blog or personal website. (Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code.)

story:
Lemon Sole is amazing - Help us get it on the market by pre-ordering some.

  • It is the first 100% natural spray designed to keep shoes fresh and a healthy environment for feet.
  • Six essential oils with properties your feet will love: Antibacterial - Antiseptic - Antifungal - Anti-inflamatory 
  • It smells really great - So will your feet and shoes.
We stuff our feet in shoes every day without a care, especially when doing sport. To date there hasn't been a product that cares for them both. Lemon Sole does and in a completely natural way.

How often do you stop wearing your favourite sports shoes because of the smell?  Lemon Sole lets you stay friends for longer. 
We are doing this campaign to raise the money for the first production run  - and all you have to do is buy some!
Click on the Perks to get Lemon Sole.  There are some great gifts available too. 
To find out more go to www.lemon-sole.com
The story:

I didn't set out to create Lemon Sole. I discovered that it was something that needed creating almost by accident, and rapidly became passionate about it and excited by the concept. A smelly training shoe changed my life.

I realised that whilst we regularly strap our feet into all different types of trainer and shoes, we really don't do much to look after them.  Especially with the pounding they get. And then we are surprised or annoyed when our feet and shoes get smelly or worse, get an infection like athletes foot. 


How many times have you thrown out trainers not because they are worn out but because they are too smelly?  Or been embarrassed to take them off in company. It need not be that way.

Lemon Sole is a 100% natural spray made with essential oils that is great for feet and helps keep shoes smelling fresh.

The story started on my honeymoon. My wife was a little upset that her favourite shoes were gaining too much of their own personality and might need throwing out; I had to agree, there were six weeks of close quarters living out of backpacks ahead of us. We were in a spa hotel that week and there were various natural oils and such like around us. In an attempt to improve the shoes, I sprayed some of the good smelling liquids into them. As you would expect they smelt better but that was just the start.


They stayed smelling not just better, but good and not for a couple of days but for our entire six week adventure through Thailand, Laos and Cambodia in hot, humid tropical conditions. And having also given my own shoes the same treatment our honeymoon was free of any smelly shoe induced stresses!

When back in the UK I tried to find products on the market that I could buy that would have the same amazing effect on our feet and shoes and I drew a blank. I drew a blank everywhere. That was when I knew it needed creating - and that is what I have done.

After much work researching the properties of a huge range of natural ingredients with properties that would benefit foot health (and keep shoes fresh) and after many test formulations, we have arrived at something we think is very special.

We are running this campaign to raise awareness of the product and pre-sell a portion of our initial production run. This way we will know that we have enough customers waiting to give us confidence to proceed with that all exciting product launch.

What ever your activity; from running to regular walks in the park, to more extreme pursuits we hope you'll want to support us and get hold of this fantastic new product.

To find out more go to our website: www.lemon-sole.com.

story:
2 Red Wines Supporting Prostate Cancer Research

The Basics:

I (Winemaker Bob) started small volume wine making in 2007 to indulge a long-time passion for wine, producing the award-winning Zinpiphany© Zinfandel and Rhone-styled #2red.  Passion changed to purpose after a pair of "normal" prostate biopsies to evaluate an elevate PSA were then followed by the diagnose of incurable prostate cancer. Determined to make the best of the situation, I created the Robert and Susan Hollander Foundation, an IRS approved 501c3 non-profit in support of prostate cancer research.  Since then, all proceeds from my wine making efforts at 2redWinery have been committed to supporting prostate cancer research through the Foundation. Help me continue my efforts with the 2015 vintage, producing great wines for you in support of prostate cancer research.

The Campaign:

By helping me make my next two barrels of wine with your tax-deductible support, you can secure wines from the 2015 vintage or from my award-winning wine library while supporting prostate cancer research.
My motivation is simple:
  1. To produce more awesome wine for you;
  2. To support prostate cancer research.
About 3 million men are living in America right now with prostate cancer and about 28000 will die this year.  This campaign will allow me to continue the pursuit of something I love while helping someone you may know.

What I Need, What You Get & What I Do

All proceeds above my anticipated wine makings costs of $16,000 for the two barrels are committed to the Foundation and prostate cancer research.  The Foundation currently operates with an expense rate of 0.0% (I pay the costs.)  You get the wine (see Perks).  I get the satisfaction of making wine and doing something useful.  In the two fiscal years the Foundation has been operational, we have made annual gifts with recipients including clinical investigators at MD Anderson and the Cleveland Clinic.  Both wines, from the first vintage in 2007 and onward have been award winners in competition:

  • 2007 Zinpiphany, 2012 SF International Wine Competition – Silver Medal

  • 2008 Zinpiphany, 2012 SF International Wine Competition – Double Gold

  • 2008 Zinpiphany, 6th Annual American Fine Wine Competition - Silver Medal

  • 2009 Zinpiphany, 2012 SF International Wine Competition – Silver Medal

  • 2010 Zinpiphany, 2013 SF International Wine Competition – Gold Medal

  • 2010 Zinpiphany, 2014 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition - Silver Medal

  • 2011 Zinpiphany, 2014 SF International Wine Competition - Bronze Medal

  • 2007 Syrah, 2012 SF International Wine Competition – Bronze Medal

  • 2008 Syrah, 2012 SF International Wine Competition – Bronze Medal

  • 2009 Syrah, 6th Annual American Fine Wine Competition - Silver Medal

  • 2009 Syrah, 2012 SF International Wine Competition – Bronze Medal

  • 2009 Syrah, 2014 NY World Wine & Spirits Competition - Double Gold, BEST OF CLASS!

  • 2010 Syrah, 2013 SF International Wine Competition – Gold Medal

  • 2011 Syrah, 2014 SF International Wine Competition - Silver Medal

The video clip shows me tasting the bottled 2012 Zinpiphany for the first time.  It was Zinpiphanitic.  I am proud and pleased with all of my wines, including those not yet entered in competition.

The Perks
Like wine futures,  you can secure wine from the upcoming 2015 vintage.  I will be offering single bottles, mixed two-packs, half-case/6 bottles and full cases of Zinpiphany and #2red. In addition, because of the longevity and age-ability of the #2red, can you secure magnums (1.5L, equal to two standard bottles) and the ever impressive 3L jeroboam.  The just bottled 2013 #2red will also be available in big bottles.  For those of you with immediate gratification needs, you can select from my existing wine library, including some of the wines listed above.


Timeline:

Summer, 2015 - grapes grow and ripen
Fall, 2015 - harvest and crush of the 2015 grapes
Fall, 2015 - shipping of library wine perks once the weather cools
Late Fall/Early Winter, 2015 - fermentation
January, 2015 through February, 2017 - aging in oak
March, 2017, or so - blending of the 2015 Zinpiphany and #2red
Fall, 2017 - shipping of the 2015s with the cooler weather

Risks:

The California wine industry has been unusually reliable year after year, largely due to favorable weather, adequate rain and, when the rain is spotty, irrigation which still remains reliable.  Natural disasters remain a rare risk and wine-making disasters like a failed fermentation are possible, but events like these are unlikely.
Wine shipments are not possible to:  DE, KY, MS, OK, RI, SD, UT.
I can ship to PA, and AL but they must be shipped to a state store for your pick up.

story:
Short Summary

I am an autodidact who developed a successful career as a financial sales and marketing consultant. I also enjoy inventing, particularly products to improve human health.

A safe and secure water supply is one of the foremost problems facing the world's population. I have worked a number of years to refine and develop my filtration and structuring water supply system to address this. I have exhausted my available financial resources in product development, patenting, and intellectual property.

I want to achieve a worldwide distribution network to market our Wai Mana (water power) products. Our penultimate measure of success will be to divert up to 20% of profits towards educating disadvantaged children in each country holding a master distributorship.

What We Need & What You Get

Patent, which is currently on hold. As funds become available we will initiate tooling of the injection molding machine for manufacturing.  Our perks Includes an opportunity to receive a gift of 1 of 20 Wai Mana Domestic System valued at US@550.00 for contributions of the US$25.00 or US$50.00 or US$140.00 

See Gallery for 10 year full Replacement Warranty.  Up to 1 year interest free finance available on all models 

The Impact

The Wai Mana products are designed to provide the best water inline supply system available. You receive multiple benefits such as:- 1. Power savings by eliminating water scaling in pipes, water cylinders, and appliances; 2. Soften water cleans with using far less detergents. 3. Testimonials from trialed users mention how soft and silky their skin and hair feels after bathing in water that flows through our system: 4. Most importantly it provides beautiful, clear water to drink from every tap in your supply system!

Risks & Challenges

As I have invested significant time and money to date, if I can secure sufficient funding to bring this product to market I don't envisage any issues that I have not already planned for. The more money that is invested the faster I can progress to manufacturing stage. 

We already have people interested in master distributorships in five other countries, subject to a contractual arrangement on or before completion of tooling.

The testimonials speak for themselves!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute please support by spreading the word (you can use Indiegogo share tools).

story:
Who are METU Hippogriffs?

We are the first Quidditch Team of Turkey founded at Middle East Technical University. We were also part of METU Dragons team who got the 3rd place at "Tournoi international de la violette" hosted by Toulouse Muggle Quidditch in Toulouse, France, We are the top team in Turkish League now with the inivincible title. 

Unfourtunately we could not attend EQC due to financial reasons, now we are eager and ready to be a competitive team in the tournament Barcelona Moustaches Time. We want to conquer Barcelona, we will bring our Moustaches too :)


Why do we need your help?

We come from a galaxy far far way and our team composed of mostly students. Since we are not part of the European Union, visa fees and travel costs are excessively high for us. Besides, since 1€ is 3 Turkish Liras, currency exchange rates are not in our side.  Here is the approximate costs for travelling from Ankara to Barcelona:

Travel costs (return included):

Bus ticket from Ankara to İstanbul: 42€

Plane ticket from İstanbul to Barcelona: 250€

Visa Costs(compulsory for everyone):

Spanish Visa for Turkish Citizens: 60€

Accomodation and Tournament Costs:

 2 nights at Hostel and Tournament Fee: 82€

Total Minimum Cost per player: 434€ 

We want to challenge Europe with our full squad, We can still come if we could have 3000 € from this campaign.

"Help will always be given at Hogwarts to those who ask for it."

We have seen such great hospitality from our European Quidditch friends in the past, we know quidditch community is family. We are coming to rock Barcelona but we need your help. Small or big your contribution is very important for us, your precious help will be always remembered.
Perks:
Free Hugs for Everyone who help us in our way to Barcelona!

"Thank you, post cards"

"Wonderful bracelets"

Hair Bands

"Collectors only"

Hippogriffs: "We Fly like an Eagle, Drink like a Horse!" 


"You know you want it, get them now with your name on, while you still can"

"These hoodies are so fluffy, oh my god!"

Other Ways You Can Help

We know you are already spending to tournaments as well, it would be nice if you could make at least a small contribution, if not you can always share our indiegogo campaign from your social network accounts. 

There are free hugs for everyone who contributes to our campaign or who helps us to share it to more people.

    Other Ways You Can Help We know you are already spending to tournaments as well, it would be nice if you could make at least a small contribution, if not you can always share our indiegogo campaign from your social network accounts. 
There are free hugs for everyone who contributes to our campaign or who helps us to share it to more people.

story:
Scroll down for English


20 september wordt voor mij het begin van mijn tweede carrière als voetballer. Na in mijn jeugd wat jaren gevoetbald te hebben mag ik van de artsen weer gaan voetballen. Onder 1 strikte voorwaarde: bescherming voor mijn ICD.

Die ICD heb ik in 2007 gekregen nadat ik hartritmestoornissen bleek te hebben. Inmiddels heb ik mijn tweede ICD. Dat ik nu een ICD heb komt omdat ik bij mijn geboorte een hartafwijking bleek te hebben. Deze transpositie van de grote vaten hebben ze toen ik 6 weken oud was, we praten over april 1985, operatief behandeld. Iets dat toen nog erg risicovol was. Maar niet ingrijpen was sowieso geen optie. Hierdoor vielen veel dromen al meteen in duigen. Want echt 100% zo sporten als andere lukte me nooit. Maar verder valt er best goed mee te leven. En ook met de ICD is best te leven alleen het niet mogen karten en mogen voetballen blijft erg vervelend. Maar in dat laatste komt dus verandering. Er is immers inmiddels bescherming.

Dat die bescherming, een Pace-Pro, er is weet ik sinds een paar weken dankzij St. Hartekind. Ik las een artikel in de STIN , een blad voor ICD/Pacemaker dragers, over Kian een joch van dertien met een pacemaker. Hij voetbalde ‘gewoon’ waar ik het niet mocht van mijn artsen. Ze waren immers bang dat een bal, ploeggenoot of tegenstander de ICD of de draden zou beschadigen. In een kolom stond uitgelegd dat Stichting Hartekind zorg droeg voor Pace-Pro’s voor kinderen. Voor meer informatie nam ik contact met hen op. En na diverse berichtjes heen en weer en contact met mijn arts kwam er groen licht om te voetballen. Hiervoor zal ik wel een Pace-Pro moeten aanschaffen. Iets dat mijn verzekeraar niet dekt.

En weer schoot Hartekind te hulp. Ze rijden 20 september mee met de Dam tot Dam fietsclinic (http://www.damtotdamfietsclassic.nl/)  om geld voor kinderen die een Pace-Pro nodig hebben op te halen. Ik heb na een paar nachtjes slapen besloten mij aan te sluiten en de 40 KM mee te fietsen om mijn eigen Pace-Pro te betalen. Al het geld dat ik meer inzamel gaat uiteraard naar Hartekind voor kinderen die er ook 1 nodig hebben.

De Pace-Pro is een persoonlijke pacemaker/ICDbeschermer die voorkomt dat de pacemaker beschadigd raakt of dat een draad breekt waardoor een kind opnieuw geopereerd moet worden, met alle eventuele risico’s van dien. Met een Pace-Pro kunnen deze kinderen dus wèl gewoon spelen en sporten. Het op maat laten maken van één Pace-Pro kost ongeveer 900 euro.

https://www.livit.nl/nl-nl/catalog/orthopedie/pace_pro.aspx

Over aangeboren hartafwijkingen en Stichting Hartekind

Jaarlijks worden er ongeveer 1.500 kinderen in Nederland geboren met een aangeboren hartafwijking (1 op de 100 baby's). Er zijn meer dan 40 verschillende typen aangeboren hartafwijkingen, van relatief mild tot zeer ernstig en levensbedreigend waarbij kinderen vaak direct al na de geboorte risicovolle openhartoperaties moeten ondergaan en vaak lange tijd in het ziekenhuis verblijven. Meer dan 50% van de kinderen zal tenminste 1 (open)hartoperatie moeten ondergaan. Bijna 50% van de kinderen met een gecompliceerde hartafwijking heeft een verstandelijke en/of motorische beperking met ontwikkelingsproblematiek en 25% gaat naar speciaal onderwijs.

Per jaar overlijden er in Nederland ongeveer 100 kinderen aan een aangeboren hartafwijking maar dat is al 30% lager dan in het begin van de jaren 90. Vroeger groeide maar 25% van deze kinderen op. Nu is meer dan 85%.

Over Stichting Hartekind

Stichting Hartekind is in 2008 opgericht en de enige fondsenwervende organisatie die zich alleen inzet voor onderzoek naar aangeboren hartafwijkingen. Wij zetten ons in voor de brede groep Hartekinderen. Zo zijn er de jongste patiëntjes en hun ouders, die zich door de schok van de diagnose in een chaotische situatie bevinden en behoefte hebben aan meer informatie en lotgenotencontact. Of de jongeren die, zelfs als hun medische situatie stabiliseert, toch moeite kunnen hebben met dingen die voor andere kinderen heel gewoon zijn, zoals opleiding of sporten.

Onze doelstellingen zijn betere medische kansen te bieden voor Hartekinderen en het verbeteren van de dagelijkse situatie van Hartekinderen waarbij de kwaliteit van leven centraal staat. Dit willen we bereiken door het stimuleren en financieren van relevant (medisch) onderzoek en het (onder)steunen van projecten en initiatieven om de kwaliteit van leven van Hartekinderen te verbeteren. De Pace-Pro is zo’n initiatief wat helaas niet vergoed wordt door de zorgverzekeraar.


ENGLISH

September 20th will be the start of my second career as a football player. After playing football for several years when I was young I have permission from my doctors to start again. Under 1 strict condition: protection for my ICD.

I got this ICD in 2007 after it became clear I had cardiac arrhythmia. As we speak I am on my second ICD. I need an ICD because I was born with a heart condition. I was operated on my transposition of the great arteries when I was 6 weeks old, this was in April 1985. Back then this operation was extremely risky, but not performing it has never been an option. Because of this operation a lot of potential dream got crushed already. I would never be able to play sports for 100% like others, but other than that living with the condition wasn’t too bad. The ICD hasn’t changed that, but not being able to go karting or play football remained shitty. But the latter will change now that there is protection available.

This protection comes in the form of a Pace-Pro; a contraption tailored specifically to the person which will protect the wearers ICD or pacemaker from direct impact, making it safe(r) to play sports in which there is a risk of impact. The existence of the Pace-Pro was brought to my attention by Hartekind, a foundation that is devoted to enable children that were born with a heart condition to live their lives as normal as possible.

On September 20th I will be cycling a 40 km track for the foundation to raise money for not just my own Pace-Pro, but for at least 1 more for a child that needs one as well. The costs for a Pace-Pro are about €900 and most health insurance companies do not cover the expenses for this useful piece of equipment.

story:
The early detection of Diabetes

 

Hello Crowfunding comunity!

My name is David Navarro, and I am part of an investigation team of Navarra, trying to publish our thesis.

We are researching about early biological markers of Type 2 diabetes and Cardiovascular disease. The prevalence of type 2 diabetes  is increasing worldwide, leading  as a global epidemic due to its complications. Who doesn´t know a family member with diabetes or a cardiovascular disease?

Novel markers are needed to identify individuals in high risk to develop those diseases... And we are working on it...

But we are "stuck" with the publishing fees of medical newspapers...

Did you know that to publish in the main medical newspapers authors have to pay from 500-5000$?  So your work could be "open access" to everybody!


What we need..

We need 2000$ to pay the fee taxes of publishing, so our work could be free for the rest of the  scientific community, and people in general!

  • You will receive a copy of the article, our photo thanking you contribution, and your name will be read in our thesis defense, in front of the scientific community!
  • If we do not get all the money, we would pay the rest to publish our work.


What you will receive


  • A copy of the manuscript
  • Our photo!
  • The video of the thesis defense, where your name will be raised!


What is the different forms of publishing?



Open Access (OA) stands for unrestricted access and unrestricted reuse. Most publishers own the rights to the articles in their journals. Anyone who wants to read the articles must pay to access them. The idea to dissipate the information, at large, has been a tedious task and requires inputs from the diverse community at every stage of its processing. The prime objective is to make the research visible and freely accessible to each and every individual, beyond social and economic and geographic barriers.

story:
• Race Bio Posted by the Race To Alaska Committee 

  •  (human or wind powered vessels)


"Before Team Serendipity entered the race, when we imagined who we want to be in mur 60s our short list included the words “alive”, “retired” and “tolerably good at bridge”. Then Team Serendipity applied for the R2AK and our list is now lies in the bottom of the recycling bin, a crumpled up ball of college-ruled shame. Team Serendipity is comprised of two 60+ year old organic farmers who are revisiting their lifetime of watery achievement and entering the R2AK to promote healthy, muscle powered sports for those over 60. We are a jaded bunch, but the R2AK crew is notably impressed. Not only are they 60 plus and farming, they are going to row- like the whole 750 miles, wind or no. All of it. This isn’t some naive venture from people hoping to reclaim lost opportunities from their youth, these folks have been there, done that, sheared the sheep, spun the yarn, woven and then sold the t-shirt." ( R2AK Race Bio)

Why We Are We Doing This?  (A Question We keep Asking Ourselves)

Ok, so we’re a couple of so called old duffers out for a rowing adventure. Well ,perhaps we are, but we don’t feel old– don’t have a desire to play golf or cards, we just want to row to Ketchikan and then on to Juneau ( another mere 300 miles) to visit my son. The trouble is when we signed up for this race, we thought it would be great to travel with a group, have coast guard support and be a part of a group of other old water dogs traveling in any kind of a floating contraption to Alaska. We scraped up the money to buy the boat ( Biscuit Girl has made the trip once) traded a years worth of produce for part of the price, figured since we are old Northwestern sailors we would have a lot of the equipment. We have both sailed the route a number of times and know the good bad and ugly of the Inside Passage. In fact, with the cumulative misadventures in that area it surprises both of us that we want to go. However, when you have grown up on the water and traveled the inside passage, there is an allure that keeps drawing you back for more, thus, we signed up anyway. Now we come to find out a great number of the contestants are young professional, very well funded Adventure Racing Teams. I just keep reminding them of the story of the “Tortoise and the Hare”.


Our Celebration and Goals

We have a lot to celebrate on this journey. Kim is celebrating 10 years of being clean and sober. Chris is just celebrating her love of life, the salt water and good enough health to even think about such a journey– not to mention adult children and grandchildren who think it sounds like a grand adventure and say they would love to tag along. We also hope to be a model for young and old alike to follow, to embrace healthy living habits, and slow down enough to enjoy the natural beauty of the world around us. It is our hope that upon our return we can host rowing, cycling, hiking and sailing events off our farm that is situated sandwiched between Olympic National Park and Hood Canal in the hamlet of Quilcene, Washington.

This trip has proven to be far more expensive than a couple of organic farmers had in mind, we have invested over $7000 into it so far. We are committed to making the journey and are being encouraged by many who know us and our love for adventure. We are hoping that some of you would like to partner with us for the journey, maybe even to the point of coming to the farm for a rowing, cycling, hiking sailing adventure of your own.. We will outfit the trip or you can just experience a farm stay. Either way we will feed you the best organic farm fresh food ever. Serendipity Farm is not just close to the mountains and the water, it is 46 acres, of produce, horses and ponies, goats, chickens, dogs, small children wetlands and just good old fashioned farm fun. We have offered some perks that we hope you will partake in and we hope to have some of you as guests when we return from our row.

Where Will The Money You Contribute Go?

  1.  To purchase the balance of  safety gear needed to make the journey
  2.  To Help pay the young help we must hire to fill in while we are gone. We are of retirement age, but farmers do not seem to be able to retire- so we have to squeeze some adventure into our lives.
  3. To Help pay shipping the boat home from Alaska
  4. Any extra money will go into helping mentor the young farmers on our farm fund bee keeping and other projects of interest to them.

Thank you for contributing to our celebration adventure. We look forward to seeing all of you on the farm.

Photos of some of our Perks

Clover Day Sailor - Voo Doo

story:
ABOUT "APRICOT"

Even though much of the visible debris from the earthquake, tsunami and nuclear accident of March 2011 has been cleared away, there are still tender wounds remaining in the hearts and minds of many children and their families in Japan's Tohoku region. Whole family units, neighborhoods and entire communities were devastated by the event. This has forced hundreds of thousands of children, mothers and their families to live in temporary housing units. Among these are the more than 71,000 children and mothers who have been evacuated from Fukushima Prefecture's eastern districts. They have been scattered throughout Japan, many living separated from their fathers, grandparents and friends. In such unstable, impermanent and stressful circumstances children can be especially susceptible to intense anxiety, depression and in time PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Syndrome), the symptoms of which can take many years to manifest. Recent government surveys suggest 1 in 3 children in Tohoku are already suffering from mental health issues.

APRICOT (Allied Psychotherapy Relief Initiative for the Children of Tohoku) is a nonprofit fund supporting the ongoing efforts of Japan's mental health professionals working directly in the Tohoku Region to provide counseling relief services for children and their families who have been affected by the triple disasters. Our mission is to raise awareness and funding so these children and their families can receive the long-term mental health care they will need to ensure Tohoku recovers.

APRICOT is a 100% voluntary project, comprised of experienced Japanese and non-Japanese mental health professionals, as well as people from backgrounds as diverse as finance, business and media. Being 100% volunteer run, we don't take salaries. We don't take expenses. We do take all the goodwill and help we can get. All funds raised by APRICOT NPO go to registered mental health NPOs and other well-vetted organizations working in Tohoku to be used to support the mental health of children in the region. Recipient organizations include the disaster relief mental health committees of the Japan Society of Certified Clinical Psychologists (JSCCP) and Fukushima Society of Certified Clinical Psychologists (FSCPP).

Much still needs to be done in Tohoku both now and over the long term. The work of mental health professionals in the Tohoku region is aimed at healing and, as far as possible, preventing the onset of anxiety disorders, depression, PTSD and other illnesses that can develop in children during both short-term and long-term life events. APRICOT NPO is a movement dedicated to ensuring that children in Tohoku will have the support they need until each and every one of them reaches adulthood..

In such unstable, impermanent and stressful circumstances children can be especially susceptible to intense anxiety, depression and in time PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Syndrome), the symptoms of which can take many years to manifest. Recent government surveys suggest 1 in 3 children in Tohoku are already suffering from mental health issues.APRICOT (Allied Psychotherapy Relief Initiative for the Children of Tohoku) is a nonprofit fund supporting the ongoing efforts of Japan's mental health professionals working directly in the Tohoku Region to provide counseling relief services for children and their families who have been affected by the triple disasters. Our mission is to raise awareness and funding so these children and their families can receive the long-term mental health care they will need to ensure Tohoku recovers.APRICOT is a 100% voluntary project, comprised of experienced Japanese and non-Japanese mental health professionals, as well as people from backgrounds as diverse as finance, business and media. Being 100% volunteer run, we don't take salaries. We don't take expenses. We do take all the goodwill and help we can get. All funds raised by APRICOT NPO go to registered mental health NPOs and other well-vetted organizations working in Tohoku to be used to support the mental health of children in the region. Recipient organizations include the disaster relief mental health committees of the Japan Society of Certified Clinical Psychologists (JSCCP) and Fukushima Society of Certified Clinical Psychologists (FSCPP).Much still needs to be done in Tohoku both now and over the long term. The work of mental health professionals in the Tohoku region is aimed at healing and, as far as possible, preventing the onset of anxiety disorders, depression, PTSD and other illnesses that can develop in children during both short-term and long-term life events. APRICOT NPO is a movement dedicated to ensuring that children in Tohoku will have the support they need until each and every one of them reaches adulthood..

story:
Short Summary

At fifteen I became a vegetarian, cut my chemically straightened hair and never looked back. I was on a mission to learn everything I could about alternatives to the onslaught of chemical exposure in food and personal care products.

Of coarse this was much to the chagrin of my family and I was met with serious opposition and dismissal. Many of these toxic substances had come to be associated with privilege and civility and folks were none too excited to release them.

I had no idea that in 20 years or so there would be a mass exodus of women (and men) of color, who would say no to the toxic hair chemicals, skin lighteners and harmful personal care products that have plagued our lives and our health for so long.

If you had told me then that millions of women would embrace their unique curly kinky hair and their diverse complexions, I simply wouldn’t have believed you. But that day has come and I’m so proud to be part of this movement by providing you with natural alternatives for skin and hair care. 

I’m Nubian Flunder, the founder and formulator for The Healing Place Apothecary. The Apothecary produces a line of hand crafted hair and skin products made with natural ingredients rooted in a variety of traditional healing modalities. Born out of my private acupuncture and herbal medicine practice, these formulations are rooted in ancient holistic remedies from Africa, Asia and the Americas that have proven effective for healthy skin/hair.

The Apothecary launched in 2012 and it really excites me that this business has grown so, that I can no longer meet the ever-growing demand of online sales, local events, and wholesale inquiries alone. In short, I need a strong team to take this business to the next level of success as we scale up to meet the demand of our regional partners and customers.


www.thpapothecary.com

See How We Can Partner

I truly believe in community partnership and that we have everything we need right in our network. I am reaching out to you as a member of my personal network, extended community, and human family to ask for your support. I am raising $70,000 in seed money to begin building a small, but qualified, team of hard working and visionary associates over the  next nine months. They will cultivate and take this business to the next level of success through product development, administration, sales & marketing, production, fulfillment and customer service as the business scales up. It will provide jobs and experience to an under served community while stimulating the local economy.

To say THANK YOU for your supportive donation, I am offering you lots of goods and services that will support your wellness and give you the opportunity to get a hands on experience with these amazing products. Please look at all of the beautiful offerings in the column to the right. 

www.thpapothecary.com

Why You Should Care

This company is committed to using 95% natural ingredients and 80% environmentally friendly packaging. It is our vision to bring awareness to the immense benefits of natural beauty products and to shift the industry perspective to one that both cares about the health of the consumer and the environmental impacts while building and maintaining thriving brands.

The products are hand crafted locally in small batches to ensure freshness. Our long-term focus is regional wholesale distribution and as the company scales up production, this unique aspect will provide jobs and trade skills to local youth and young adults. Natural ingredients are sourced locally when available. I also partner with local organizations that offer services to young women and girls of color by providing them wellness education, tutorials, and sponsorship.


Risks & Challenges

As a product connoisseur, I can truly say that this line of products and excellent customer service is the real deal which has been demonstrated by review after review. My biggest challenge has been acquiring the funding needed to develop a quality team of professionals to take this project to the next level of success and beyond. I know that through community involvement and investment such as what I am doing here, I can and will overcome this hurdle. This was recently demonstrated when I was awarded the Small Producers Grant from Whole Foods Market Lafayette through an online community voting process that showed people want and need safe hair and skin care products. That $5,500 grant is being used to make products more "shelf" ready for larger retailers, salons and spa's. 

   

www.thpapothecary.com

Ways That You Can Support

Please support in the following areas.

1.  Share the campaign with your network of contacts

2.  Donate funds to the campaign

3. Donate a product or service to the campaign to be given as a gift. This is an excellent way to get some promotion for your product or service.

4.Partner with me to provide your product or service to donors. There are many ways that we can collaborate.

story:
Our Purpose: 

Our mission is to show the love of Christ by serving with the gifts that God has granted each of us.  Every year, as members of Church of Southland, we send a team of healthcare professionals to a remote part of Southwest China in the Yunnan Province to serve the indigenous Miao people.  Though the travel is strenuous consisting of over 30 hours in air flight, train, bus, and hiking with medical supplies to reach the mountainous area of their villages, the needs are great as healthcare is virtually inaccessible to them.  In the past years we have seen over 500 people in less then a week!  And our relationships and friendships have been blessed each year.

This year our team of volunteers consists of physicians, dentists, nurses, and an acupuncturist who will give their time and resources to serve the indigenous people for 14 days.

How to support:

This is our very first year reaching out to you for support.  For the past three years, we've been financing our own medical missions.   As you can imagine, sustaining medical missions like this does have a cost.   Our fundraising goal of $4,000 is to cover part of the cost for basic medical and dental supplies such as medications, vitamins, injections, IV, extraction equipment, transportation, and so forth.  Should there be funds available beyond our original goal, the remaining funds will be allocated to help cover others cost such as local transportation, meals and the campaign itself. 

We are very excited this summer to see what God has in store for our special group of volunteers and for the people we'll be serving and ministering to.  Please join us by partnering with us in providing healthcare to those in needs in remote parts of the world where God has not forgotten them.  

You can partner with us by clicking on the name of the person you would like to support with a minimum donation of $25.   Every dollar will be used to the fullest measure to help those in need.

Church of Southland is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization which means your donation is TAX DEDUCTIBLE!

Other ways you can participate: 

  • Join us in Praying for the people!
  • Indiegogo offers SHARE tools so you can SPREAD the word!

story:
Mental Health is a concern of all humanity, and it affects everyone, no matter where they are in the world. As the people open up, and more begin to talk about the scale and complexity of the impact of mental health on everyday life, one thing is missing; a dedicated media source that enables people to open up in deeper conversations as well as provide access to support, information and services around the globe.

Better Mental Health Magazine is here to fill that gap – as the only independent international consumer magazine dedicated to providing information for improving mental health & well-being.

We aim to raise awareness of general and specific mental health issues as well as ways of improving mental health and obtaining a greater sense of mental well-being.

This crowd-funding campaign has been created following the success of our launch; now we are ready to publish issue 4 of the magazine, but need your help to turn this magazine into a recognized well established resource.


Why a crowd-funding campaign

Directly, or indirectly mental health impacts everyone. Regardless of gender, age, racial background, social upbringing, financial means, or education, mental health does not discriminate.

Anyone can be affected by a mental health condition. We know that many of you who encounter mental illness in your own lives either personally or with a close family member of friend, are suffering in silence, or hiding in the shadows. We want to deliver into your very hands in the privacy of your own home, a channel of insight, relevant material, and stories that you can identify with.

As much a lifestyle improvement magazine as a source of relevant mental health topics on family, society and work, Better Mental Health Magazine is informative and approachable. We focus on presenting serious and often difficult topics with a balance of respect and optimism.

In order to keep the printing press rolling, pay all of our writers and contributors and continue to produce our digital copy of the magazine we need to raise some additional funds, hence this crowd-funding campaign. 


Why’s it so important

Better Mental Health Magazine is here to provide information, personal experiences and support resources to people with mental health concerns, and their supporters. We are taking these topics from the shadows, and bringing them it into the spotlight enabling everyone to be comfortable talking about subjects that are avoided or misunderstood.

We know that, at some time in their life, one in four people in most countries will suffer from, struggle through or live with a mental health issue. Then there are the practitioners, clinicians, counselors, employers, teachers, and social and legal professionals who work with, support and manage those affected by mental health issues. Socially important and increasingly relevant, Better Mental Health Magazine benefits anyone who wants to live with improved mental health & wellness.

The truth is that we can all experience mental heath shifts at some point in our lives; it’s a natural human phenomenon that arises as a result of life’s many challenges. There are many situations that cause mental illness, some temporary and some permanent. At Better Mental Health Magazine we address the entire spectrum.

Mental Illnesses are simply a state of a human being, and by publishing Better Mental Health Magazine in a way that everyone can relate to, appreciate and understand we take a step closer to increased compassion, empathy and acceptance of one another.


What goes into Better Mental Health Magazine?

Dedicated to all things mental health and sourced from personal experiences and professional information, Better Mental Health Magazine provides you with a greater understanding of mental illness, nutrition, physical well-being and mindfulness.

We provide an entry level and general approach to mental health and well-being.

The magazine is delivered both online and in print, and If you’re wondering “why a print magazine in 2015”, well the answer is that a print magazine is perfect for sharing with family, friends, colleagues and also clients; and we will deliver each issue of Better Mental Health Magazine to you absolutely FREE anywhere in the world!

For all of you technology lovers, we have got you covered! Better Mental Health Magazine is available on just about any smartphone or mobile device on the market so you can carry it everywhere you go.


What makes it unique?

Unlike any other magazine available on the market, here at Better Mental Health Magazine, we take a lifestyle approach, which allows our readers to understand the impact of mental health on theirs and everybody’s lives around them.

Better Mental Health Magazine is informative, encouraging and supportive for people with mental health concerns and their supporters; providing information on ways to improve your mental health, and co-exist with mental health conditions that are affecting your life.

Our magazine provides the following unique features and benefits:

  • Professional Health & Wellness Information
  • Independently published
  • Print and digital formats available
  • Magazine is published every 2 months
  • Single issue, 6 month or 12 month print subscriptions
  • Free International Shipping
  • Issue 4 is in the final stage of development
  • We aim to raise awareness of general and specific mental health issues and ways of achieving better mental health and a greater sense of mental well-being.
  • Read personal accounts from people who have had real experiences with mental health and illness, as well as positive information from medical professionals.
  • Better Mental Health Magazine helps reduce the stigma, raise awareness and understanding of all things about the mind and mental wellness.


Risks and Challenges

The media business is a rough world - you always hear about dwindling newspaper subscriptions, confused advertisers, and media companies closing.

We are in a position where we have found our niche, the response has been great and we are providing a much needed and essential resource for humanity today.

So we understand perfectly well the risks and challenges of continuing with our endeavor, but we have already proven that we can do this, we simply need your support to keep it going.. 

One way or another we will keep talking about Better Mental Health for everyone.


We Actually Need Your Help

This is an old school crowd funding campaign - the way they once were before successful companies realized Indiegogo is a promotional platform – we genuinely need financial donations as we are a genuine publishing company.

The promotion is great, and we would love for you to share this message with everyone you know; however we are seriously crowd funding.

We really need to hit this goal of $10,000 to pay for printing of the upcoming issues. It would be fantastic if you could contribute to the cause and receive a great magazine subscription out of it.

To sweeten the deal we have added some great supporters rewards that we think you will appreciate and enjoy.

With a subscription of any kind, you will get Better Mental Health Magazine delivered to your door, or your device, so it’s always available to you, and there is also an option for all of you writers and mental health champions to contribute to our upcoming issues and become a part of the Better Mental Health Magazine family.

story:
Summary

As of today, August 25, 2015 we have received an additional $5475 in check donations to CHIMES bringing our total to $9,055,    We have reached 72% of our goal.  Thank you all!

Helping build community-based healthcare in one of the most remote, rural and poor areas of Honduras has been the focus of CHIMES, California Honduras Institute for Medical and Educational Support since 2005. Our volunteers assisted the Garifuna community in building the first-ever out-patient facility in the region, the Ciriboya Medical Center.

The community-based center empowers the community, particularly women, in addition to providing previously non-existent health services for the poor.

In 2013, Dr. Luther Harry began construction of two more buildings at the center; a Birthing Center and a Surgery Center. The Surgery Center construction is furthest along.  It is in urgent need of a roof, before the rainy season in October.

That’s where you come in!  With your help we can raise the roof and protect what’s been built so far. With a roof, progress on the building can continue.

What We Need & What You Get

We must raise $12,500  in the next 40 days for supplies and labor to put the roof on the Surgery Center. That could be 500 people contributing $25 each.

Your contribution of $25 or whatever you can afford, will make a world of difference to tens of thousands of people in the region.

Your donation is an essential part the continuing transformative changes in the Garifuna community's physical and emotional strength as a result of the center's work.

If we do not reach our goal, we will prioritize protecting the structure from the heavy rains of fall and winter.

We will keep you updated through e-mail on further developments of the center and its services through CHIMES.  Because CHIMES is a 501 (c) (3) non-profit organization, your gift is tax deductible.

Impact

Your contribution to the raising of the roof on the new Surgery Center is the indispensable next step in continuing the improvement of access to essential medical care for the Garifuna people and their neighbors in the Iriona region of the state of Colon.

Not long ago poor families didn’t name their children until they were two years old because so many died before that age.  Most were anemic and all had intestinal worms.

With over 800,000 medical visits since the center’s inception, women are not dying in child birth and infant mortality has been reduced.

Your contribution now, will literally, be a life or death matter for some people with traumatic illness or injury, simply because of time.

Currently, it is a two-hour drive over rough roads and rivers with a cement ford, assuming a vehicle is available, to the nearest hospital. These roads become impassable during the long winter rainy season.

Building community-based health care is making a lasting world of difference. The center is training people as medical professionals.

With local residents trained and employed in the center, communication is optimized and services most effectively focused.

Over half the students training as Medical Doctors are women who will return to their home town to serve its citizens.

Community classes in practical health and hygiene provided free of charge, further empower the people. These community roots will only be strengthened with time.

The success of this community-based medical center and program are results of the foresight and tenacity of the Garifuna people and the generosity of people like you.

Risks and Challenges

Our immediate challenge is to raise $12,500 within the next 40 days, so that roofing materials can be purchased and delivered in time to construct the roof prior to the rainy season beginning in October.

Our most immediate risk is that we don’t raise all the $12,500.In that case, funds will be prioritized to protect what has been built through the rainy season. Any funds in excess of $12,500 will be used to purchase windows and doors and finish the interior of the building.

Broader challenges for the medical center and the services provided are political. In Honduras, as in the U.S.A., funding for public services and infrastructure are in danger of being reduced or eliminated. At the same time, privatization of both is advancing.

Finally, outright corruption within the government can lead to lack of support for vital services to the people. While these serious challenges are beyond the scope of CHIMES and may affect the rate of progress, none of them will stop this community-based and internationally supported project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit our Facebook page - CHIMES of Ca and "like" us.

www.facebook.com/CHIMESofCA

Use the Share Tools located in the toolbar next to our video:

•  Copy our URL (http://igg.me/at/rtrhonduras) and paste it into an email or social media update

•  Click on the Facebook icon to share through your social media networks

•  Add a widget to your blog or personal website. Click Embed and then copy and paste the widget code.

•  Send a direct email from Indiegogo

Let everyone you know about our campaign to Raise the Roof in Honduras!
