story:
Yesterday, I was at breaking point with Ollie. His physical health and behaviour, both intertwined, were really challenging me. So I did something that I’d never done before with him.

I talked about his birth.

You gotta start the healing somewhere, right?

With utmost sensitivity and honesty (and a slightly down-played story about tadpoles from Wez and baby eggs in my tummy) I shared with my 7 year old the highs and lows of loving him in my womb.

I guided him through a deeper lesson on emotions, feelings, fear, control, trauma... He was ready. (So was I.)

I heartfeltly explained what it’s like to want to leave your own body behind after going through a seemingly tough experience. Not so much in a suicidal way, but because you’re too petrified to fully acknowledge the sadness inside and all that lies beneath.

Sometimes we allow our body/mind to take us further and further away from those core afraid sensations. In any way we can. Although ironically often we want to bring resolution/release to our old feelings so we accidentally make our life repeat circumstances in order to give rise. It’s pretty clever, really. I’m actually a genius at both of those tricks.

“How do you feel now, Ollie?” I asked at the beginning of our early morning session.

“Bored.” He checks the time on our clocks. Like he does 150 times a day. “It’s 7:17, Mum.”

“Thanks Ollie. I was pretty sure it was, because you told me when it was 7:16. Let me share with you some important stories about when you were born.”

I kept it factual. But I ended up weeping. I shared with him how my waters broke.

Yep, I went there.

The general hospital in Launceston was short staffed. It was Tuesday and the week leading up to Easter 2008. 24 hours after I audibly heard the plug to the bathtub pop, I began contractions. Another, yes another, 24 hours after that, Ollie was born ‘normally’ on Thursday. By then I knew I/we had endured the extra kind of torture no woman (or newborn) deserves.

Yet that was just going to be the beginning of it.

The contractions were a breeze. It was the shooting pain in my back and down my leg that got me. Ollie was flipped or posterior or something. So even though his head was descending he was turned around the other way. Sunny-side up, when the back of the baby’s head is against the mum’s spine. And I have a suspicion posterior head circumference measures larger than anterior head circumference. That thing was huge.

I had Wez and my beautiful friend Rosa Koster with me for the birth. Rosa, even though she had been through more than her fair share of baby challenges, was simply unbelievable. Luckily she knew how dysfunctional I was especially back then (I have a tendency to disassociate myself from... well, pretty much everything/everyone) and patiently guided me through and through. I don’t think I’d even read one pregnancy book. With her own expertise and experiences, I think I asked Rosa to be there because in the back of my mind I was expecting something to go tragically wrong. And when Ollie developed pneumonia on the way down, I suppose it nearly did.


So all in all, the long labour was for me and Ollie super hardcore. I also explained to Ollie about the water injections we had twice during the 24 hours. Midwives and doctors were called in to hold me down and together they administered these at least three hellish prongs into my lower back all at the same time. The concept behind sterile saline injections for pain is ‘gate control theory’. Code for smash this part of your body as excruciatingly as you can so you forget about the pain happening in the other part. It was like being stabbed to death by wasps. With REALLY REALLY bad stingers. I really tensed with these thick needles in my back and jolted forward out of my body in extreme shock, screaming the building down. Surely Ollie would have sensed this severe distress.

Did they work? Maybe they helped a little for an hour. But not even an epidural at the very end could help this nerve pain. Even when I could feel contractions before the epidural, my nerve/leg/back pain was incurably way worse.

If the numerous labour traumas weren’t enough stress for us both, it was clear Ollie was born with neonatal pneumonia. It wasn’t just a little temperature spike. He had wheezing with the infection on his lungs and white foam frothing from his little blue tinged mouth.

I was exhausted. I had been awake for 48 hours. I told 7 year old Ollie how I watched in fear through a glass window as the doctors and nurses tried to poke 1 hour Ollie over and over with a needle. They couldn’t find a good vein. He was so thirsty. Nobody was holding him. They were all holding him down to be still, on a cold metal table. I have never ever heard or seen him cry like he did in that room. A nurse walked over and closed the blind. Eventually they found one in his head.

I was so scared and so sad. “I cannot believe that grumpy nurse closed the blind to you Mum,” Ollie was angry as we relived it. He was so engaged with the whole story. Normally he doesn’t focus.

“The doctors and nurses and antibiotics saved your life, Ollie. We are so, so grateful. I am so very sorry I let you get sick. This experience has given us some extra work to do now to build your body up. This is one of the reasons why you still get sick so much. The antibiotics helped you in the emergency of when you were born, but you still have some very important things we need to work on. Since I didn’t know how to help you at the time, I am going to help you now.”

I finished our little session in the time machine, confessing to Ollie that he was a complete surprise. That I was scared to be a Mum, especially with me being very sick as well in many ways. But I assured him the truth, that he was the most welcome, wanted and loved baby... a very special precious gift.

“And I’m so sorry I yell at you sometimes Ollie. Sometimes when Mums feel really scared deep down, they yell. I just want you to be safe and happy.”

“That’s okay, Mum. I love you.”

We wiped away a few tear drops, beaming with warmth and gratitude, spontaneous smiles, naturally feeling whatever we needed to. We felt strangely lighter. More free. We have more work but we hugged tighter than we have ever hugged before. Ollie NEVER hugs for real or for long. He always pulls away to go off chasing or throwing something. I have never seen him more physically present and relaxed (his muscles normally feel so tense to touch) and his heart was open. He was in the moment. His whole body was there. And he didn’t even tell me the time.


Ollie hates his allergies. Like really hates them. I’m starting this campaign because we have found proven ways to bring him some healing.

Not that we will ever go back to eating rubbish, but it would be nice to not have to be so severely allergic and sensitive to the many things Ollie is. I would love to see him attend one birthday party and not have to leave before the cake or be excluded because he is allergic to eggs. Just sharing a toy with someone who is eating egg is enough to make him swell badly. If he eats it he will throw up constantly for about 24 hours. And not just your average spewing up, his stomach convulses and spasms over and over until he starts vomiting water and air for hours. This is horrible for me to watch. And for him to go through, of course. If he accidentally eats other stuff he is allergic to, his throat swells up and he will go unconscious. He can die. We have seen him have an anaphylactic shock a couple of times and it is unspeakably terrifying.

At the moment, Ollie is also having severe asthma attacks at least once a day. This happens every Winter. However we know the cold air is only the secondary trigger. We have him on artificial treatment (that we are still waiting to kick in) but we hope to help him come off this once we fix the primary cause.

At the end of last year we kind of nearly lost Ollie in another way when he only had ONE platelet and was bruising spontaneously right over his body. His gums were pouring out with blood by themselves. It turned out to be an immune attack response to his glandular fever.

For more than 20 years, I have had quite debilitating health issues of my own. Maybe, after hearing only some of the stress stories today, you will empathise why I now have chronic fatigue. However, Ollie and my current conditions can be cured. How do I know this?

I am guided even training with the leading practitioners in the field of wellness medicine. The testimonies and research speaks for itself. It is true, some of the work would be oblivious to the majority of doctors. But there are a growing number of doctors who are choosing the truly effective approach of integrative medicine.

While I personally believe true healing often won’t happen until we acknowledge and release repressed emotions and traumas, we also need the right food and supplements, plus the removal of environmental and internal stresses. It also usually requires the aid of bodywork like chiropractic and so on. Healing is about restoring natural balance, according to our own very unique genome and microbiome. Even restoring balance to our perception of things in life.

My naturopath quoted at a training day, “Without a particular combination of genetic mutations, heavy metal toxicity, chronic infections, chronic inflammation and excitotoxin damage, then chronic disease would not manifest.”

I believe her.

Yes, it costs money to get well. The most expensive tests are usually not covered. But with the results pouring in, we are finally discovering Ollie and my underlying conditions. Over the years we keep thinking we have solved the mystery, but now we see how these were just one significant but small pieces of the puzzle. We are READY to bring ALL our jigsaw together and feel WELL.

Things we know so far: Ollie and I PROBABLY have chronic lyme disease; we both have some interesting gene mutations some being MTHFR (he is +/+ C677T), COMT, MAO-A (also known as the ‘Warrior’ gene aka serial killer gene haha) which basically means with our past environmental contributors we both have a rough time with dopamine and serotonin (I wish my doctor knew this when she once put me on an SSRI); Ollie has severe heavy metal toxicity... There is much more we know and more we need to confirm. Ollie is struggling at school cognitively and behaviourally and I am really struggling here at home. I would give anything to feel normal and be able to work. To have the energy to be the Mum Ollie deserves.

Both pharmaceutical and natural treatments for everything are expensive. We as a family cater for over a dozen food allergies and sensitivities that we need to consider for every meal and every snack every day. Shopping for ingredients gets expensive. Everything is expensive. You get the picture. I don’t think I will bore you any more than I have...

Basically we need to urgently raise around about $2000 each ($4000) to cover outstanding expenses. As you know Wez only works part time and has had to pick up the role of cooking due to my fatigue (we are learning how to batch cook and meal plan so we can free him from this... although it was only one week ago when we finally found out what we are really allowed to eat. So now everything is coming together... yay) And I have just started treatment with the right practitioner for me. We would love love love to afford to have our beautiful Ollie treated by her as well. Hence the campaign.

If you can afford $5 or $10 to put towards our tests and treatments, we would be absolutely honoured. There is simply so much I want to accomplish in this world when I am well. This 20+ year journey for me has not been in vain. We will be serving and empowering others on their own journey in no time.

Love & joy,

Charlene & Ollie


PS If you are the praying/meditating kind please send your loving vibes to help our old home sell in Tasmania. I feel like we need a breakthrough with selling the house more than we ever have, because we are honestly really ready to get well by doing whatever it takes and soon enough earn with our careers. Thanks for supporting our family during this time of transition and transformation. Either way we promise we will pay it forward by helping to bring true healing and love to others in this broken world.

story_txt:
Yesterday, I was at breaking point with Ollie. His physical
health and behaviour, both intertwined, were really challenging me. So I did
something that I’d never done before with him.


I talked about his birth.
You gotta start the healing
somewhere, right?
With utmost sensitivity and honesty (and a slightly
down-played story about tadpoles from Wez and baby eggs in my tummy) I shared
with my 7 year old the highs and lows of loving him in my womb.
I guided him through a deeper lesson on emotions, feelings,
fear, control, trauma... He was ready. (So was I.)
I heartfeltly explained what it’s like to want to leave your
own body behind after going through a seemingly tough experience. Not so much
in a suicidal way, but because you’re too petrified to fully acknowledge the
sadness inside and all that lies beneath.
Sometimes we allow our body/mind to take us further and
further away from those core afraid sensations. In any way we can. Although ironically
often we want to bring resolution/release to our old feelings so we accidentally
make our life repeat circumstances in order to give rise. It’s pretty clever,
really. I’m actually a genius at both of those tricks.
“How do you feel now, Ollie?” I asked at the beginning of
our early morning session.
“Bored.” He checks the time on our clocks. Like he does 150
times a day. “It’s 7:17, Mum.”
“Thanks Ollie. I was pretty sure it was, because you told me
when it was 7:16. Let me share with you some important stories about when you
were born.”
I kept it factual. But I ended up weeping. I shared with him
how my waters broke.
Yep, I went there.
The general hospital in Launceston was short staffed. It was
Tuesday and the week leading up to Easter 2008. 24 hours after I audibly heard
the plug to the bathtub pop, I began contractions. Another, yes another, 24
hours after that, Ollie was born ‘normally’ on Thursday. By then I knew I/we had
endured the extra kind of torture no woman (or newborn) deserves.
Yet that was just going to be the beginning of it.
The contractions were a breeze. It was the shooting pain in
my back and down my leg that got me. Ollie was flipped or posterior or
something. So even though his head was descending he was turned around the
other way. Sunny-side up, when the back of the baby’s head is against the mum’s
spine. And I have a suspicion posterior head circumference measures larger than
anterior head circumference. That thing was huge.
I had Wez and my beautiful friend Rosa Koster with me for
the birth. Rosa, even though she had been through more than her fair share of baby
challenges, was simply unbelievable. Luckily she knew how dysfunctional I was especially
back then (I have a tendency to disassociate myself from... well, pretty much
everything/everyone) and patiently guided me through and through. I don’t think
I’d even read one pregnancy book. With her own expertise and experiences, I think I asked Rosa to be there because in the back of my
mind I was expecting something to go tragically wrong. And when Ollie developed pneumonia on the way down, I suppose it nearly did.

I was so scared and so sad. “I cannot believe that grumpy
nurse closed the blind to you Mum,” Ollie was angry as we relived it. He was so
engaged with the whole story. Normally he doesn’t focus.
“The doctors and nurses and antibiotics saved your life,
Ollie. We are so, so grateful. I am so very sorry I let you get sick. This

story:
Universal Ultimate 101

Universal Ultimate is one of Aero Ultimate's most ambitious projects to date. It has been carefully created to deliver education about the sport in new and engaging ways. As the sport and technology evolve, so will Universal Ultimate.

Mission

To consolidate all Ultimate information with evolving content and formats, always providing cutting-edge education resources for players of all levels in simple, expandable and engaging ways.

Vision

A community that has deep educational resources needed to teach others the sport, regardless of experience level, using the opportunity to grow social skills, physical fitness, and mental sharpness, to progress together towards a higher potential.

Atlas

Our core product in the form of an evolving curriculum database.

Any Device - Integrated with our website and Aero Accounts, access all topics optimized for phone, tablet, and computer.

Topic Breakdown - With categories and levels of content, associated skills can be grouped and studied.

Explorability - Think, find and learn to immerse yourself in the knowledge and variety.

Fluid Format - With many types of readers to serve, we put a lot of thought in creating a simple yet expandable format.

Long-Term Evolution - Atlas today is only the beginning. We think you'll enjoy where ultimate education goes in the near future.

Create an Aero Account and explore Atlas Basic for free! http://www.aeroultimate.com/universal/atlas/free


Perks

(An Atlas subscription is for life!)
(All perks over $15 donate an Atlas subscription to a youth coach in need!)

Be a proud part of our launch community with your limited edition UU Indiegogo sticker!

Early birds get $3 off! Gain lifetime access to Atlas, the ultimate curriculum database building towards 500 topics. Includes limited edition sticker!

Donate an Atlas subscription to our sponsorship pool for High School and Middle School coaches. You'll also gain access to Atlas and the limited edition sticker.

Gain lifetime access to Atlas for you and 4 other coaches, captains or teammates of your choosing. Includes 1 limited edition sticker.

Donate 10 Atlas subscriptions to our sponsorship pool for High School and Middle School coaches. You'll also gain access to Atlas and the limited edition sticker.

You'll get first access to our prototype lesson plan package. Includes Atlas for you and your team (5 subscriptions) and 1 limited edition sticker.

You'll get first access to our prototype drillbook and playbook system. Includes lesson plan beta access, Atlas for you and your team (5 subscriptions) and 1 limited edition sticker.

Get full access to everything Universal has to offer for 2 years: Atlas, Lesson Plans, Drillbook, Playbook and maybe more. Keep your Atlas subscription and limited edition sticker after September 2017.

Be the best coach you can be! Get full access to everything Universal has to offer for life. (Universal Ultimate has 11+ projects planned after Atlas, Lesson Plans, Drillbook and Playbook.)


Funding Goal & Stretch Goals

With 100 topics already written but many more in the queue, we'll looking for a little bit of financial help to spend more time on Atlas. Reaching $3900 will allow us to more quickly bring Atlas up to 250 topics. (Current breakdown below)

Our next project is the development of lesson plans that makes Atlas content instantly ready for the field. Reaching $5000 will help us quickly develop 10 youth/college level lesson plans for this upcoming Fall.

Our second stretch goal really starts to accelerate our development. We have spirit and fitness experts on standby to begin writing our human element topics. Reaching $7500 will bring Atlas information on spirit values, performance concepts, and mental abilities. (Current breakdown below)

Our last stretch goal helps us take a major leap in our timeline. Beyond Atlas, our Drillbook and Playbook projects will take information to an applicable and interactive level. We have a lot of awesome ideas for these and reaching $10,000 will allow us to dive into development this Fall.


Additional Info

Six Pillars

Centralized Location - Information doesn't need to be scattered or contradictory. We aim to collect and connect the dots.

Digital Systems - We introduce content in new formats and processes to accelerate development and application.

Consensus Driven - All content goes through heavy logical reasoning before publishing. We’ll minimize "opinions" as much as possible, relying on facts.

Living Information - There is a half-life to most knowledge, especially in sports. Ensuring continual relevancy, we will review and update content as times change.

Adaptive Writing - Our goal is to have content for varying ages and experience levels, and deliver the information necessary for individuals.

Community Involvement - We involve all types of players and coaches in numerous ways to revise and expand content to an optimum level.

Funds Distribution
If we reach our $10,000 stretch goal, there's a lot of writing to do and new projects to develop. To get to work quickly and create resources with quality, this is how we plan to distribute our funds.

The Team

Elijah Kerns - Editor-in-Chief

Elijah Kerns first attended a pick-up game of Ultimate as a gift from his mom on his tenth birthday. By the time he joined Alameda’s Dark Meat during his sophomore year of high school, he pivoted on the wrong foot, threw no look spinning hucks and had a variety of other self-taught habits. Over the next few years he honed his decision making and took this passion for Ultimate to teams like Polar Bears, Patatas Bravas (Spain), San Francisco’s Revolver and U23 Team USA. A proud alumni of the Davis Dogs, Elijah hopes to put his English and Linguistics background to work in helping shape the sport that’s taken him all over the world and allowed him to meet amazing, like-minded people wherever he goes.

Emily Clarke - Editor

Emily Clarke was introduced to Ultimate her freshman year of college, and fell in love with it. Playing throughout her college years, she participated in the creation of an Ultimate team on campus. Having graduated with a degree in creative writing and studio art, Emily brings a sense of joy and passion to her activities. Having found this company by a stroke of luck, she is excited to bring that passion, creativity, and love for Ultimate to her work for Aero. She balances working for Aero with helping run a lodge in beautiful northern Michigan.

Ken Kaminski - Creative Director

Ken picked up Ultimate in high school after learning from college players returning home for summer pick-up. After leading his high school team, Ken did extensive research on Ultimate skills when starting Kettering's team. Ken logged countless hours reading The Huddle and other blogs about Ultimate skills and strategy. His analytical mindset allowed him to develope a stable forehand and throw variations. Ken continues to tweak his skills and playing mindset to discover situational advantages and mentions them often in deeper topics written.

Kyle Breen - Development Manager

Kyle began playing pick up ultimate in 2007 as a freshman in high school. As a sophomore in college, he found the competitive team on campus and quickly dedicated himself to Reaper Ultimate and learning as much as he could about the sport. In just his second year on the team, he became the president of the team. In his third year now, he is both captain and president of the team. Kyle’s passion within ultimate is teaching new players and veterans alike new aspects to the game. He will return to EIU and Reaper in the fall as a coach and will use his knowledge from Universal Ultimate to help enhance the learning process. Kyle balances his work at Aero with running EIU Ultimate, finishing his undergraduate degree and his pursuit of a doctorate in Sociology.

Joe Yalicki - Youth Developer

Joe started playing pick-up Ultimate as a camper at Lotus Lake Camp in Williamstown, VT. Playing competitively came later on down the road after playing soccer, basketball, and track & field through high school. Joe attended the University of New Hampshire and tried out for the Ultimate team as a freshman looking to join a club for the added experience. After 4 years with UNH Joe graduated with experience studying marketing, coaching, and working with youths. Joe coaches 4 local soccer teams consisting of boys and girls ages 13-18 and has worked for 9 years as a head counselor at the same Lotus Lake Camp that he first started chasing plastic as a camper.

Ryan Dubowsky - Systems Developer

Ryan was first introduced to competitive ultimate in in 2007 during his freshman year of college by an eager upperclassman looking to found a team. After learning the basics, Ryan constantly bounced ideas off his teammates in an effort to develop his thoughts and ideas about the game. Before his senior year at New Paltz Ryan decided to take up a leadership role in Ultimate and has captained nearly every team since -- including at the club level. Ryan took advantage of his playing and leading opportunities to refine his thoughts about Ultimate. Ryan still uses his teammates and peers to further his understanding of Ultimate.

Questions?

Email our team at uu@aeroultimate.com!

Thank you for your support!

With 100 topics already written but many more in the queue, we'll looking for a little bit of financial help to spend more time on Atlas. Reaching $3900 will allow us to more quickly bring Atlas up to 250 topics. (Current breakdown below)



Our next project is the development of lesson plans that makes Atlas content instantly ready for the field. Reaching $5000 will help us quickly develop 10 youth/college level lesson plans for this upcoming Fall.
Our second stretch goal really starts to accelerate our development. We have spirit and fitness experts on standby to begin writing our human element topics. Reaching $7500 will bring Atlas information on spirit values, performance concepts, and mental abilities. (Current breakdown below)



Our last stretch goal helps us take a major leap in our timeline. Beyond Atlas, our Drillbook and Playbook projects will take information to an applicable and interactive level. We have a lot of awesome ideas for these and reaching $10,000 will allow us to dive into development this Fall.
Additional Info
Six Pillars

Centralized Location - Information doesn't need to be scattered or contradictory. We aim to collect and connect the dots.
Digital Systems - We introduce content in new formats and processes to accelerate development and application.
Consensus Driven - All content goes through heavy logical reasoning before publishing. We’ll minimize "opinions" as much as possible, relying on facts.
Living Information - There is a half-life to most knowledge, especially in sports. Ensuring continual relevancy, we will review and update content as times change.
Adaptive Writing - Our goal is to have content for varying ages and experience levels, and deliver the information necessary for individuals.
Community Involvement - We involve all types of players and coaches in numerous ways to revise and expand content to an optimum level.
Funds Distribution


If we reach our $10,000 stretch goal, there's a lot of writing to do and new projects to develop. To get to work quickly and create resources with quality, this is how we plan to distribute our funds.

The Team





Elijah Kerns - Editor-in-Chief
Elijah Kerns first attended a pick-up game of Ultimate as a gift from his mom on his tenth birthday. By the time he joined Alameda’s Dark Meat during his sophomore year of high school, he pivoted on the wrong foot, threw no look spinning hucks and had a variety of other self-taught habits. Over the next few years he honed his decision making and took this passion for Ultimate to teams like Polar Bears, Patatas Bravas (Spain), San Francisco’s Revolver and U23 Team USA. A proud alumni of the Davis Dogs, Elijah hopes to put his English and Linguistics background to work in helping shape the sport that’s taken him all over the world and allowed him to meet amazing, like-minded people wherever he goes.

Emily Clarke - Editor
Emily Clarke was introduced to Ultimate her freshman year of college, and fell in love with it. Playing throughout her college years, she participated in the creation of an Ultimate team on campus. Having graduated with a degree in creative writing and studio art, Emily brings a sense of joy and passion to her activities. Having found this company by a stroke of luck, she is excited to bring that passion, creativity, and love for Ultimate to her work for Aero. She balances working for Aero with helping run a lodge in beautiful northern Michigan.
Ken Kaminski - Creative Director
Ken picked up Ultimate in high school after learning from college players returning home for summer pick-up. After leading his high school team, Ken did extensive research on Ultimate skills when starting Kettering's team. Ken logged countless hours reading The Huddle and other blogs about Ultimate skills and strategy. His analytical mindset allowed him to develope a stable forehand and throw variations. Ken continues to tweak his skills and playing mindset to discover situational advantages and mentions them often in deeper topics written.
Kyle Breen - Development ManagerKyle began playing pick up ultimate in 2007 as a freshman in high school. As a sophomore in college, he found the competitive team on campus and quickly dedicated himself to Reaper Ultimate and learning as much as he could about the sport. In just his second year on the team, he became the president of the team. In his third year now, he is both captain and president of the team. Kyle’s passion within ultimate is teaching new players and veterans alike new aspects to the game. He will return to EIU and Reaper in the fall as a coach and will use his knowledge from Universal Ultimate to help enhance the learning process. Kyle balances his work at Aero with running EIU Ultimate, finishing his undergraduate degree and his pursuit of a doctorate in Sociology.
Joe Yalicki - Youth Developer
Joe started playing pick-up Ultimate as a camper at Lotus Lake Camp in Williamstown, VT. Playing competitively came later on down the road after playing soccer, basketball, and track & field through high school. Joe attended the University of New Hampshire and tried out for the Ultimate team as a freshman looking to join a club for the added experience. After 4 years with UNH Joe graduated with experience studying marketing, coaching, and working with youths. Joe coaches 4 local soccer teams consisting of boys and girls ages 13-18 and has worked for 9 years as a head counselor at the same Lotus Lake Camp that he first started chasing plastic as a camper.
Ryan Dubowsky - Systems DeveloperRyan was first introduced to competitive ultimate in in 2007 during his freshman year of college by an eager upperclassman looking to found a team. After learning the basics, Ryan constantly bounced ideas off his teammates in an effort to develop his thoughts and ideas about the game. Before his senior year at New Paltz Ryan decided to take up a leadership role in Ultimate and has captained nearly every team since -- including at the club level. Ryan took advantage of his playing and leading opportunities to refine his thoughts about Ultimate. Ryan still uses his teammates and peers to further his understanding of Ultimate.

Questions?Email our team at uu@aeroultimate.com!Thank you for your support!

story:
History of the club Adrenalin:

 Climbing club Adrenalin is founded back in 1997. because some of the students from Faculty of sport and physical science in Novi Sad had been in love with nature, healthy life and most of all adrenaline sports.
 This club was the one of the first three made in Serbia, but the real activity of the team Adrenalin starts in 2000. when we introduced the city with first assembly structure for free climbing in Novi Sad. In summer 2001.  another structure for free climbing was made, it was on the Novi Sad’s public beach “Štrand“. 12 meters high and 4,5 meters wide, metal - wood construction, with black panels, painted to yellow. 


 In the past 15 years, we have organized more than 160 different competitions and events, sometimes with only 30 and sometimes with more than a 120 participants in the climbing gym that spreads on 160 square meters , with a bouldering wall that is only 3.9 meters foot high, but 22.5 meters long.

 Now we were forced to move out of the climbing gym that was our home for last 15 years and to strip everything down.

The idea is born:


Why not to make something that had never before been seen in our country? Something that is available to everybody, whole year round and not just for the summer?


After 3 months we have found new place for our climbing center. That location is placed in our home town, Novi Sad, and there it was for the past 30 years, but we didn't know about it.
Now we need to build everything from the start. 


We started our new and biggest project so far in  09th march 2015. and we will try to finish it up by September 1st. 2015.


There are going to be changing rooms, cafe, chill out zone, activities zone,pet friendly area, a climbing wall for lead climbing that is 11.6 meters high and 24 meters wide and bouldering area of 80 square meters. Our desire is to create an adventure park that will be placed at the height of 15 meters.

The time is now:

We tried to do this all by ourselves, but we realized that it will not be that easy.
Until this moment we have spent around 8.000 euros ( 9.000 $ )  for this project, and we still have not reached the main part. 
Our friend and CEO of climbing center Nenad Matic had spent all of his savings on this project, because the costs are higher than he expected.  He is a school teacher, and when we take a step back and see that average monthly salary in Serbia is 300$, if you are lucky, you need three jobs to save that amount of money in 10 years.
Our project manager tells us that we will need another 14 - 18.000 euros ( 16 - 20.000 $ ) to finish everything that we imagined.

               

Several times we asked for funds from the city and state but they had no understanding for us.

     

     


Even if this action is unsuccessful, we will continue on with the construction of this center. So in a year, or two, we will have our center done.

This project is not only important to us and our team, this will be the only commercial climbing center in Serbia that is going to be used throughout the whole year. It is the first of it's kind here. 

This is the first time in all these years that we now own the space that can be used every day, all day long.  Climbing center Adrenaline is the first and the only “pet friendly” climbing center in Serbia.   
P.S. after we reach 8.000+  , we will donate 10% of all the amount to the animal shelter "Bella" in Budisava, a town near Novi Sad.

their link:
https://www.facebook.com/azil.bella?fref=ts
  

The Team:

Nenad Matic, CEO, sport climbing instructor,  MSc sport and exercise science

Stevan Todorovic, sport climbing instructor, ultra marathon runner , electrical installer

Aleksandar Djuranovic, sport climbing instructor, student, Faculty of Economics and Administration, project manager


Aleksandar Sajatovic, sport climbing instructor, IT programer


Bojan Sajatovic , sport climbing instructor,  Faculty of Sciences, Department of Chemistry , MSc in environmental protection


Danijel Milojkovic, sport climbing instructor, metalworker


Miroslav Ninkov, sport climbing instructor, Physiatrist, First Aid instructor


Stevan Bugadzija,  sport climbing instructor, Software developer at Schneider Electric DMS NS


Vladimir Tepavac, sport climbing instructor, fitness instructor

story:
My Health Detective System by Health Evolution

Connecting Your Brain and Your Health

SCAN, MEASURE, DELIVER Personalized Custom Codes and TRACK Body System Patterns

About this project

My Health Detective System opens up a totally new approach to personal wellness using Biofeedback and Pulsed Electromagnetic Field (PEMF) technology.

Never before has there been a time when wellness-minded scientists, biofeedback practitioners, software programmers and business leaders been able to connect, research, and create unprecedented ideas and innovation enabling you to:

                                                         MONITOR YOUR

                                                             Wellbeing

                                 USING A SAFE, BIOFEEDBACK SYSTEM

My Health Detective System currently includes a brain sensing headband (manufactured by Muse), our proprietary device responsive software application and prototype tone/frequency delivering AMPCoil hardware.  It’s portable and affordable.  Finally all the tools are in place to scan, map, and track your own brain and body stress indicators, and decode these patterns into meaningful and useable data. 

See: www.myhealthdetective.com.

  STUDIES SHOW the effectiveness of BioFeedback for:

  • Stress Reduction
  • Discomfort Relief
  • Positive Behavior Reinforcement
  • Mental Focus
  • Sleep Enhancement
  • Cognitive Improvements
  • Neuromuscular Re-education

 STUDIES SHOW the effectiveness of PEMF for:

  • Anti-Oxidant Stimulation
  • Improved Nutritional Uptake
  • Cellular Energy Improvement, ATP Production
  • Enhanced Cellular Oxygenation
  • Reduced Sports Recovery Time
  • Detoxification

Can you imagine getting all this in one system?  Talk about personal power!

What People are Saying about My Health Detective System

Jaslyn M.  “My son is now thinking faster and talking, actually talking.  He has come a long way in just six short weeks.  My heart can hardly contain my joy. Thank you so much for all this.”

Nancy W. “I have noticed that I am a lot less anxious.  Before, I was worried that this might hurt, but it doesn’t.  I was worried that this might not work, but it does.  The changes in me are all positive and exciting, in a very good way.”

Lawrence L. “I think clearer after coiling.


Understanding your own brain and body clues

You are invited to participate in a revolutionary vision, utilizing proven technology to embrace a powerful, new way we experience wellness.

My Health Detective Software App and AMPCoil combines EEG brainwave detecting headband technology, highly innovative proprietary software with frequency producing AMPCoil (a modified Doug/Rife coil) for the process of self-improvement. Life can throw us curve balls and figuring out what’s right for you can be tough. Now is your opportunity to discover revealing information about yourself.

You can scan, measure, record and track your body system patterns, enabling you to retrain your mind and body.

Identifying your priorities

Our mission is to empower people to improve their personal physical landscape by identifying and accessing stress reducing and performance enhancing frequency codes.  We’ve leveraged our training, knowledge, research and passion to create the next generation of self-fitness.  My Health Detective Software App and AMPCoil enables you to identify and retrain your body to optimize your fitness and performance goals.


Self-awareness leads to self-empowerment

Our hardware engineer, Larry Langdon, testing our third prototype


The Muse Headband
  • Connect the headband to your smartphone or tablet via Bluetooth
  • Get real-time feedback on your brain activity via 7 dry sensors
  • Sends brainwave data to AMP software for decoding
  • Utilizes the same EEG handset technology as hospitals and clinics
  • Tested and certified to meet all safety standards


AMP Coil – 3rd generation prototype
  • Electromagnetic Frequency Generator
  • Electrical resonant transformer (modified Rife Coil/Doug Coil)
  • Utilizes PEMF Pulsed Electromagnetic Field technology
  • Synchs with brainwave sensing accessories to target and customize
  • Amplifies the magnetic field
  • Plugs into the MP3 audio output
  • Coil stays cool even after hours of use
  • Superior engineering design for Amplifier and Controller Unit

My Health Detective Software, version 1.3

  • Analyzes, decodes, and translates brainwaves into usable data
  • Identifies body system patterns and ranks system priorities
  • Sends ideal frequency codes unique to the individual via the AMP Coil
  • Runs on Windows, Androids, and iPhones

My Health Detective is an efficient EEG (electroencephalography) brainwave self-monitoring technology that measures the electrical impulses from your hundred billion brain cells.  Our software decodes your scans into a personal wellness dossier for you to track your body pattern changes.

Training/Support

  • Step-by-Step User Guide with Start Up Protocols
  • User Manual for operation and care
  • 1 hour private remote instruction session
  • Ongoing phone and email support

Guide your body with targeted frequencies

The My Health Detective Software App translates your brainwave info into meaningful data.  This information is the basis in creating which frequencies are uniquely beneficial for you.  My Health Detective’s software can measure, track and help you improve your performance levels by reducing stress, increasing your focus and improving your sleep quality. 

The AMPCoil is a modified Doug/Rife coil that plugs into your computer’s MP3 audio output and has been adapted to generate specific frequencies (PEMFs) in response to your individual body system’s prioritized needs. 

Powerfully impacting lives

Life is not always in our control.  Sometimes things happen and you realize that you must do something about it.  We have listened to hundreds of challenged people searching for an effective way to enhance their lives.  So it’s with joy and gratitude that we have this technical package and program that you can:

  • Use in the privacy of your own home

  • Use without messy conductive gel with a dry sensor headband

  • Scan, monitor and record your progress

  • Generate your own relaxation sequences 

  • Include family members of all ages, pets and horses

At the heart of My Health Detective App

Your support of My Health Detective Software App and AMPCoil can make us all more productive.  Discover your own stress and brain fog reduction, sleep enhancement and peak performance patterns.

My Health Detective System calls for your support

THE NEXT STEPS

Significant milestones for this project include:

  • Concept March 2013
  • Proof of Concept August 2013
  • First Prototype September 2013
  • Second Prototype November 2014
  • Headband and Software Sync February 2015
  • Third Prototype March 2015
  • Field Testing Begins March 2015
  • Crowdfunding Campaign May 2015
  • Production Setup June 2015
  • Production Adjustments August 2015

Who’s behind My Health Detective?

It takes the extraordinary combination of talent, skill, experience and desire to create a novel approach with proven technologies. 

Aaron Bigelow, Founder and Business Development

With three decades of entrepreneurial experience, Aaron has sales, marketing, worldwide product distribution and excellent team building skills.  His background is in nutrition and psychology.  He was a competitive athlete and missionary.  He delivered over 10,000 biofeedback SCIO/EPFX devices to practitioners worldwide. His own personal challenges drive him and his mission to bring relief and assist people to be well.

Aaron's Story

My heartfelt thanks to all who have the vision of utilizing technology to embrace the powerful and interactive ways we can experience our greatest potential.”  - Aaron


Deborah Anne Drake, Health and Wellness Director

Now retired, Dr. Drake’s 25 years of medical practice included emergency and family medicine, she was the director of a large integrative medical clinic, and has taught medical, nursing and biofeedback students.  A lifelong continuous learner, athlete and musician, she currently enjoys lecturing, coaching, teaching and training students in alternative and natural modalities.  She has authored textbooks and numerous white papers on toxicity, candidiasis, and biofeedback therapies.  Combining evidenced-based medicine with natural health and wellness strategies enables the body to self-clean, rejuvenate and energize itself.

“We can now empower people to have access to vibrant, audacious health options.”  - Deborah


Larry Langdon, Chief Engineer

Larry has spent 30 years innovating cutting edge technologies for Boeing, National Semiconductor, Intel, Microsoft and classified projects requiring special clearance for high level applications. Utilizing his B.S. in electrical engineering, he has extensive experience in software, hardware, integration, instrumentation, product testing and embedded designs; including the first FDA approved defibrillator introduced years ago.  Larry is determined to use his skills and knowledge to assist others in their own wellness journey.

“Positive thoughts can create a positive attitude, which creates positive actions, which creates positive events.  We can be our own chain reaction of goodness.”  - Larry


Helena Tummers, Chief Financial Officer

Helena brings 33 years of experience in the manufacturing sector of the motorcycle, bicycle and automotive industry.  Her expertise is accounting, operations and project management. She co-founded AMP Research with her father in 1989, as an R&D house to utilizing cutting edge inventions and technology to produce the first full suspension and disc brake mountain bike.  Using its own patented technology from the bicycle and motorcycle sector, AMP invented numerous leading automotive and OEM accessory products that were supplied to most of the automotive manufacturers, including GM, Dodge, Ford, Nissan, Mitsubishi, Toyota with yearly sales of over $ 35M.  AMP’s brand name was highly respected in the industry, which lead to the sale of the company to Lund International Inc., in October 2013.

“Technology continues to inspire us to find significance in the very act of living and sharing a good and healthy life.” - Helena



Suzan Moody, Director of Operations

Retired audiologist, researcher, founder/co-founder of 3 successful Internet start-ups, Suzan brings 16 years of experience in internet technology and software.  Her companies included connectivity companies and an e-commerce software company.  She is a health and wellness advocate, author, and speaks internationally on autism, detoxification and personal growth.

“My Health Detective System is a wellness opportunity.  It gives people the ability to be their own playwright and director of a healthy life.”  - Suzan

Success prototypes

Our team has been working on the development and implementation of My Health Detective Software App and AMPCoil for the last 18 months. We have successful brought a series of prototypes to a functioning production level.  We have qualified industrial partners ready to begin production.  With your support we can start production in four months and turn My Health Detective Software App and AMPCoilinto a world-wide success.  And you will be one of the first to benefit from your own personal wellness transformation.

Now there’s only one little step left to take – and that is where we need your help.  Your support and contribution will help us finance:

  • Wholesale purchase of production components

  • Special tools for production

  • Legal and licensing fees

Risks and challenges

We are innovators and pioneers of this software and have a combined track record of successfully delivering products to consumers worldwide.  Our team has tested software versions; neuroheadband and AMPCoil prototypes.  We have been working with manufacturing partners to mitigate the risks of volume production.  We have provided the Kickstarter community with a conservative estimate for when the delivery of the software AMPcoil can be expected.  We are committed to keeping you informed of our progress.  Nevertheless, unforeseen challenges and circumstances can arise as we finalized the software and the AMPcoils’ production capacity.  We pledge to do our utmost to minimize any delays in our shipping schedule and dedicate ourselves to provide you the best opportunity to experience this technology as soon as humanly possible.

medicine, she was the director of a large integrative medical clinic, and has
taught medical, nursing and biofeedback students.  A lifelong continuous learner, athlete and
musician, she currently enjoys lecturing, coaching, teaching and training
students in alternative and natural modalities. 
She has authored textbooks and numerous white papers on toxicity,
candidiasis, and biofeedback therapies. 
Combining evidenced-based medicine with natural health and wellness
strategies enables the body to self-clean, rejuvenate and energize itself.
“We can now empower people to have access to
vibrant, audacious health options.”  -
Deborah
Larry Langdon, Chief
Engineer
Larry has spent 30 years
innovating cutting edge technologies for Boeing, National Semiconductor, Intel,
Microsoft and classified projects requiring special clearance for high level
applications. Utilizing his B.S. in electrical engineering, he has extensive experience
in software, hardware, integration, instrumentation, product testing and
embedded designs; including the first FDA approved defibrillator introduced
years ago.  Larry is determined to use
his skills and knowledge to assist others in their own wellness journey.
“Positive thoughts can create a positive attitude,
which creates positive actions, which creates positive events.  We can be our own chain reaction of goodness.”  - Larry


Helena Tummers, Chief Financial Officer
Helena brings 33 years of
experience in the manufacturing sector of the motorcycle, bicycle and
automotive industry.  Her expertise is accounting, operations and
project management. She co-founded AMP Research with her father in 1989,
as an R&D house to utilizing cutting edge inventions and technology to
produce the first full suspension and disc brake mountain bike.  Using its
own patented technology from the bicycle and motorcycle sector, AMP invented
numerous leading automotive and OEM accessory products that were supplied to
most of the automotive manufacturers, including GM, Dodge, Ford, Nissan,
Mitsubishi, Toyota with yearly sales of over $ 35M.  AMP’s brand name was
highly respected in the industry, which lead to the sale of the company to Lund
International Inc., in October 2013.
“Technology continues to inspire us to find
significance in the very act of living and sharing a good and healthy life.” -
Helena

Suzan Moody, Director of Operations
Retired
audiologist, researcher, founder/co-founder of 3 successful Internet start-ups,
Suzan brings 16 years of experience in internet technology and software.  Her companies included connectivity companies
and an e-commerce software company.  She
is a health and wellness advocate, author, and speaks internationally on autism,
detoxification and personal growth.
“My Health Detective System is a wellness
opportunity.  It gives people the ability
to be their own playwright and director of a healthy life.”  - Suzan
Success prototypes
Our team has
been working on the development and implementation of My Health Detective Software
App and AMPCoil for the last 18 months. We have successful brought a series of
prototypes to a functioning production level. 
We have qualified industrial partners ready to begin production.  With your support we can start production in four
months and turn My Health Detective Software App and AMPCoilinto a world-wide success.  And you will be one of the first to benefit
from your own personal wellness transformation.
Now there’s
only one little step left to take – and that is where we need your help.  Your support and contribution will help us
finance:

Wholesale
purchase of production components
Special
tools for production
Legal
and licensing fees

Risks and challenges
We are
innovators and pioneers of this software and have a combined track record of
successfully delivering products to consumers worldwide.  Our team has tested software versions; neuroheadband
and AMPCoil prototypes.  We have been
working with manufacturing partners to mitigate the risks of volume
production.  We have provided the
Kickstarter community with a conservative estimate for when the delivery of the
software AMPcoil can be expected.  We are
committed to keeping you informed of our progress.  Nevertheless, unforeseen challenges and
circumstances can arise as we finalized the software and the AMPcoils’ production
capacity.  We pledge to do our utmost to
minimize any delays in our shipping schedule and dedicate ourselves to provide
you the best opportunity to experience this technology as soon as humanly
possible.

story:
Short Summary

I am Pat MacIsaac and I have dedicated the last 30 years to raising money to build, grow and finish St. Andrews Na Creige Golf Course in the stunning Codroy Valley, Newfoundland, Canada.

This all started, when my Dad (Richard MacIsaac) passed the land down to me in the 90's, which has been in the MacIsaac family since Captain John MacIsaac (my great grandfather) was deeded the land by Queen Victoria herself in 1889. I made a promise to my Dad to do something with it. To create something for our community. To increase tourism and boost Codroy Valley as a must see place to visit in Canada, North America and the world a like.  To develop this land into something where kids can come to play sports, have camps and thrive in athletics.

In 1994 I began this amazing journey by raising money to start the project.  As anyone could imagine the money quickly ran out, and we were only able to finish the front 9 holes.  Now that I am the full time operator of the course, it is hard to get out there to find investments and financial support. Between mowing greens and fairways to bartending and hosting weddings in my club house, the days seem to end too quickly to add anything else to the plate.

This is where Indiegogo can save the day! Any contribution to my project would help tremendously! I would be able to fulfill my promise to my Dad, by turning our families land into something the community can use and thrive off of. The back 9  would be finished.  The driving range and work around the clubhouse would be complete.  And finally, we could start on building the baseball diamonds for the kids and building RV hookups and camping areas for visitors. It would be the start of an even larger picture such as housing developments and making St. Andrews into a full resort. The sky really is the limit!

What We Need & What You Get

We need roughly $2,000,000.00 to finish the project, mainly the back 9 holes and facilities. Once the back 9 holes are complete, it will open up more time and capital for me to continue with development, like the driving range and baseball diamonds. I will be able to hire help, rather then do it all on my own and I will be able to afford the equipment necessary to complete the course. Think of how amazing that will be for the golfers! A brand new back 9 instead of doing our current course twice!

Whats in it for you?! Besides helping out a cool Newfoundlander and his life's work :) ?!  Any of our contribution levels will have you joining the Legacy of St.Andrews. No matter what level you are able to contribute, you will be a part of our Wall of Fame. You will be a part of our Codroy Valley Family. Our 2nd level contribution will garner you a Square Foot Certificate which gives you the chance to "own a piece of the rock", have your name on the Wall of Fame and your first 18 holes free of green fee charges. Each level increases from there and only gets better, including the opportunity to own your very own home on the course!!!  Every single contribution from the smallest to the largest, will not only go to great use, but will absolutely mean the world!

Now what if we don't reach our goal?! Whatever funds we do get, will go to as much as we can around the course. Staffing, fixing up the club house, paying bills, and general maintenance. This obviously depends on how much we get. $250,000 will get us on our way with the back 9, however $30,000 won't get us very far on that front but will be allocated to many other necessities around the course. Every little bit truly does help!

The Impact

Newfoundland, for those of you that haven't been lucky enough YET to visit, is a stunning, unforgettable place. Our golf course is a privately owned public 9 hole golf course (Par 35) situated in the beautiful Codroy Valley area of the southern portion of Newfoundland’s west coast. Surrounded by spectacular views of the Long Range Mountains and Little Codroy River, St. Andrews Na Creige offers stunning views to golfers and visitors alike. The property has been in the family for over 125 years, and boasts all of Newfoundland’s charm, beauty, and friendliness. 

Tourism is essential to Newfoundlands economy. By creating St.Andrews Na Creige into a complete 18 hole course with driving range and space for RVs and camping, it will encourage visitors to come and stay and explore the rest of what the beautiful Codroy Valley has to offer. Golfing, fly fishing (2 local salmon rivers and 15 others within a 40 minute drive), bird watching, hiking, canoeing, swimming, and zip lining are just some of the things that you can do while visiting the valley and surrounding areas. 

The Codroy Valley area covers approximately 100 sq. km and encompasses 15 smaller communities and is surrounded by the Long Range Mountains, the Anguille Mountains and the Atlantic Ocean. The Valley has spectacular views throughout of the mountains, waterways, Newfoundland’s rugged coastline and rolling hills. Unspoiled beaches are only minutes from St. Andrews Na Creige Golf Course. There is so much to do in the Valley, including bird watching, atlantic salmon fishing, fly fishing, hiking, swimming, skidooing and cross country skiing.

By finishing the course, our community will have a stunning finished golf course to call their own. An activity to do to keep active, to visit with friends and family, and to teach the younger generation. Having the completed course and driving range will give pride to the community and give myself and others another thing to be proud of.

Risks & Challenges

My biggest risk and challenge will be mainly raising enough funds, but also finding the staff to work. 

$2,000,000.00 is a lot of money to raise. I know in my heart that the money will be going to finish an already amazingly beautiful course, but conveying that to you is a bigger challenge. Through photos and videos, I will do my best to show the beauty that is not only St.Andrews Na Creige Golf Course, but also Newfoundland as a whole.

Being in the Codroy Valley makes staffing difficult.  The population of the area is composed of 15 small towns. As you can imagine, finding staff is not the simplest task. The funding will allow me to reach out further and increase pay which will hopefully increase the amount of eligible employees.

Other Ways You Can Help

If helping financially isn't in the cards for you at the moment, thats ok!! I would really appreciate if you shared this page to others that you think may be able and willing to help. Someone who loves to travel, someone who loves to golf, someone who loves Newfoundland and its people or someone who loves community involvement may all be interested in this campaign.

There are so many ways to spread the news and we would be over the moon if you would! 

Check out www.standrewsgolfcourse.ca for more information

story:
La visibilité est essentielle afin de faire connaitre nos services à ceux qui en ont besoin et sensibiliser la population québécoise à la problématique des troubles alimentaires.L’ANEB est un organisme à but non lucratif, et doit compter sur la générosité de ses partenaires médias afin de rendre cette visibilité possible. Mission: Venir en aide a tous ceux touche par un trouble alimentaire et éduquer leurs entourage

#ANEB La Chic!Québec charter for a healthy and diverse body image .We want to follow an international current towards awareness campaigns on problems related to excessive preoccupation with weight, anorexia nervosa, and bulimia nervosa. We are determined to collectively contribute to promote a healthy diversity of body images

  • Les contributeurs pourrons nous aider a continuer le program d'education pour detecter les signes et aider a la guérison
  • Contributors will help in continuing the educational program to detect early signs and continue to support the journey towards recovery

What We Need 

  • We need a lot but for this campaign we are hoping to reach 5000$ of more

  • your donation allows us to continue our support and educational activities any amount will help!

  • Vos dons nous permettent de maintenir nos activitees de support et de developer nos service aupres de ceux touches par un trouble alimentaire. Tout montant est apprecie!

The Impact

Body image presented in the public and media influence self-image and self-esteem. Beauty ideals based on extreme thinness can harm self-esteem, particularly in girls and women. We encourage partners from all fields to work together to help diminish adverse social pressures so as to foster a healthy society. With vitality and creativity, the fashion, advertising, and media sectors can provide leadership and exert a positive influence upon the population. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are holding a silent auction during the Montreal Burlesque festival and all the funds collected will go directly to ANEBQuebec. If you want to donate a prize for the auction please contact us: info@montrealburlesquefestival.ca

story:
When I first lost my eye sight, the first question I asked was "Now what do I do"?  My family and friends looked online for answers to this question.  Millions of results came up, some of them relevant,  most of them were for window blinds, while others showed me the song Blind. 

There were a lot of definitions, various pages on social media, and treatments.  however, none of these options told me that because I am blind, WalMart and my local supermarket give me a personal shopper to help me. None of them told me that i get free 411 on my house phone and cell phone. None of them told me about what doctors, restaurants, software, cell phones, hardware was really accessible and which ones were just false advertising without having to test each and every one.

It took over two years for me to find out this information. and to learn that other disabilities had similar problems finding resources. Parents with children who have autism, juvenile type 2 diabetics, various types of cancer, depression, addiction, ADHD, crones, and hundreds of others.  So my partner and i created Imuneek.com  to help instantly connect people, organizations, doctors, support groups, news, events, hash tags, and articles specific to their medical condition or disability, physical or mental. Imuneek is your virtual online assistant for every type of disability, medical condition, etc. We call these Uniqueness's.  So far, Imuneek is one of only 2 resources in the country for blind parents and is the only  company that has the ability to have a support group in every community for type 2 juvenile diabetes. Imuneek is also one of only a handful of places a parent can attend an online support group for their children with autism.  Imuneek is the only place that has a user generated "What To First Guide" to save people years of their life that would have been spent looking for information.  Imuneek not only has its own users and information, but acts like a hub so that our users know every option available, even though its not on our website.  Imuneek has an RSS reader that automatically sorts the information so that our users only see articles specific to their uniqueness.  Imuneek understands that a uniqueness affects not just the person who has it, but their family members as well.  This is why Imuneek has the option for a person to sign up because they have a love one  who is affected by a medical condition or disability.  A spouse or sibling of a person suffering from Alzheimer can speak to other spouses or siblings to ask what is the best way to keep their loved one active.  Another great feature of Imuneek is that if yo ask a question, with a simple click of a button, you can ask not only the Imuneek users, but all of your social media at the same time.  No need to post it several times on different sites.  By doing this, our users get the most exposure  so their questions can be answered.  When someone responds, the comment can be voted up if it is relevant and valid so that the posing moves to the top of the responses.  If an answer is incorrect, you can vote it down so that it travels to the bottom of your responses.  Sometimes you want to ask a doctor, and sometimes you want to ask a person in your shoes.  We know that no one can know exactly what you are going through.  But Imuneek lets you know that you are not alone, and there are  other people who are going through something similar.  We spent our life savings developing this website.  We need your help to add modules to the site  that will make life easier for over 1 billion people in the world.

Community Modules Price in USD:

A section for our users to include allergies to medications or food or products $8,000

Doctor, hospital, organization, etc directory with rating system $6,000

Individual Chat between users in the site $6,000

Public message system in groups $4,000

User generated wiki for each category $4,000

Add filters to posts (question, tip, only for doctors,etc) $2,000

An Imuneek Drugs module that is synced with the FDA database to list, define, and have images on all prescription drugs and experimental drugs as well $10,000

Add the possibility for users to write articles, blog, journal and post them in their profiles $6,000

Live video conferencing $35,000

Companies modules:

A module that allows businesses to tell our users about a clinical trial, and the user can sign up for them in one click $20,000

Imuneek news updates so that a business account can release news to the community specific to a category $5,000

Imuneek Jobs module $6,000

Doctors:

Electronic medical records $8,000

Prescription records $9,000

A tele-medicine module so that if a user has a camera they can chat directly with a doctor and the doctor can diagnose them, electronically send a prescription, and bill the insurance company through the site. $35,000

APPS:

Imuneek app (jobs, answers, wiki, articles) $35,000

Imuneek Tele Medicine $50,000

Imuneek medical/prescription records $30,000

Imuneek conditions, diseases, drug, and treatment database app. $20,000

Risks

There are many challenges that can arise from building a website that is automated and 508 compliant, (508 compliant is a set of guidelines that websites that cater to people with medical condition and disabilities must conform to). Some of the modules that we create might not work as efficiently when they are live as they behave during our beta testing on our developmental server. Some modules may require a longer beta testing period which may delay the development of certain parts of the website. When we are developing the apps for IOS and Android the operating systems might get upgraded and change dramatically. If this happens we might have to go back and redevelop the apps to work with the new OS.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share our story by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Youtube Review


Our Story

Have you ever wondered why sugar compels so many of us to binge eat?  Why you start off planning to eat a couple of Oreo’s, only to wind up eating the whole sleeve?  Why you plan to eat a small dish of ice cream, then scarf down the entire carton?  Have you tried to cut back on sugar only to realize how difficult it is?  That’s because, according to a Princeton study written by Dr. Bart Hoebel, sugar is as addictive as cocaine, heroin, and alcohol!

Sugar addiction is something people don’t think much about, but sugar addiction is real.  There are serious health issues associated with sugar, along with mounting health care costs.  Sugar cravings keep people from losing weight and staying healthy.


That’s why our founders, Robert, Alex, and Matt, created Seynani--to help people struggling with everyday sugar urges.  Seynani is an all natural dietary supplement that empowers consumers to say “No” to sugar and artificial sweeteners, “No” to empty calories and weight gain, “No” to sugar related diseases, and “Hello” to a long healthy life.


What We Need

Seynani is real.  It has been demonstrated in numerous field studies.  It absolutely, temporarily, blocks the ability to taste sweet.  What we need now is to mass produce Seynani so YOU can get it at your nearest store for the best price possible. We need your help to do that.  We're asking for $20,000 for start-up costs which will cover:

  • Labeling

  • Packaging

  • Manufacturing

  • Bottling

  • Advertising

Join the fight against sugar

Sugar has a hold over us–more powerful than we want to admit!  

The average American consumes over 130 lbs of sugar a year.  Sugar is linked to diabetes, obesity, hypertension, depression, headaches and fatigue.  By cutting out added sugar from your diet you would consume 500 fewer calories a day.  500 fewer calories adds up to significant weight loss.  Help people end sugar's hold over them.  Help people move toward living a truly healthy life.

How Seynani Works

Seynani's herbal blend naturally fills the sweet taste receptor locations on the taste buds on your tongue, thereby preventing their activation by sugar molecules.  Seynani naturally, safely, temporarily, block your ability to taste sweet.

Seynani is a conditioning tool.  By modulating the taste of sweet we can alter the brain's chemical and behavioral response to sweet.  We take away the craving for sweet by removing the taste of sweet from food naturally and temporarily.  Chocolate without sweet is only bitter.  Soft drinks  without sweet are only fizzy colored water.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.  Educate yourself about sugar.  Watch documentaries like “Sugar Coated.”  Help us put  Seynani on the market!

story:
the making  Hi INDIEGOGO. Nice to see you on my project page.

I want to offer a unique spinning top. My spinning tops were realized with hand crafted manual processing. I have been thinking what material to use. In the end I decided and chose raw steel. Other materials for choice: Stainless steel and copper. I want to let you decide which material can be the best.



This one is the smaller, minimalistic type of my Black Pearl Spinning Top.

hand polished 1,5 our procedure 

The "big boy" spinning top

My spinning tops are made for education, relaxing,  gaming and passion. The price is for everyone too, who want to have one of my black pearl.
I don´t want to be a millionaire I just want to make a little smile on your face.
Thank you for your help bring this project to life, and thank you for your time to  visiting this page.

The new model Mk 1.2

story:
The Short Version:

We’re here to help reduce consumer-level food waste by making using up leftover ingredients and prepared foods entertaining and fun.


Want more details? Here goes...

Every Time You Waste Food, A Kitten Cries

OK, that may not be exactly true (kittens are notoriously heartless toward broccoli and brussels sprouts, among other foods) but did you know that in addition to the wasted expense to you, food waste takes a toll on everyone’s environment? Some staggering statistics from the United Nations Environment Programme (get the details & source research at at the UNEP site):

  • 30% of all food in the US, worth US$48.3 billion, is thrown away each year. About half of the water used to produce this food also goes to waste, since agriculture is the largest human use of water. Additionally, organic waste is the second highest component of landfills in the US, which are the largest source of methane emissions.
  • UK households waste an estimated 6.7 million tons of food every year, around 1/3 of the 21.7 million tons purchased. Most of the food waste (61%) is avoidable and could have been eaten had it been better managed.
  • According to Canada’s Value Chain Management Centre, 51% of the country’s CA$27 billion in wasted food ends up in household trash bins. (See this CBC News story for sources & details)

Yowch. Now we’re crying.

The thing is, people know that wasting food is, well... a waste. And anyone can look up recipes to figure out what to do. But it’s all so... dull. Tedious. Yawn-worthy. A chore. Whatever word you choose, it’s the exact opposite of fun.

That’s where we come in.

Putting A Face On Food

Sad & Lonely Leftovers gives your past-prime food a personality. Go ahead and feel sorry for it. Then get cooking.

Our webseries is like TV for your fridge, but humans are encouraged to watch it too. Seriously, when was the last time your fridge actually cooked?

Each episode features a unique recipe to turn malingering leftovers into something fresh. But these aren’t just recipe videos—each one tells a story full of action, adventure, danger, or just plain drama.

The best part: there’s always a happy ending. 

And refreshments.

For 2.50 (USD) a month (math tip: that's about $30 less than the average American squanders in monthly food waste, based on the average of $1.07/day) subscribers to our series will get 4 to 5 fresh episodes—that’s a new episode every week—and access to our archive of previous episodes. 

More importantly, no leftovers will cry. And you won’t be hungry anymore.

Our Process

We started by researching the most popular leftover lookups across the top five English-language search engines to bring you the most relevant recipes possible. We also track grocery sale items across the United States and Canada to make sure those “buy in bulk and save” sales don’t leave you trapped beneath unused food items. We keep a mix of meats, veggies, grains & other items so variety is always on the menu, and we keep our food selections seasonal to ensure each new episode arrives when you need it most.

Once a leftover is selected, the research begins anew—we check again across popular search engines to see what’s already out there so we can make sure the recipes we give you each week are anything but run-of-the-mill. Special diet info? We've got that covered too.

But it doesn’t stop there, because these aren’t just cooking videos. Leftovers are more likely to be saved if they’re cute, right? So each one tells a story... that just so happens to end with something new to eat.

Entertainment + eating. Like two peas in a pod. Or a whole bunch of leftover peas turned into something fabulous and new (but you’re gonna have to wait a bit for that one... pea season is in July).


Ready To Help?

Great! We’re glad you’re here. Our Indiegogo campaign is raising funds for improving our equipment, promoting the series, and ensuring the production of weekly episodes continues until we grow our subscriber base enough to cover our operating costs. It breaks down like this:

$3500 for improved equipment. 

Right now, we’re operating on editing hardware and software that can barely keep up, and our storage capacity is filled to bursting. This part of the budget also helps improve our lighting and lets us build a mini studio to improve episode quality dramatically.

$2500 for marketing and advertising

That whole growing our subscriber base thing? It takes some doing. We’ve got the guerrilla stuff covered, but a few dollars here and there will sure help it along.

$1500 for general operations

This money helps us keep afloat until the abovementioned marketing and advertising kick in. These costs include music and sound effects licensing along with better sets, props, and costumes for our scrumptious stars.

Even if we don’t reach our complete goal, funds raised here will be channeled into the above categories to boost our production as much as possible as we build our subscription-based funding. However, we may need to scale back production to a new episode every other week if our equipment isn't improved. 

Contributor Reward Levels

Remember, any amount helps! These levels just detail specific perks. Anyone who contributes $1 or more will receive our gratitude and a shout-out on our Facebook page.

  • $25 - A one-year subscription to Sad & Lonely Leftovers plus our undying love and gratitude expressed in a personalized e-card from some of our fave leftovers, the Bad Apples.

  • $50 - A one-year subscription plus the aforementioned e-card and access to an exclusive outtakes video.
  • $100 - The above plus a Sad & Lonely Leftovers T-shirt or grocery tote. Your choice.

  • $500 - A lifetime subscription to Sad & Lonely Leftovers, plus YOU get to pick a leftover, and we’ll create an episode around it, dedicated to you.
  • $1000 - All of the above, plus a "virtual walk-on" role in your dedicated episode. What does that mean? Send us a photo or a description of yourself and we’ll style & name a character (ingredient) in the episode after you. You even get to pick the ingredient!
  • $2500 for industry pros - If you’re a food company, restaurant owner, or other foodtrepreneur, we’ll work with you to develop recipes to take care of your top three leftovers. Forget throwing good day-olds away; we’ll help you turn them into something fresh your customers will love. And you'll get that lifetime subscription, of course.
  • $2500 for the rest of us - Three personalized cooking classes via Skype or FaceTime to help you perfect new recipes for three of your favorite leftovers. We’ll work with you via email to develop recipes you’ll love, then videochat our way through a demo so you can get the technique down. Did we mention the lifetime subscription?

Can’t Help Yet?

Don’t start sobbing! We love anyone who can help us boost the signal by sharing this campaign or our website with friends, and we’d love for you to become a subscriber when the series launches on World Environment Day, June 5.

Shareable link: https://igg.me/at/sadandlonelyleftovers/x/13778653

Who We Are

Ravenous Cat Kitchen is Deb Taber, a former professional cook and theater production designer turned writer and editor, and Robert Bland, an independent film producer, publisher, and writer. Somehow, all these skills got stirred together and baked into what you see here. 

Deb's particular penchant for saving leftovers came from working as a cook at a women's monastery. Reducing waste while providing tasty, healthy, home-cooked meals was a key component of her work, and with a captive dining audience, turning leftovers into something new and unexpected was a crucial part of keeping everyone happy.

Rob's years of work on both Hollywood and independent films have given him an eye for shooting and editing our series. Deb stirs up the trouble. Rob makes it look good.

Team RavCat also includes Stefanie Batten-Bland, an unending source of creativity and all-around all-star, as our social media and outreach coordinator.
