story:
Mary's Reflexology & Trinity Healing

  • Started by Mary Filippi and Kais Khatib both with 5+ years exp
  • We want to offer several holistic modalities to help the community
  • We have advanced treatments, sauna, foods and services
  • Funding could allow us to expand and offer services that are currently not in the area 


Reason for funding

  • We need around $50,000 or more for meditation floating chambers
  • None of our treatments are available in our area, and are rare
  • Whether we reach our goal or not, funding will go towards high end care

The Impact

Contributing to this project will allow us to reach many people in need of alternative health. We are dedicated to educating clients in natural wellness

  • Currently many people are searching for a new way to heal naturally.
  • What we currently offer has had an immediate impact on clients health.
  • Our goal is to cure what many may call "non-curable" ailments.

Risks & Challenges

Natural health and wellness is new to some people, we may have to advertise special offers to help promote to those who don't know much about it currently.

  • With the new age of social media & technology we have tools to advertise.
  • Between the internet and different advertising methods, Many can be reached.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Anyone can contribute to our effort, even just by talking about our center!
  • Please share our passion with Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Last year, as 6th graders,  we created our school's first all-girls' robotics team. We took part in the First Lego League (FLL) Robotics Competition. At the Silicon Valley FLL Competition, we received 1st place in the Innovation Solution Award.

Our Innovative Solution:

Have you ever had your day ruined by stepping on a piece of used chewing gum? Not only does gum stick to your shoes, but with 100,000 tons of chewing gum consumed every year, gum is also filling up our landfills. Therefore, we worked together to develop a way to reduce gum’s impact on our environment. 

Our innovative solution was to make biodegradable gum. We developed a patent-pending compostable chewing gum that will lessen the burden on landfills.

Now we are seeking your help to secure our patent, which will allow us to continue our innovative work - we want to change the world with every chew!

We are asking for $5,000 for our project.

The money will be used for applying for a patent ($3,000), kitchen safety and hygiene training  ($1,000), and supplies for our first commercial batch of flavored gum ($1,000). As part of our food safety plan, we will get the proper permits and licenses necessary to produce our gum. We are trying to get a special designation as a "cottage industry" in our home kitchen, to keep our costs lower.

People who donate will be among the first to sample our new gum flavors, and may even have the opportunity to select a new flavor for us to make!

Why donate?

On the internet, if you look up “Does gum biodegrade?” most sites will say, “Nope, it lasts forever.” The reason why most existing gums do not break down is because they are made from latex, which is the same substance used to make rubber. As anyone who has seen an old spare tire left by the side of the road can attest, rubber does not readily biodegrade, and the same goes for gum. To address this problem, we have invented a gum that uses all natural ingredients along with a food-safe mold. So, it will not only biodegrade, but it will biodegrade faster than competing all natural gums.  While there currently exist a handful of gums on the market made from natural ingredients, none contain an active agent to make the gum compost-friendly.

Furthermore, in sugar-free gums, xylitol and sorbitol are often used as its sweetening agent.  However, those sweeteners are poisonous to animals such as dogs.  And, the long-term impact to the environment of xylitol and sorbitol gums are unknown.

 Our gum will only use sustainable, natural ingredients that can be consumed safely and will break down properly in composting sites to ensure we do not waste the earth’s precious resources.

History of the name of our gum:

Aplidium is the Latin word for ecology. We wanted something that would represent our commitment to the environment, and to sustainability. 

Aplidium is also the name of an ocean-dwelling species, the sea squirt. The ocean is always a big inspiration for us because we live in Pacifica, which is a beach town!

To the word Aplidium, we added the word "gum," to put our own, special spin on it.

Hint: if you cannot pronounce Aplidigum, you can always say "a little gum," really fast, and it sounds almost the same.

Our journey:

We began this journey when we formed an all-girls' robotics team, and competed in the First Lego League (FLL) Robotics Competition in San Mateo. As part of the competition, we were asked to identify a problem related to trash, and then to find a solution. 

We were thrilled to win the Project Award for our gum! From there, we went to the Regional Championships for the Silicon Valley area, and won first prize in the Innovative Solution Awards.

We were also invited to apply for the National Innovative Solution Award Competition in Washington, D.C. Our team worked hard on our application and we were ready to do whatever it took to get ourselves to the capital. Unfortunately, we weren't selected among the global applicants, but we haven't let that slow us down.

Our team was also selected to present about Girls and Robotics at the Makers' Faire, of San Mateo County. There, we presented our story in front of a large audience, and shared our great success in making our biodegradable gum. After the presentation, we were approached by Hasbro and they asked if we wanted to collaborate with them on a project!

Now, we want to take our project to the next level. Our plan is to produce our gum in a certified kitchen, package it, and sell it commercially. To do this, we need our patent and some starter funds to get our project going.

Risks & Challenges:

Some obstacles we may face are competition from the big manufacturers of commercial gum, like Trident, Orbit and Hubba Bubba. We aren't a giant corporation, just a small group of 7th graders, who want to change the world with every chew.

Another challenge is spreading the word about our amazing gum, but with your help, you can let many more people know about Aplidigum.

Please support us by sharing this Indiegogo campaign, and putting it on your social media, whether it be Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, etc.

Thank you for your support, and helping us to make our environmental dream a reality!

To address this problem, we have invented a gum that uses all natural ingredients along with a food-safe mold. So, it will not only biodegrade, but it will biodegrade faster than competing all natural gums.  While there currently exist a handful of gums on the market made from natural ingredients, none contain an active agent to make the gum compost-friendly.

Furthermore, in sugar-free gums, xylitol and sorbitol are often used as its sweetening agent.  However, those sweeteners are poisonous to animals such as dogs.  And, the long-term impact to the environment of xylitol and sorbitol gums are unknown.
 Our gum will only use sustainable, natural ingredients that can be consumed safely and will break down properly in composting sites to ensure we do not waste the earth’s precious resources.
History of the name of our gum:
Aplidium is the Latin word for ecology. We wanted something that would represent our commitment to the environment, and to sustainability. 
Aplidium is also the name of an ocean-dwelling species, the sea squirt. The ocean is always a big inspiration for us because we live in Pacifica, which is a beach town!

To the word Aplidium, we added the word "gum," to put our own, special spin on it.
Hint: if you cannot pronounce Aplidigum, you can always say "a little gum," really fast, and it sounds almost the same.

Our journey:
We began this journey when we formed an all-girls' robotics team, and competed in the First Lego League (FLL) Robotics Competition in San Mateo. As part of the competition, we were asked to identify a problem related to trash, and then to find a solution. 
We were thrilled to win the Project Award for our gum! From there, we went to the Regional Championships for the Silicon Valley area, and won first prize in the Innovative Solution Awards.
We were also invited to apply for the National Innovative Solution Award Competition in Washington, D.C. Our team worked hard on our application and we were ready to do whatever it took to get ourselves to the capital. Unfortunately, we weren't selected among the global applicants, but we haven't let that slow us down.

Our team was also selected to present about Girls and Robotics at the Makers' Faire, of San Mateo County. There, we presented our story in front of a large audience, and shared our great success in making our biodegradable gum. After the presentation, we were approached by Hasbro and they asked if we wanted to collaborate with them on a project!


Now, we want to take our project to the next level. Our plan is to produce our gum in a certified kitchen, package it, and sell it commercially. To do this, we need our patent and some starter funds to get our project going.   
Risks & Challenges:
Some obstacles we may face are competition from the big manufacturers of commercial gum, like Trident, Orbit and Hubba Bubba. We aren't a giant corporation, just a small group of 7th graders, who want to change the world with every chew. Another challenge is spreading the word about our amazing gum, but with your help, you can let many more people know about Aplidigum.
Please support us by sharing this Indiegogo campaign, and putting it on your social media, whether it be Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, etc.
Thank you for your support, and helping us to make our environmental dream a reality!

story:
Bring the audiophile experience with you.

It is a USB DAC/Soundcard, Headphone amplifier and Remote controlled preamp 3 in 1.  Listening to music in your local cafe, your office and on the move will never be the same.  At home it is the centre of your high fidelity audio system.

Hear everything in your music.

A key feature of the Conductor Air is its TPA6120A headphone amp chip. This is a reference class headphone amplifier chip typically featured in desktop audio and pro-audio applications.  This chip however is avoided by conventional portable designs due to its high voltage requirement.  To fully utilize this chip, we had to develop a unique voltage rising circuitry which converts the 5V DC USB power to 18V DC.  This 4 folds increase in voltage supply drove the TPA6120A chip to its full potential.  As a result, the Air outputs 500mW into 32 ohm and nearly 4 times the dynamic range compared to typical USB powered audio devices.  The Air delivers desktop amp performance in a pocket size device.

Remove the sound-card bottle-neck.

The Conductor Air features the same references class ESS9018 DAC chip as its full size sibling. The DAC chip is teamed with the all new Burson V5i Hybrid audio opamp, allowing any digital source to stream bit perfect audio with the highest level of definition and accuracy.


Connect to just about everything.

The XMOS USB interface offers the highest level of connectivity from desktop Windows based PC and Mac OSX to major mobile platforms such as Apple iOS and Androids.  It can even play back audiophile quality formats such as DSD256/DXD and 32bit/384khz audio files. For Android devices which support OTG, the Air draws power from the device.  For iPhone and iPad, an external 5v power bank is needed.

Control what you hear, with style.

With 100 steps of volume control, the Air is a smooth operator as a headphone amplifier or a preamp for your home audio system.  The Air enclosure and its remote control are both machined from solid blocks of high density aluminum. They are then brushed and anodized with distinctive Burson styling.

Ready for Production

The design is finalised and ready for production.  With your support, we'll start production soon and delivery in late August. 

Perks:

We are again teaming with Audeze, the premium US planar magnetic headphone maker, to deliver the best value-for-money Perks for fellow headphone audio enthusiasts.  The Audeze phones are known to team perfectly with Burson headphone amplifiers and the Conductor Air is no exception.

story:
Please Help Me Fight for Scotland and Become A World Champion! 
My name is Andrew Ewen. I'm 15 and am very proud to have been selected by WKC Scotland to compete at the World Kickboxing Championships in Dublin at the end of October.

I don't have a lot of disposable income (in fact I don't have much of an income at all!) so I'm looking for a little bit of help to make sure that I can afford to attend all squad training sessions and cover the costs of travel, accommodation and equipment for the trip.

If you can spare a few £s to help me on my way I'd really appreciate it! I can't offer you much in return, just a shout out on social media, but even a small donation will make a massive difference to me!

If I'm lucky enough to achieve more than my target amount I would like to donate the extra money to the rest of the WKC Scotland Squad and make a donation to the Joanna Brown Trust (who provided me with a small grant towards the cost of my training).

story:
Short Summary

Hello!  My name is Edwina Wright, Founder and President of Clenapure Botanical Body Products.  I began making soaps in my kitchen and started selling them at home spa parties and craft shows.  Soon afterwards, I committed to using only plant-based ingredients after discovering that what we apply to our skin is quickly absorbed into our bloodstreams.  After adding other natural bath and body products to my repertoire such as lotions, body scrubs, and body oils, Clenapure was born!

I am planning a relaunch of my entire line of Clenapure products.  Although Clenapure is currently being sold in local spas, health food and traditional grocery stores, I realize that I need to update my product packaging in order to compete more effectively in the holistic bath and body marketplace.  My new packaging will therefore depict the clean, wholesome, wellness-oriented attributes that characterize Clenapure products, which are made with pure ingredients such as:

Fruit and Nut Oils and Butters (vs. Petroleum-Based Oils)

Pure Essential Oils (vs. Chemically-Based Fragrance Oils)

Coconut Oil-Based Foaming Cleansers (vs. Sulfates)

Floral Waters

Organic Herbal and Fruit Extracts

Vitamins and Minerals

No Parabens or Dyes

I am seeking your help to finance a robust relaunch of Clenapure so that I can continue to give consumers a "clean and green" alternative to their skin, bath and body care regimen, as well as expand Clenapure's reach into upscale retailers.  Read below to find out how your contributions will also help fight bullying and prevent child abuse.

 Interview on Fox 59 Indianapols Morning News

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $56,000.  These funds will be used for the following:

  • Cover the expense of new, more holistic and spa-like packaging
  • Cover the expense of new labels with more visually appealing graphics
  • Finance the first run of each of my 4 Sulfate-Free Body Washes, 3 Nutrient-Rich Body Oils, 3 Body Scrubs (1 made with organic sugar and 2 made with mineral-rich Himalayan pink salt), and Fluide Body Moisturizer -- all in their new packaging!!  (See video for a glimpse the of new packaging!)
  • Provide financing for digital marketing campaigns to build the Clenapure brand and increase consumer awareness of Clenapure Botanicals
  • Finance trade show participation (spa and specialty retailers) in January 2017 to market Clenapure to the masses.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?  I'm glad you asked!  Since Clenapure is already in production, you will definitely receive your Clenapure product(s), based on your level of contribution.  However, you will receive your Clenapure products in its current packaging vs. the new packaging….and you will get to experience just how wonderful Clenapure products are for you and your health.  That's because our Clenapure products are made with plant-based, clean, wholesome ingredients. So no worries about absorbing toxins into your body! 

In The Media

Clenapure Botanical Body Products have received several media mentions in outlets such as:             


Testimonials

Clenapure products have received several raving reviews!  Here are a few of them…..

  • "I LOVE your Clenapure products!  The body wash is great!  I've tried other natural body washes and they don't seem to lather very well.  Your product lathers up very well an smells fantastic!  I love the body lotion too.  It makes my skin feel so soft and smooth and yet it doesn't feel oily or greasy."   ~K. Dolan; Missouri
  • "I met the Clenapure spokesperson at a Kroger Grand Re-Opening and tried the tester of the Clenapure Patchouli Oil.  I live in Bloomington, IN and found your display at the College Mall Kroger and purchased some.  It is heavenly and gentle on my skin!  I am a swimmer and a runner and the summer takes a toll on my 50+ year-old skin.  This oil is not heavy (my initial concern) and has a nice lasting effect post-shower, -swim, etc.  Thanks for a swell product!" ~ K. Kovich; Indiana
  • "I really enjoy your Clenapure lotion.  The first thing that I noticed about it is that it has a fresh, clean smell and it wasn't until sometime later that I realized that was probably why it was given the name Clenapure.  It feels really good on my skin and gives it just the right amount of sheen without being oily'" ~ K. Fluker;  Maryland
  • I recently purchased a few Clenapure items and I was blown away!  I especially liked their bar soaps and their body oils! ~ J. Bowen, New Jersey
  • Clenapure offers a great plant-based body care line that smells great, it's all natural, better for the environment, and better for your skin." ~J. Barnett, KTLA 5 Morning News, Los Angeles


The Impact

In addition to your adapting a healthier skin regimen through the use of Clenapure's non-toxic bath and body products, and your helping to implement a strategic relaunch of Clenapure with enhanced marketing and rebranding efforts, your contributions will also help to make life healthier and more peaceful for those who are suffering. 

Clenapure has partnered with Angels and Doves, a nationwide 501c(3) non-profit charity that travels across the country to prevent bullying, bullying injuries, and bullying suicides.  Clenapure has also partnered with The Villages of Indiana, a fully licensed and accredited child and family services agency that fights child abuse by working to support every child's right to a safe, permanent and nurturing home.  A portion of your contributions will be donated to Angels and Doves and The Villages of Indiana.  After all,  no one can have a healthy mind and body, nor live a healthy life, if it is a life filled with violence and shame.  Please help us to help those who can't help themselves!





Risks & Challenges

There is no risk to you if you contribute to this campaign.  That is because you will still receive your Clenapure products…in its current packaging.  However, the success of our campaign will enable us to relaunch Clenapure with appealing spa-like packaging MUCH SOONER rather than later… as well as provide the means for us to hire a branding expert and social media strategist.  We have the opportunity to  present Clenapure to television shopping channels, but we feel that we will have better success with "new and improved" packaging….and we would greatly appreciate your contributions to help us achieve this!  Plus, it would be very beneficial to exhibit Clenapure at the aforementioned January 2017 trade show so that we can market Clenapure to spas and specialty retailers, on a larger scale, and help grow our customer base at a faster pace.  As a reminder, your contributions will also help The Villages and Angels & Doves continue their fights against child abuse and bullying, respectively.

Other Ways You Can Help

We certainly understand that some people cannot make a financial contribution.  But guess what?!  You can still help by spreading the word about Clenapure's fundraiser throughout your network!  So, please!  Go and "tell it on the mountains!" by using the Facebook and Twitter share buttons at the top right of our campaign page.  We would greatly appreciate your help in getting this word out!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q. Are your current product formulations that same as the formulations that will go into your new Clenapure packaging?

A. Yes.  All formulations are the same with the exception of the Clenapure Tropics Body Polish (scrub).  The current Tropics Body Polish formulation contains essential oils of Lime and Ylang Ylang.  However, the new Tropics Scrub formulation will contain essential oils of Lime and Petitgrain.

Q. Can I change the mixture of my package product selection vs the package offerings listed in your campaign?

A. No.  That's because we wanted to ensure that each backer would receive a package with at least one body cleanser and one body moisturizer so that you can achieve the total Clenapure holistic bath and body care experience.  However, there is an offering for only the Clenapure Olive Oil Soaps.

Q. Since your package offerings contain several products, how can I ensure that I will receive the exact product scents that I want?

A.  You will receive a survey from Backerkit after your commitment to contribute to this campaign.  On this survey you will be able to make your selection of the exact scent that you want for each product included in each package.

Q. Can I contribute at more than one level of your campaign?

A. Yes.  You will have the opportunity "add on" the $5 level (as many times as you choose) during your checkout process.  Thank you!!!

story:
«This time I'll take a travel diary... » (never finished as usual)
«What were we doing in that photo?»
«Wow...what a nice view, I'll write my impressions down later at the hotel»
«What have we seen first? The temple or the museum?»

These are just a few of the things we say during or after a travel and these are the reasons that have inspired us while designing Travelogr.

What is Travelogr

Travelogr is a project made for people who love traveling and sharing their experience. Using a simple app you can share your travel story, map your movements, take photos, videos and notes in real time and without connection problems and everything is collected in just one web page. 


Connection and signal bars won't be your problem anymore: the app will post to your personal Travelogr page automatically when your smartphone will find a suitable connection.

The web site will collect every traveler's journey log, and will become a repository to browse before your next trip. Of course each user could decide who (if any) can see their trip, their trip details and how.

What Travelogr has that other apps don't have

  • Travelogr will keep all the info regarding your trip in the natural, chronological order. All of your trips will be stored in just one place, where you (or the people with whom you have decided to share) can read them: a true journal of your travels. 
  • with Travelogr you will have all the social functions you will need during your journey, in just one convenient app without having to use different apps for mapping, logging, posting pictures, sharing videos etc.. 
  • network issues, checking if the post uploaded correctly, etc are not your problem anymore: Travelogr will publish your content automatically, keeping the chronological order, whenever there is a good internet connection, optimizing battery and internet usage, while you enjoy your adventure. 


  • Travelogr will create a vast repository of journeys categorized by destination, mean of transport, time of the year, and many other tags (kids, with animals, weather..) so it will become a reference to browse while planning your next trip

Travelogr is for you if...
  1. if you love traveling slowly (boat, horse, motorcycle, bike, foot, car) and you can't, or won't always have time to "call home", with Travelogr your dear ones will always be informed where you are, and what you are doing.
  2. if you like running or cycling over long distance races or trails: family and supporters  can follow you easily on the web site and know exactly where you are and will be so they could be right there and give you water, food, friendly cheers and a shot a nice picture, and also they will be able to know when you will cut the finish line. And what's more with Travelogr it's easier to shot pictures and track the race while running or biking.
  3. if you like traveling following your passion, be it art nouveau architecture, wonderful bookstores, old industrial age factories or just a simple week end walking around a new city, everything can become an itinerary to share with who has the same passion
  4. if you are a parent and your child is doing her first travel alone or with friends: you will always know where she is without having to wait for a text msg or phone call.

What is the campaign for
We have done a rough prototype one year ago and we have used it on the Santiago way, then we have spent some months thinking about the features we would like to have in the app and on the web site.
We have some preliminary graphics done by our exceptional designer, and we are ready to write our true first alpha version of the app (just on iOS, to meet the perk deadline) and the web site, but we need your help. 
this is the project timeline:
  • 15th Novembre 2015: Alpha version of iOS app and web site
  • 15th January 2016: Beta version of iOS app and Alpha version of Android app
  • 15th March 2016: Beta version of web site
  • July 2016: version 1.0 of iOS app and web site.
By funding more you can help us change the timeline, depending on the funding we reach during the campaign:

  • 8.000 $ (Summer goal): we'll anticipate on the 31st of July the release of a alpha version of the app deciding which OS, among Android or iOS, based on the most funded perk between Passionate Logger and Fervent Logger. 
  • 15.000 $: we’ll also anticipate on the 31st of July the release of the alpha version of the app for the other operating system (see summer goal)
  • 28.000 $ (goal reached): we will have beta version of both Android and iOS apps on the 15th of November
  • goal exceeded!: timeline is contracted, and releases are anticipated! 
  • goal exceeded by more than 8.000$: Alpha version of app Windows Phone

Features of Travelogr

  • alpha version of app: logging, picture and text sharing. Very simple connection/battery optimization
  • alpha version of web site: very basic website where travel data will be collected and published. Sharing is done by users by sending to friends a private url.
  • beta version of app: Added social sharing via app, and better connection/battery optimization
  • beta version of web site: simple user profiling, and simple sharing of travels with friends. Social integration, and tagging. Site is searchable
  • version 1.0 of app: heavy battery/connection optimization, full social features.
  • version 1.0 of web site: complete user profiling and travel tagging. Fine grained preferences for sharing (or not sharing) travels with friends. Site is fully searchable

Why flexible funding?
We have carefully planned our project so as to be feasible even if we don't reach the final goal.
Of course reaching the goal will shorten the development time, and will enable us to distribute the Alpha and Beta version of the app to a committed community of supporters, without having to search for private business angels or other investors. 
On the other hand, no matter the amount of funding collected on Indiegogo, if you have chosen a perk that includes the Alpha version of the app, you can be sure you will still be a Travelogr, it will just take a little bit more time to release the Alpha version for you to use!
story_txt:
«This time I'll take a travel diary... » (never finished as usual)«What were we doing in that photo?»«Wow...what a nice view, I'll write my impressions down later at the hotel»«What have we seen first? The temple or the museum?»

These are just a few of the things we say during or after a travel and these are the reasons that have inspired us while designing Travelogr.
What is Travelogr
Travelogr is a project made for people who love traveling and sharing their experience. Using a simple app you can share your travel story, map your movements, take photos, videos and notes in real time and without connection problems and everything is collected in just one web page. 







Connection and signal bars won't be your problem anymore: the app will post to your personal Travelogr page automatically when your smartphone will find a suitable connection.


The web site will collect every traveler's journey log, and will become a repository to browse before your next trip. Of course each user could decide who (if any) can see their trip, their trip details and how.
What Travelogr has that other apps don't have

Travelogr will keep all the info regarding your trip in the natural, chronological order. All of your trips will be stored in just one place, where you (or the people with whom you have decided to share) can read them: a true journal of your travels. 

with Travelogr you will have all the social functions you will need during your journey, in just one convenient app without having to use different apps for mapping, logging, posting pictures, sharing videos etc.. 


network issues, checking if the post uploaded correctly, etc are not your problem anymore: Travelogr will publish your content automatically, keeping the chronological order, whenever there is a good internet connection, optimizing battery and internet usage, while you enjoy your adventure. 







Travelogr will create a vast repository of journeys categorized by destination, mean of transport, time of the year, and many other tags (kids, with animals, weather..) so it will become a reference to browse while planning your next trip




Travelogr is for you if...



if you love traveling slowly (boat, horse, motorcycle, bike, foot, car) and you can't, or won't always have time to "call home", with Travelogr your dear ones will always be informed where you are, and what you are doing.


if you like running or cycling over long distance races or trails: family and supporters  can follow you easily on the web site and know exactly where you are and will be so they could be right there and give you water, food, friendly cheers and a shot a nice picture, and also they will be able to know when you will cut the finish line. And what's more with Travelogr it's easier to shot pictures and track the race while running or biking.


if you like traveling following your passion, be it art nouveau architecture, wonderful bookstores, old industrial age factories or just a simple week end walking around a new city, everything can become an itinerary to share with who has the same passion


if you are a parent and your child is doing her first travel alone or with friends: you will always know where she is without having to wait for a text msg or phone call.


What is the campaign forWe have done a rough prototype one year ago and we have used it on the Santiago way, then we have spent some months thinking about the features we would like to have in the app and on the web site.We have some preliminary graphics done by our exceptional designer, and we are ready to write our true first alpha version of the app (just on iOS, to meet the perk deadline) and the web site, but we need your help. this is the project timeline:



15th Novembre 2015: Alpha version of iOS app and web site


15th January 2016: Beta version of iOS app and Alpha version of Android app


15th March 2016: Beta version of web site


July 2016: version 1.0 of iOS app and web site.


By funding more you can help us change the timeline, depending on the funding we reach during the campaign:



8.000 $ (Summer goal): we'll anticipate on the 31st of July the release of a alpha version of the app deciding which OS, among Android or iOS, based on the most funded perk between Passionate Logger and Fervent Logger. 


15.000 $: we’ll also anticipate on the 31st of July the release of the alpha version of the app for the other operating system (see summer goal)


28.000 $ (goal reached): we will have beta version of both Android and iOS apps on the 15th of November


goal exceeded!: timeline is contracted, and releases are anticipated! 


goal exceeded by more than 8.000$: Alpha version of app Windows Phone


Features of Travelogr



alpha version of app: logging, picture and text sharing. Very simple connection/battery optimization


alpha version of web site: very basic website where travel data will be collected and published. Sharing is done by users by sending to friends a private url.


beta version of app: Added social sharing via app, and better connection/battery optimization


beta version of web site: simple user profiling, and simple sharing of travels with friends. Social integration, and tagging. Site is searchable


version 1.0 of app: heavy battery/connection optimization, full social features.


version 1.0 of web site: complete user profiling and travel tagging. Fine grained preferences for sharing (or not sharing) travels with friends. Site is fully searchable




Why flexible funding?We have carefully planned our project so as to be feasible even if we don't reach the final goal.Of course reaching the goal will shorten the development time, and will enable us to distribute the Alpha and Beta version of the app to a committed community of supporters, without having to search for private business angels or other investors. On the other hand, no matter the amount of funding collected on Indiegogo, if you have chosen a perk that includes the Alpha version of the app, you can be sure you will still be a Travelogr, it will just take a little bit more time to release the Alpha version for you to use!

story:
Mathaios (Matt Matt) Kitchens

Our youngest son Mathaios has autism and is such a brave young boy!

  • My name is Kelly and I am a stay at home mother to two precious little boys and two step sons who are with us on the weekends and most of the summer.
  • We Are trying to raise funds to get saftey and therapy equipment for Matt Matt.
  • Matt Matt has been diagnosed with Autism and has a very bad tendancy to try and wander away and also his instinct is to run when anyone calls to him or tries to pick him up. He also has severe sensory integration problems which can make his daily life very restricted and debilitating to do some of the most simple tasks.
  • Did you know that the average family will spend almost $60,000 a year to cover costs of raising a child with autism including therapies, tests, safety equipment, therapy equipment and doctors appointments to name a few.

Mathaios is a joy to be around and absolutely captures everyone he meets with his dynamic personality.

Our Main Goals....

Our main goals are to raise funds for a fence around a house to keep him safe from wandering and to attain a therapy preasure roller to help give him the sensory input he needs to stay calm.

  • We asked for the specific amount of $6550 because the estimate for the fence is just under $6000 and the therapy roller that was recommended is $550.
  • An example of the roller is here; 
    • http://www.southpawenterprises.com/Weight/SouthpawsSteamrollerDeluxe.asp
  • If we don't reach our goal or have extra after the fence and roller any funds will be placed into a savings account for Mathaios for his educational expenses or any other safety and therapy equipment recommended by his therapists.z

The Impact

Did you know that one in every 68 children is diagnosed with autism, and even worse one in every 42 boys is diagnosed and those numbers grow every year. There is no known specific cause for this mental illness and no cure. 

  • in 2009-2011 the leading cause of accidental deaths in Children with ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) is drowning accounting for 91% of deaths. the case of the deaths is typically due to these childrens unintentional wandering.
  • In the properties surrounding our house there are three different ponds that as you can imagine pose an extreme danger for Matt Matt as he loves to try and wander off.
  • With your help we can help keep Matt Matt safe and happy enclosed in the yard where he can play freely without the danger and threat of what lies beyond our home.

Its ok if you don't have the funds to help!

I myself understand completely the fact that sometimes you just don't have the funds to help people you want to you could also help Matt Matt by....

  • sharing this campaign on social media or with your friends or family
  • or a simple prayer or thought for matt matt is always appreciated

Thank you so much for reading and helping! Matt Matt and our family appreciate it more than you can imagine to keep him safe!

story:
Here's the problem we've grappled with at BeThere24:  

When we call our aging parents (who live independently) many miles away (we're in NY, they're in FL), we worry if this will be the time they don't answer! Are they okay? Has something happened to them? 

We've said to ourselves there must be something out there to help us keep a long distance eye on our loved ones!  And we are not alone, all of our friends have the same concerns.  
So this is what we did..... 

Over the past year, we've worked on coming up with a system that discreetly monitors the activity in our parent's home. If something out of the ordinary happens, we are alerted immediately via text or voice message.  We've also connected our system with a 24/7 monitoring service, so if we're not available, our parents are still in good hands.

And now we know what’s going-on with Mom and Dad!  


Here's the story............. 

Young and old, crave more then ever their independence and active life-styles.

Institutional long term healthcare is a worst case scenario.



Option #1 is to remain in the comfort and familiarity of your own home.


But this scenario has its anxiety-ridden moments:

Mom is not answering the phone!  Where is she? Has something happened? What can I do?

What if she fell down and was unable to get up. 


Here’s the solution we came up with:

BeThere24 is creating a smart technology using wireless sensors placed discreetly throughout the home that monitors routines and activities.  


Our technology then determines an algorithm of those routines and activities to determine the norm, and that which is outside the norm.

If an event occurs outside the norm, an alert is sent to a 24/7 monitoring service and to care givers.  If an emergency, EMS is automatically dispatched, and you're also immediately informed.


Here's why we're a good investment:

Baby boomers are reaching the senior age of 65+ at a rate of 8000 daily, adding 3 million a year to the 43,000,000 seniors already living in the US. 


So we have plenty of markets to concentrate our efforts on.  But intend to concentrate on only a few to begin with.


The BeThere24 service includes many types of monitoring, including:

  • Pill dispenser sensors
  • Tracking of visitors’ arrivals and departures
  • Outside fall sensors and GPS location
  • Nursing aides arrival and departures
  • Appliances running needlessly
  • Temperatures and general conditions of the living environment

    • BeThere24 offers a residential system, and is currently working on perfecting a commercial system to be installed in senior living facilities, nursing homes, and hospitals.

    The BeThere24 system can be installed for as little as $199, and professionally monitored 24/7 for as little as $30 a month.

    Install a BeThere24 system and take the stress and worry out of your life knowing your loved ones are okay living happily in their own home.

    Our goal for raising funds is $65,000. We need these funds for the following:

    • Enhance our Dashboard to make User Friendly (+/- $40,000)
    • Create the Mobile App  (+/- $15,000)
    • Improve company website (+/- $5,000)
    • Roll out aggressive SEO program (+/- $25,000)
    • Direct Market strategically through home security industry

    We have put in substantial capital to date, but need your help to take us over the finish line.



    This is who we are......

    Management Team

    James Heins, CEO,  Heins is the visionary who has been at the forefront of many successful starts-ups.  It may be the fact that he started his professional career as a Professional Baseball Player with the Detroit Tigers. That winning competitive spirit has been extended into his business paths. He has been in Executive Management within manufacturing, distribution and development for the past 25 years. Heins is a graduate of Vanderbilt University in Tenessesse.

    Robert B. Mytelka, COO, specializes in start-up operations, sales and marketing in Franchise, Food, Lawn/Garden, Real Estate, and Technology companies. His specialties are in product development, marketing, consumer research, operations, and budgeting.  He has operated a multi-channel distribution business in consumer goods. He sits on the boards of several educational institutions, and not for profit organizations.  Mytelka is a graduate of Alfred University in New York, and Oxford University, Oxford, England.

    Walter Lara, CTO, specializes in Home Automation,Computer Networking, Security Installations, Access Control, Web Design, and has managed IT services for business and residential customers.  His technical acumen includes technologies in home automation, universal remote, computing diagnostics, OS, OSX, Windows, Linux, OSX Server, Google AppsDatabase, Filemaker, Access, and MySQL.  He has designed, programmed, and installed dozens of elaborate smart home systems.  Lara is a graduate of Florida International University.

    Samuel Mytelka, CPA, Assistant to CFO, is an experienced tax accountant with specialties in partnership tax returns, trust tax returns, due diligence in retail operations, technology and software. Mr. Mytelka graduated from University of Houston, C.T. Bauer College of Business; and City University of New York-Brooklyn College, BS , Accounting.


    Risks and Challenges

    As with all startups, our biggest challenge will be to bring our service to the right market in the quickest time frame possible.  We plan a two-prong attack to the market.  One, develop a DIY market for our product.  We must develop a fresh website, and the SEO push to bring prospects our way.  At the same time, further develop our product for that DIY marketplace.  Two, work with existing strategic alliances in the home security industry, and offer their existing customers a senior monitoring plug-in to their existing customer base.  These alliances provide us with over ten million prospective customers. They have also  agreed to assist us in our marketing effort.

    Competition does exist, and this is good, for we are certain of the proof of concept. They are priced at double the price we are, and do not offer the variety of services that we do, such as 24/7 professional monitoring.  Further, the big players in the PERS (Personal Emergency Response Systems), such as ADT, Medical Alert, and Life Line Systems concentrate solely on wearables, and single station panic devices.  Wearables are rarely worn, particularly in the shower, and when going to bed, the time and place where the greatest number of mishaps take place.  The push button panic devices require ability and presence of mind to press the button. 

    BeThere24 is confident that its unique product that includes 

    •  24/7 professional monitoring
    •  and/or self-monitoring
    •  dynamic mobile app
    •  non-obtrusive sensor devices
    •  2-way communications with seniors
    •  relationships with national monitoring companies
    We believe these will provide us a first position in the race to capture the most important growth segment in the home security/PERS market.

story:
If you couldn’t move your arms above your waist, how would you feed yourself? Scratch an itch? Open a door? Lots of kids face these problems every day, that is why we created Magic Arms.

Emma's Story


Our Story

Over 50,000 children in the U.S. and more than 500,000 children worldwide suffer from rare diseases and conditions that prevent them from using their arms. We founded Magic Arms to bring a life-changing 3D-printed exoskeleton to these children so they can do what was once impossible, like hugging their parents, brushing their teeth, feeding themselves, or just playing a game. This technology works and has changed children’s lives, but it is not yet accessible to many children. We need your help to set up care centers so children can get their own Magic Arms and fulfill our waiting list of over 200 children. Our stretch goals will fund a redesign of our exoskeleton (the “Magic Arms orthotic”), and bring Magic Arms to kids who do not have access to health care.

What We're Doing Now

We are partnering with leading children’s hospitals to develop care centers to help more children and families worldwide. Working with the top doctors and researchers, we will continue to collect crucial feedback on children’s outcomes with Magic Arms. This will give us the insight we need to improve our product and expand medical reimbursement. 

What We Need to Give Kids Magic Arms

Our distribution of the Magic Arms orthotic is bottle-necked because there is only one care center and only one trained expert who can fit kids with Magic Arms. Your donation will help us set up regional care centers, train clinicians to fit the device, and create an inventory that can meet the current and growing demand for Magic Arms. 

Our Care Centers

After our immediate distribution needs are met, we will begin a redesign of the Magic Arms orthotic to make it less expensive, improved outcomes, and expand health care reimbursement. This is a crucial step in bringing Magic Arms to more than 500,000 children worldwide. Working with expert medical device designers, such as Kablooe Design in Minneapolis, we aim to cut the total cost of the Magic Arms orthotic in half. We will accomplish this by making the device easier to manufacture, assemble, and fit to children. 

Once we meet our goal of funding care centers and our product redesign, all incremental donations will bring Magic Arms to kids who do not have access to affordable care. We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and all donations are tax deductible.

Our Goals


Our Timeline


Our Team


Broader Impacts

Supporting Magic Arms will help bring a solution to children with arm muscle disabilities, and it will also forge a new path for treating rare conditions. In the U.S., conditions affecting less than 200,000 people are considered Orphan Medical conditions that receive less support and attention from large medical device manufacturers. Magic Arms uses cutting edge technology to find a solution to address these conditions, demonstrating that human ingenuity and generosity can help children and families live a better life.

Risks & Challenges

Magic Arms technology is evolving with real time feedback from medical professionals, patients, and families. Over 100 kids have benefited from the Magic Arms orthotic, but we know we can make a much larger impact. First, we need to open centers and study patients to collect outcomes data to improve our product design and reimbursement. We need to provide devices to doctors and researchers at children's hospitals, train them to fit the Magic Arms orthotic to each child, and identify strengths and design challenges of the Magic Arms orthotic.

Primary Challenges

  1. Diagnosing each child properly to make sure they can benefit from Magic Arms

  2. Making it simple enough to assemble that it can be put on a child properly without much guidance

  3. Shrinking the technology so it is less obstructive but still has the strength needed

We are qualified to overcome these hurdles because:

  1. Our research and analytics team will help us learn what is needed to identify good candidates for Magic Arms and develop a protocol to do a successful assembly and fit

  2. We are using skilled and experienced medical device engineers and designers to redesign the device

Our plan to solve these hurdles:

  1. Develop relationships with leading medical professionals to help us assess child outcomes and incorporate feedback

  2. Focus on these items as priorities in the R&D portion of the project

  3. Use rapid prototyping and testing to improve the designs quickly


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! We are looking for:

  1. Donors who can help us grow and meet our mission
  2. Advocates to help set up additional care centers
  3. Experts to make the Magic Arms orthotic better
  4. Children who need Magic Arms!
Share our story on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and other social media!

FAQ

How does Magic Arms work?

It supports and balances the weight of a child’s arms using a 3D-printed frame and resistance bands. Precision bearings in all joints of the device allow children to amplify their limited arm strength to participate in the joys of life. As children grow, new parts can be printed or modified to meet each child’s unique needs.

How much does Magic Arms cost?

Right now the Magic Arms orthotic is about $7,000, from initial measurements through 3D printing and final fitting. Compared to most medical devices, this is a very reasonable cost. Magic Arms, however, is not currently covered by insurance (though it is a future goal!) and $7,000 is a large out-of-pocket cost for a family to pay. This crowdfunding will help us redesign the Magic Arms orthotic to lower production costs and help extend the “reach” of Magic Arms! One of our stretch goals is to provide Magic Arms to more children without access to health insurance!

Why does Magic Arms need to be redesigned?

The current device costs around $7,000 dollars to manufacture, assemble, and fit to a child. Since this technology is so new, not many health insurance plans reimburse patients, leaving many families paying out of pocket. We hope to reduce the cost of the device by making it simpler to manufacture, assemble, and fit to a child while also improving the comfort and function. We are also working to educate health insurance providers so that the cost of the device can be reimbursed.


What conditions can Magic Arms help?

Our current orthotic can help children with the following conditions, but we are working to identify other conditions that we could help as part of our redesign. 

  • Spinal Muscular Atrophy
  • Muscular Dystrophy - (Duchenne’s & Becker’s)
  • Arthrogryposis Multiplex Congenita
  • Brachial Plexus Injury

How can my child get Magic Arms?

Please fill out the form on our website. We are working as quickly as we can to help more children get their own Magic Arms! Help us speed it up by giving toward our fundraising goal!

Image Credits

Blank US Map - Lokal_Profil [CC BY-SA 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.5)], via Wikimedia Commons

Emma's StoryOur StoryOver 50,000 children in the U.S. and more than 500,000 children worldwide suffer from rare diseases and conditions that prevent them from using their arms. We founded Magic Arms to bring a life-changing 3D-printed exoskeleton to these children so they can do what was once impossible, like hugging their parents, brushing their teeth, feeding themselves, or just playing a game. This technology works and has changed children’s lives, but it is not yet accessible to many children. We need your help to set up care centers so children can get their own Magic Arms and fulfill our waiting list of over 200 children. Our stretch goals will fund a redesign of our exoskeleton (the “Magic Arms orthotic”), and bring Magic Arms to kids who do not have access to health care.What We're Doing NowWe are partnering with leading children’s hospitals to develop care centers to help more children and families worldwide. Working with the top doctors and researchers, we will continue to collect crucial feedback on children’s outcomes with Magic Arms. This will give us the insight we need to improve our product and expand medical reimbursement. What We Need to Give Kids Magic ArmsOur distribution of the Magic Arms orthotic is bottle-necked because there is only one care center and only one trained expert who can fit kids with Magic Arms. Your donation will help us set up regional care centers, train clinicians to fit the device, and create an inventory that can meet the current and growing demand for Magic Arms. Our Care Centers



After our immediate distribution needs are met, we will begin a redesign of the Magic Arms orthotic to make it less expensive, improved outcomes, and expand health care reimbursement. This is a crucial step in bringing Magic Arms to more than 500,000 children worldwide. Working with expert medical device designers, such as Kablooe Design in Minneapolis, we aim to cut the total cost of the Magic Arms orthotic in half. We will accomplish this by making the device easier to manufacture, assemble, and fit to children. Once we meet our goal of funding care centers and our product redesign, all incremental donations will bring Magic Arms to kids who do not have access to affordable care. We are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, and all donations are tax deductible.
Our Goals






Our Timeline





Our Team



Broader Impacts

Supporting Magic Arms will help bring a solution to children with arm muscle disabilities, and it will also forge a new path for treating rare conditions. In the U.S., conditions affecting less than 200,000 people are considered Orphan Medical conditions that receive less support and attention from large medical device manufacturers. Magic Arms uses cutting edge technology to find a solution to address these conditions, demonstrating that human ingenuity and generosity can help children and families live a better life.
Risks & Challenges

Magic Arms technology is evolving with real time feedback from medical professionals, patients, and families. Over 100 kids have benefited from the Magic Arms orthotic, but we know we can make a much larger impact. First, we need to open centers and study patients to collect outcomes data to improve our product design and reimbursement. We need to provide devices to doctors and researchers at children's hospitals, train them to fit the Magic Arms orthotic to each child, and identify strengths and design challenges of the Magic Arms orthotic.



Primary Challenges

Diagnosing each child properly to make sure they can benefit from Magic Arms
Making it simple enough to assemble that it can be put on a child properly without much guidance

Shrinking the technology so it is less obstructive but still has the strength needed


We are qualified to overcome these hurdles because:

Our research and analytics team will help us learn what is needed to identify good candidates for Magic Arms and develop a protocol to do a successful assembly and fit
We are using skilled and experienced medical device engineers and designers to redesign the device

Our plan to solve these hurdles:

Develop relationships with leading medical professionals to help us assess child outcomes and incorporate feedback
Focus on these items as priorities in the R&D portion of the project
Use rapid prototyping and testing to improve the designs quickly

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word! We are looking for:



Donors who can help us grow and meet our mission


Advocates to help set up additional care centers


Experts to make the Magic Arms orthotic better

Children who need Magic Arms!
Share our story on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and other social media!

FAQ

How does Magic Arms work?It supports and balances the weight of a child’s arms using a 3D-printed frame and resistance bands. Precision bearings in all joints of the device allow children to amplify their limited arm strength to participate in the joys of life. As children grow, new parts can be printed or modified to meet each child’s unique needs.



How much does Magic Arms cost?Right now the Magic Arms orthotic is about $7,000, from initial measurements through 3D printing and final fitting. Compared to most medical devices, this is a very reasonable cost. Magic Arms, however, is not currently covered by insurance (though it is a future goal!) and $7,000 is a large out-of-pocket cost for a family to pay. This crowdfunding will help us redesign the Magic Arms orthotic to lower production costs and help extend the “reach” of Magic Arms! One of our stretch goals is to provide Magic Arms to more children without access to health insurance!



Why does Magic Arms need to be redesigned?
The current device costs around $7,000 dollars to manufacture, assemble, and fit to a child. Since this technology is so new, not many health insurance plans reimburse patients, leaving many families paying out of pocket. We hope to reduce the cost of the device by making it simpler to manufacture, assemble, and fit to a child while also improving the comfort and function. We are also working to educate health insurance providers so that the cost of the device can be reimbursed.




What conditions can Magic Arms help?
Our current orthotic can help children with the following conditions, but we are working to identify other conditions that we could help as part of our redesign. 



Spinal Muscular Atrophy


Muscular Dystrophy - (Duchenne’s & Becker’s)


Arthrogryposis Multiplex Congenita


Brachial Plexus Injury





How can my child get Magic Arms?Please fill out the form on our website. We are working as quickly as we can to help more children get their own Magic Arms! Help us speed it up by giving toward our fundraising goal!



Image CreditsBlank US Map - Lokal_Profil [CC BY-SA 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.5)], via Wikimedia Commons

story:
KidShape is a program and app designed to help parents and their kids live healthier lives by addressing their level of activity, choices for nutrition and by choosing to create healthier habits.

KidShape builds on the original KidShape program and includes more interactive nutrition activities and games with a family cooking program to make the experience entertaining and engaging. Families learn successful tools to change behavior, eat healthier, move more and feel good. 

The enrollment process is as easy as downloading the app and signing up for the 21-day free trial!

     

  • Play time instead of exercise
  • More family activities
  • Incorporates activities that kids already do like jumprope, play wii, biking, etc.

                                            

  • Healthier options
  • Kids are involved in the process
  • Cooking skills/ tutorials

                                              

  • Repeated actions create healthy habits that stick
  • It's easier to teach a kid than to reteach an adult
  • Ages 6-12 are formative years for setting habits

                                             

The KidShape app is appealing to KIDS because:

  • It mirrors a video game
  • Kids can earn points and get to the next level by making healthy choices. For instance, if your child chooses broccoli over french fries, he/she will move up or closer to the next level.
  • We hope to add a virtual gaming component which will allow kids to play with others.
  • The design will include bright colors, interesting noises and effects and easy to follow directions much like the games kids play today on their tablets.

                                            

The KidShape app is appealing to PARENTS because:

  • Often we don't have time to learn what's best for our kids' health OR we just don't know. The KidShape program makes it easy fir us to help our kids develop healthy habits and make good choices by giving us a PLAYBOOK!
  • This book will allow the parent to follow along the game so that they know what their child is learning, doing and needs!
  • For instance, your child can earn points for making smart shopping decisions, cooking a healthy meal and even going to sleep on time!
  • The KidShape program sets up all the guidelines and you're just helping your child "PLAY the GAME!"

                          

Some of our perks include the KidShape Wearable 

  • Bluetooth syncs with phone, shows caller id, text messages, FB, Twitter
  • Tracks activity, calories, sleep and quality of sleep, watch, reminder function, USB charging, waterproof
  • IOS & Android compatible
  • Choose between black, red and blue!

                                         

Very recently we read a story of a 3-year-old child who was diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes.  This is the youngest child ever to be identified as having this very serious condition. Due to poor eating habits and low activity, this child weighed 70% more than that of a healthy child her age. With proper nutrition and activity, doctors were able to reverse the condition. KidShape was borne from the concern that this same scenario is playing out more and more and will increase if nothing is done to address the problem of childhood obesity.

Over the years, we have seen the dramatic effects of obesity on the heart and on children. When we were kids, we played outside all day long until our parents called us in for dinner. We were active and we grew up to be healthy adults.

In the last 30 years childhood obesity has more than doubled. That’s a future we need to change. As it stands now, these children will grow up to have increased heart risk factors, prediabetes or diabetes, higher risk for stroke and a whole other host of image problems that are associated with obesity.

Here’s a sobering note: this is the first generation in the history of our country that is projected to die at an earlier average age than the previous generation.

That’s not a future we can live with! 

                                                 

Champions Youth Fitness is targeting $250,000 for our KidShape program. That money will be used to help make a dent in the childhood obesity epidemic specifically by:

  • Improving and redesigning the app for better user experience for kids
  • Offering healthy products to complement the essential program recommendations and goals.
  • Creating better tools to assist in tracking and keeping a healthy lifestyle
  • Adding more options and components to continue improving the overall program and experience.

All of these objectives will add up to make a stronger impact on this very real and very dangerous problem.

                                       

I’m Paul Bosley. I launched Champions Youth Fitness 5 years ago to create a solution to our youth obesity crisis. I believe that our health is our most prized possession and I’ve practiced what I preach for my entire lifetime. After hearing Michelle Obama talk about the probem with childhood obesity, I knew something had to be done and I wanted to help.

And I’m Saeb Jannoun. I’ve been in the health and fitness industry for years and have seen first hand what the benefits are, both mentally and physically. I’m a father and have children and I never want to see mine experiencing any of the shaming, health concerns and mental issues that come with childhood obesity.

Additionally, we have an experienced and knowledgeable team supporting this effort including:

Christiane Wert Rivard, MPH, RD a registered dietitian with a Master’s Degree in Public Health and over 15 years of experience in developing, implementing and evaluating comprehensive childhood obesity programs.

Beth Braun, PhD who specializes in children and families dealing with weight issues and has been featured in the national media, including the Oprah Winfrey show, discussing childhood obesity.

John Rutigliano who has a Masters Degree with a concentration in Exercise Physiology and doctoral studies in Applied and his career includes the design, development and distribution of child/youth exercise equipment with a self published manual for his BEE-FIT programs.

Chef Erin Tyler with over 30 years of culinary education and experience. After graduating from the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she went on to develop the culinary program for the nation's first private High School for overweight teens and created the culinary program for their weight loss camps that are located worldwide. During that time she was also a culinary educator, teaching over 1,000 young adults and children essential cooking skills and how to create menus and recipes to use throughout their lifetime.

The whole team at KidShape takes the future of children seriously. Please join us in helping to impact their lives in a way that could vastly improve their future as well as the future of their families and the many people whose lives they’ll touch. The future of many depends on the actions we take today. You may not think you can play a part but every little bit helps and we intend to bring exposure to and address this issue of childhood obesity.

It would mean a lot to us if you would spread the word by simply clicking the Facebook and Twitter buttons on these pages. Just two clicks could make a huge difference!

Please forward to friends, family, co-workers…anyone you think might be interested. The more the better!

-Paul and Saeb

story:
Move Strong Fit (MiSFIT)
ASD Gym

(Pilot program)

Summary

As a parent of a child on the Autism Spectrum I am constantly searching for ways to support him to engage and interact with the world and everyone in it. At times, I am torn between what I want and what my child needs. Searching for something he will enjoy, love and possibly excel in.

I have seen first hand the benefits of exercise for all kinds of children, especially Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) children. Quite often and for many different reasons it is difficult for these children and teenagers to fit into a 'standard' gym or martial arts school. Hence, the concept of the ASD Gym was born.

The ASD Gym will provide an environment where teens with an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) can visit and participate in a range of physical activities, where they can learn to move, get strong and fit.'Move, Strong, and Fit' are the three elements that help build the physical and mental confidence in everyone. The environment will be designed with three distinct training areas and activities:

  1. martial arts
  2. mobility
  3. strength 

These activities offer a way to formalise patterns and add structure that many ASD teens find comforting. The Move, Strong, Fit paradigm is one I feel will bring many essentials to the teens as they move from adolescent to young adult. A time when they may feel like they don't belong and possibly find it difficult to accomplish and achieve goals in the mainstream. Being able to Move, be Strong and Fit will give them confidence in themselves and help them to overcome many situations where they may not have the ability to adjust to specific circumstances, they wont be the 'misfits' often associated with ASD children. With a deliberate play on words the MiSFIT name will take pride of place in the Gym. As immortalised by the Apple "Think Different" campaign in the late 90's, it will help people appreciate that we are different and inspiring in our own ways. Watch the following video to see the poem below, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O0S5SuAwIXs

"Here’s to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They’re not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can’t do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." 

Concept Summary

There is a relationship between the body and mind that improves with movement and practice. Best results coming from engaged routines and focused attention from the individual. The path to such physical attention need not be done alone. It is often best done with care and advise from those more experienced.

Children on the spectrum are diverse and complex, yet their are some activities that span this complexity and offer a way for them to focus, interact, develop and improve their self-perception.

The three skill based activities mentioned, offer the kids a way to move and improve their bodies using repeatable and relatable skills they can apply to the rest of their lives.

The MiSFIT pilot program would initially target high functioning ASD children with the support and encouragement of the parent and carer. This pilot program will allow us to gauge the significance of the separate modalities (Mobility, Martial Arts, Strength training) for the Higher functioning participants and allow us to refine the sessions and expectations for the future.

During the pilot process efforts will focus on the three main aspects of: Mobility, Strength, and Martial Arts.

Mobility:

Using the Original Strength system offers a fantastic way to learn how the body moves and at the same time increase reflexive strength and coordination, using fundamental body movements including: rocking, rolling, crawling, marching, skipping and running.


Strength:

Strength training will allow the exploration and building of the body to improve underlying strength. It will be based on functional strength training systems using results based methods with skills covering bodyweight, kettlebell and barbell.


Martial arts:

Martial Arts is a pattern based skill which like the skills above is easily teachable and repeatable. Offering a distinct path to follow, combining reflexive strength and mobility, with measurable outcomes that will improve many areas for each participant.



Facility


(Concept of proposed facility, with separate areas for each modality)

The goal is to provide a very specific style of facility to coach and support the kids. A facility to give them the best advantage possible to learn and participate in various modes of physical activity. The larger premises as shown in the above concept image would be the upper end of our goal. An area where the spaces are combined would also offer a similar experience with specific times set aside for specific training.

There are many factors we would like to control in a facility such as this. The ability to control lighting and noise would allow trainees with high sensory needs to be able to train and utilise the areas. The same way each individual ASD child is unlike any other, we would like to be able to assist them in learning how to train, by providing a facility that can cater for all.

As a carer reading this, I'm sure you would like to train at the same time as your child, learning with the same vigour and share in the benefits.  You could do your own training while they are working with a coach or have somewhere to leave your child knowing that they will be looked after and instructed in a safe manner.

The concept plan shows specific areas for martial arts training, strength training, and movement training. They are all separate and can operate independently at the same time, without interfering with the other areas. We also feel that it is important to have a transition area for relaxing before and after.


Obviously a facility like this is specifically designed and built, as such this campaign is designed to fit out an existing location with the necessary equipment and areas.

The Program

The pilot program is a 9 week term in 4 parts. The weeks from 1 to 6 cover the individual modalities to focus on the correct patterning and the remaining 3 weeks progress and integrate all aspects together. Ideally there will be 2 sessions per week separated by a few rest days. The rest days allow the students to think about the sessions and do their own practice. Each session has time for skills reinforcement and new skill acquisition. In the final 3 weeks all skills will be applied in each session and this is where the students gain the confidence that will carry on in their every day lives. At the end of the term a progress report will be available for the parents/carers to take for future reference, giving them a comparison and a commentary of the student's progress from start to finish. 

Sessions

In addition to the formal 9 week program there will be a variety of training options ranging from one on one training to workshop. These will vary depending on the individual need of the student. To ensure that a student and the parent understand the processes for a workshop,  individual training or the 9 week program an introduction session will be organised for all new and prospective students.

The facility will have trainers onsite at all times, taking sessions/classes or assisting with training. Meaning that outside of the specified class/session/workshop times there will always be someone nearby to offer help and advice.

Introduction / Induction

Prior to any training a prospective student and their carer/carers will be required to attend an induction session that will last approximately one hour and cover the facility and everything on offer. During the induction we will cover all areas of the ASD that are of concern, with the understanding that the coach is there to ensure safety for the student, the parents and others in the facility.  During the introduction session the coach will provide an initial mobility and coordination assessment that will be used in assistance with the ongoing coaching. 

One on One

Scheduled sessions for a particular style, Mobility, Strength, Martial Arts, etc. for an individual covering their style of choice. These are conducted by appointment only.

Small Group

Scheduled classes for a particular style, Mobility, Strength, Martial Arts etc. These will be scheduled on a daily or weekly basis depending on specific popularity.

Classes

Scheduled classes for a particular style, Mobility, Strength, Martial Arts, etc. These will be scheduled on a daily or weekly basis depending on specific popularity.

Workshops

Open sessions available to members, students and prospective new members. These workshops will cover a range of specific training modalities and will be scheduled at different times throughout the year.

Open Training

Open training will be available during times when specific sessions are not in progress. Giving the member an opportunity to practice technique or train on their individualised allocated program.

Memberships

Every new student will be required to complete a membership form. Available memberships include: Casual: Mobility, Strength, Martial Arts, Multiple Class' Unlimited.

 Parent / Carer

As a parent or carer its often difficult to get to a gym for a workout because of the difficulty involved in taking your child along. As the parent or carer of a child who is a gym member, by default they will receive a discounted membership to attend classes and sessions either with their child or in a separate area. This gives parents and carers peace of mind and an opportunity to work on their fitness or connect with other parents and carers.

Conclusion

The MiSFit ASD Gym is a collection of training programs. The facility is a place for ASD teens and carers to do fitness work in a supported environment. An assessment phase has been built into the early part of the project. This will determine the viability of further building the pilot program to include pre-adolescent ASD children.

The funding goal

For this campaign we are seeking $15,000 for provision of leasing and fit out of a facility in readiness for our first program within three months of the campaign completion.The main focus of this campaign is to start the first nine week program with between five and ten teenage ASD children.  It is our desire to be able to fund sufficiently to find and convert a suitable location with the relevant areas and equipment. The project has a future vision to grow the gym for use by pre-adolescent children
