story:
My Mission is to contribute to the cultivation of a connected, healthy, peaceful world


BRIEFLY STATED

what I want to see

I am Christopher Grant - entrepreneur, yoga teacher and owner of the Yoga Farm.
I want to participate in a world where people are healthy and free to live into their life's purpose.
I want to see a world where all people have the opportunity to thrive and to live a life free of depression, addiction and loneliness.  
Here at Yoga Farm, I help overweight individuals and families return to balance and discover what they are truly hungry for. 

People who are balanced and living their life purpose will have peace of mind, ease in body, and joy in spirit.  
what is the problem

Here in the United States, we have a problem, as 2/3 of our population is overweight or obese according the National Institute for Health.

why is there a problem

The National Institute of Health states: 

"Obesity is a major public health problem and notoriously difficult to treat. There are many parallels between obesity/overeating and addictions to alcohol and drugs."

Overeating is a particularly challenging addiction, as it roots deeply both in the body, and the mind.  

People over eat, or eat unconsciously because they want to change the way they feel.  This is leading to health problems for adults and children throughout America today.

This is the health challenge of our time, and I am here to meet it head on with an open heart, with all of my passion, and with all of my skill as a teacher of yoga and meditation.
why is yoga farm a solution

Yoga is the perfect solution for healing the overweight body and depressed mind.  

Both the body and mind need to be treated, together, to step out of the cycle of a food addiction and restore balance and health.  

I am offering a powerful solution to this social problem that has grown out of personal and professional insight into the nature of addiction.

My Yoga Farm will be in the forefront of the national return to balance, by presenting classes, workshops, teacher trainings, online learning, and inspirational examples of courageous people taking that first step out of being stuck, and into personal wellness.

Yoga Farm is a gorgeous 65-acre farm with waterfalls, forests and fields just outside of Ithaca, NY, and our unique programs incorporate time in nature, daily walks, one on one coaching, along with yoga specifically designed for the overweight.

I'm fundraising today to complete our wellness center at Yoga Farm, to expand the reach of our programs, and to bring my proven yoga and mindfulness solutions for healing the body and mind to a national audience.  
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step, and people are taking that first step to health here at the Yoga Farm.
Please support this mission today, so I can help thousands of people take that first step on their journey to health, leading to a more peaceful and happy world for ourselves and our children. Thank You.

DETAILS

what can we do, together

A global population who truly cares for each other and our earth can solve any environment and social challenge that we turn our attention to.  

I am working towards to a nation of people who are healthy and working cooperatively together. Once all have equal opportunity and tools for peace of mind, ease in their body and and joy in spirit, then peace in the world will be possible.   

Where there's light in the soul there is beauty in the person             
Where there's beauty in the person there is harmony within the home
Where there's harmony within the home there's order in the nation
Where there's order in the nation there is peace in the world.
-- Dr. Joe Marshalla

this is a growing problem...

This overeating trend is everywhere, nationally and globally, in youth and adults.

It is apparent that an increasingly stressed population is satiating themselves with food.  We consume too much of the wrong food because it temporarily makes us feel 'full', easing the emptiness that leads to unhealthy behavior.  

People are turning to drugs and devices to physically prevent obesity and still are growing larger.

Addictive behaviors are emotionally numbing, and this can lead to depression, to a life that is not satisfying.  According to the Centers for Disease Control, 43% of depressed adults are obese.(http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/databriefs/db167.htm)

Think of it this way: 2/3 of our country is overweight, often due to being stressed, angry, frustrated, or depressed.  And we all are collectively OK, with this, because we know we can't just quit eating.  So bodies are getting bigger, enthusiasm for life is getting smaller, health conditions are worsening, our sense of separation and aloneness is growing, and the unconscious consumption continues.

When a friend or colleague or family member is addicted to alcohol, or opiates, or sex, or tobacco, we NOTICE, we know something is wrong.  But everyone has to eat, and with waistlines and shirt sizes growing on all sides of us we have turned a blind eye to this national cry out to be noticed, heard and seen.

why yoga is a solution

Obesity is a symptom of a mind and body out of balance, and yoga offers corrective therapy to bring balance back into the body and mind.  

An individual with balance in body and mind will learn to treat food as medicine, and not as an escape from discomfort and depression.

At Yoga Farm, our programs for the larger individuals include stretching and physical exercises, but also incorporates mindfulness and meditation, walking in nature, and coaching with effective techniques to clear the mind of stressful thinking that leads to overeating, low-self esteem, guilt, or malaise.

We are the only yoga center with holistic, comprehensive programs to treat the body, mind and spirit of a plus-sized person, including unlimited yoga classes specifically designed for overweight individuals.

why I can present this solution well

I am a yoga teacher, a health coach and a wellness pioneer.  I've been studying the mind/body link and tools from the science of yoga and meditation for two decades now.  My passion is in extracting the essence of these tools for healing the body and mind and presenting them in a format that everyone can do.
I am a compassionate person who will not stand by while my family and friends, and your family and friends suffer from a problem that is treatable by the same tools that led me back to stability in body and mind.
Here is a testimonial from a student here:
“I’ve been an “Easy, Light and Fun” devotee since finding the studio five months ago. I always look forward to coming to class and enjoy the relaxed peaceful feeling I go home with. The deep stretches and long holds have done an amazing job loosening my stiff joints and aching back. My spine feels so loose, I feel like a slinky! Christopher is an amazing teacher and a gift to Lansing. If you haven’t been to the Yoga Farm yet, I recommend you check it out.” – C.N. Lansing, NY


why I will be successful leading this solution

I am a successful entrepreneur and business leader, having created a technology services firm which I operated in Ithaca for many years.  

I love to bring people together to solve challenging problems. Several years ago, I handed over my technology company's leadership to a successor and turned my full attention to my study and teacher training in the science of yoga.

what is Yoga Farm offering?

I own, live, and teach on a gorgeous farm just outside of Ithaca, NY.  This land is peaceful, my classes are nurturing, and I'm witnessing people wake up, take my hand, and step bravely forward on the path to healing themselves. 

After hundreds of successful yoga sessions taught here I've established my mission, received strong community support, and am taking my first step towards turning this farm into a wellness center for the overweight, out-of-shape, and those that mainstream health and wellness have left behind.  

I'm fundraising today to complete the conversion of an antique barn into our home-base yoga Center, that will serve thousands of people, locally and nationally.  My unique, proven programs include gentle yoga classes, private yoga therapy, walking in the forests and fields, swimming and resting by waterfalls, and coaching work to identify and purge the stressful thinking that leads to overeating.

As 2/3 of our population gains access to mind/body yoga-inspired tools currently used by less than 10% of the population, they will begin to awaken to their own joy, to the potential in their own life.  Their sense of purpose and personal power will inspire others to take that first step on the road to wholeness.  They will start to feel seen by their family and co-workers and friends.  In turn they will shine their light and insights into dark corners of society, solving environmental and political issues, together.

what we need and what you'll get 

I'm creating a broad spectrum wellness enterprise, with Yoga Farm as my home base, for classes, camps, trainings, online learning and outreach.

I have a business plan, a marketing plan, a rock-star board of advisors, and have committed my own savings to bring this vision to life.  I'm bringing high quality teachers who share my mission to offer classes, workshops, teacher trainings and more here at Yoga Farm.

I'm dedicating my life to carrying this solution to the world, and I am giving you an opportunity today to be part of the solution.  I'm raising $25,000 minimally, with a stretch goal of $50,000, to complete the creation of the Yoga Center, and launch the national expansion of the programming that has already been proven here.

Make your contribution today; seize this opportunity to make a difference. I've created many perks specifically for this fundraising, or you may provide funds directly for continued construction so that I can complete Phase 1 of this Center.  Perks include classes, merchandise, programs, membership, private sessions, facility use, recognition on the building itself and much more are available.

For those who don't live near Yoga Farm, your financial support is very welcome! I'll put a 'thank you' plaque with your name by a component of the facility that you pay for: a gorge-view window, the main entrance, or will even dedicate the building to you or a cause close to you for specific contribution levels.  You can also 'pay it forward' and fund one of our programs for an individual who otherwise couldn't afford to participate.

Another perk is first access for my upcoming yoga-for-the-overweight video online learning series, so you can practice and share these powerful tools from the comfort of your own home, and take your first step back to wellness.

Ready to support our mission?  Take a look at the perks on the right. 

funding requirements

Here's our current status: We are half-way through our Center construction project, with a grand opening planned end of June and new programs launching July.  We are converting an antique, well-constructed barn into a 'Yoga Barn', well-lit with spacious windows overlooking the gorge, a hardwood floor in the main studio, a bathroom, and kitchen.  The second level is huge and will remain open for larger gatherings and talks.


About half of the funds have been committed and our construction is well underway. The week before launch of this campaign we completed our framing, roughed in plumbing and electric, and created an inviting entrance into the new Center.

Here are the specifics of what I require funding for by the end of May to launch Yoga Farm and bring our innovative body/ mind healing programs to those who need it this summer:

  1. Heating / Cooling system: $6,000
  2. Develop, print, distribute marketing materials for the new programs and promote summer launch: $2,500
  3. Fixtures for kitchen and bath: $1,500
  4. Insulation on all sides of Center: $10,000
  5. Cover the outside of the barn with long-lasting, barn-red steel: $8,000
  6. Painting the inside of the studio: $1,500
  7. Double-door main entrance: $2,450
  8. Sustainable Bamboo hardwood floor: $5,000
  9. Ceiling fans: $600

All funds raised in this campaign will go towards our mission of developing a retreat center, starting with completing this barn conversion.

Here is a walk-through of the barn where it is now, about 1/2 done:


Stretch goals:

I've set our initial goal at $25,000, which will take us through the next major phase of work.  Working together we can surely reach $50,000.  With the next $25,000, the facility will be complete and ready for us.  I'll be able to paint the roof of the barn, sealing leaks, so it will last many more years, and bring my program out to groups such as Overeater's anonymous.

I'll develop facilitator training programs so that others can use the effective yoga adaptations that I've been honing for the last 5 years in their local area.

I'll be able to fund scholarships for those who apply for financial aid.  

I will landscape the outside of the barn with 2 retaining walls to create an outdoor, flat yoga space and meeting area, and I'll create a large all-season parking area.

The Impact

Together, we will be able to support thousands as they integrate body and mind and open their hearts in service to the world.  When we care for ourselves we are able to care for others. If each person cares for just one other person, then EVERYONE will be taken care of.   Our programs will be offered at reduced costs on a sliding scale to those in financial hardship.  

Will you look into your heart and see to support this crucial next step of expansion for this shared vision: All people living in nature's harmony with peace of mind, ease of body and joy of spirit.

Your funds will go a long ways to easing the suffering of many as these potent wellness tools, programs, courses, and offerings become available to a broad audience.

Thank you.

Christopher

  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Google+, Instagram and Twitter.  There are easy share buttons right on this page.
  • Visit our website to learn more about us: http://www.YogaFarm.us
  • Like our Facebook page: http://www.Facebook.com/YogaFarmLansing
  • Read my blog article about my new summer programs for the overweight: http://yogafarm.us/2015/04/22/come-take-my-hand-lets-walk-together-to-wellness-take-that-first-step-with-me/
  • Connect us with an agency in the area who also serves the overweight and obese so that we can explore bringing our programs to them
  • Make a donation of any amount directly to us.  Your gift will be used wisely.
  • Think of who you know in our area who could benefit from effective mind-body work in a caring, non-judgmental environment, and tell them about Yoga Farm and this campaign!
story_txt:
My Mission is to contribute to the cultivation of a connected, healthy, peaceful world

BRIEFLY STATED
what I want to see
I am Christopher Grant - entrepreneur, yoga teacher and owner of the Yoga Farm.
I want to participate in a world where people are healthy and free to live into their life's purpose.
I want to see a world where all people have the opportunity to thrive and to live a life free of depression, addiction and loneliness.  
Here at Yoga Farm, I help overweight individuals and families return to balance and discover what they are truly hungry for. 
People who are balanced and living their life purpose will have peace of mind, ease in body, and joy in spirit.  


what is the problem

Here in the United States, we have a problem, as 2/3 of our population is overweight or obese according the National Institute for Health.
why is there a problem

The National Institute of Health states: 

"Obesity is a major public health problem and notoriously difficult to treat. There are many parallels between obesity/overeating and addictions to alcohol and drugs."

Overeating is a particularly challenging addiction, as it roots deeply both in the body, and the mind.  
People over eat, or eat unconsciously because they want to change the way they feel.  This is leading to health problems for adults and children throughout America today.This is the health challenge of our time, and I am here to meet it head on with an open heart, with all of my passion, and with all of my skill as a teacher of yoga and meditation.

why is yoga farm a solution

Yoga is the perfect solution for healing the overweight body and depressed mind.  
Both the body and mind need to be treated, together, to step out of the cycle of a food addiction and restore balance and health.  

I am offering a powerful solution to this social problem that has grown out of personal and professional insight into the nature of addiction.


My Yoga Farm will be in the forefront of the national return to balance, by presenting classes, workshops, teacher trainings, online learning, and inspirational examples of courageous people taking that first step out of being stuck, and into personal wellness.
Yoga Farm is a gorgeous 65-acre farm with waterfalls, forests and fields just outside of Ithaca, NY, and our unique programs incorporate time in nature, daily walks, one on one coaching, along with yoga specifically designed for the overweight.

I'm fundraising today to complete our wellness center at Yoga Farm, to expand the reach of our programs, and to bring my proven yoga and mindfulness solutions for healing the body and mind to a national audience.  
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step, and people are taking that first step to health here at the Yoga Farm.

Please support this mission today, so I can help thousands of people take that first step on their journey to health, leading to a more peaceful and happy world for ourselves and our children. Thank You.

DETAILS
what can we do, together
A global population who truly cares for each other and our earth can solve any environment and social challenge that we turn our attention to.  
I am working towards to a nation of people who are healthy and working cooperatively together. Once all have equal opportunity and tools for peace of mind, ease in their body and and joy in spirit, then peace in the world will be possible.   

Where there's light in the soul there is beauty in the person             Where there's beauty in the person there is harmony within the homeWhere there's harmony within the home there's order in the nationWhere there's order in the nation there is peace in the world.-- Dr. Joe Marshalla




this is a growing problem...

This overeating trend is everywhere, nationally and globally, in youth and adults.




It is apparent that an increasingly stressed population is satiating themselves with food.  We consume too much of the wrong food because it temporarily makes us feel 'full', easing the emptiness that leads to unhealthy behavior.  
People are turning to drugs and devices to physically prevent obesity and still are growing larger.


Addictive behaviors are emotionally numbing, and this can lead to depression, to a life that is not satisfying.  According to the Centers for Disease Control, 43% of depressed adults are obese.(http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/databriefs/db167.htm)
Think of it this way: 2/3 of our country is overweight, often due to being stressed, angry, frustrated, or depressed.  And we all are collectively OK, with this, because we know we can't just quit eating.  So bodies are getting bigger, enthusiasm for life is getting smaller, health conditions are worsening, our sense of separation and aloneness is growing, and the unconscious consumption continues.

When a friend or colleague or family member is addicted to alcohol, or opiates, or sex, or tobacco, we NOTICE, we know something is wrong.  But everyone has to eat, and with waistlines and shirt sizes growing on all sides of us we have turned a blind eye to this national cry out to be noticed, heard and seen.
why yoga is a solution
Obesity is a symptom of a mind and body out of balance, and yoga offers corrective therapy to bring balance back into the body and mind.  


An individual with balance in body and mind will learn to treat food as medicine, and not as an escape from discomfort and depression.
At Yoga Farm, our programs for the larger individuals include stretching and physical exercises, but also incorporates mindfulness and meditation, walking in nature, and coaching with effective techniques to clear the mind of stressful thinking that leads to overeating, low-self esteem, guilt, or malaise.
We are the only yoga center with holistic, comprehensive programs to treat the body, mind and spirit of a plus-sized person, including unlimited yoga classes specifically designed for overweight individuals.
why I can present this solution wellI am a yoga teacher, a health coach and a wellness pioneer.  I've been studying the mind/body link and tools from the science of yoga and meditation for two decades now.  My passion is in extracting the essence of these tools for healing the body and mind and presenting them in a format that everyone can do.
I am a compassionate person who will not stand by while my family and friends, and your family and friends suffer from a problem that is treatable by the same tools that led me back to stability in body and mind.
Here is a testimonial from a student here:“I’ve been an “Easy, Light and Fun” devotee since finding the studio five months ago. I always look forward to coming to class and enjoy the relaxed peaceful feeling I go home with. The deep stretches and long holds have done an amazing job loosening my stiff joints and aching back. My spine feels so loose, I feel like a slinky! Christopher is an amazing teacher and a gift to Lansing. If you haven’t been to the Yoga Farm yet, I recommend you check it out.” – C.N. Lansing, NY

why I will be successful leading this solution
I am a successful entrepreneur and business leader, having created a technology services firm which I operated in Ithaca for many years.  
I love to bring people together to solve challenging problems. Several years ago, I handed over my technology company's leadership to a successor and turned my full attention to my study and teacher training in the science of yoga.
what is Yoga Farm offering?

I own, live, and teach on a gorgeous farm just outside of Ithaca, NY.  This land is peaceful, my classes are nurturing, and I'm witnessing people wake up, take my hand, and step bravely forward on the path to healing themselves. 
After hundreds of successful yoga sessions taught here I've established my mission, received strong community support, and am taking my first step towards turning this farm into a wellness center for the overweight, out-of-shape, and those that mainstream health and wellness have left behind.  
I'm fundraising today to complete the conversion of an antique barn into our home-base yoga Center, that will serve thousands of people, locally and nationally.  My unique, proven programs include gentle yoga classes, private yoga therapy, walking in the forests and fields, swimming and resting by waterfalls, and coaching work to identify and purge the stressful thinking that leads to overeating.
As 2/3 of our population gains access to mind/body yoga-inspired tools currently used by less than 10% of the population, they will begin to awaken to their own joy, to the potential in their own life.  Their sense of purpose and personal power will inspire others to take that first step on the road to wholeness.  They will start to feel seen by their family and co-workers and friends.  In turn they will shine their light and insights into dark corners of society, solving environmental and political issues, together.
what we need and what you'll get 

I'm creating a broad spectrum wellness enterprise, with Yoga Farm as my home base, for classes, camps, trainings, online learning and outreach.

I have a business plan, a marketing plan, a rock-star board of advisors, and have committed my own savings to bring this vision to life.  I'm bringing high quality teachers who share my mission to offer classes, workshops, teacher trainings and more here at Yoga Farm.

I'm dedicating my life to carrying this solution to the world, and I am giving you an opportunity today to be part of the solution.  I'm raising $25,000 minimally, with a stretch goal of $50,000, to complete the creation of the Yoga Center, and launch the national expansion of the programming that has already been proven here.

Make your contribution today; seize this opportunity to make a difference. I've created many perks specifically for this fundraising, or you may provide funds directly for continued construction so that I can complete Phase 1 of this Center.  Perks include classes, merchandise, programs, membership, private sessions, facility use, recognition on the building itself and much more are available.

For those who don't live near Yoga Farm, your financial support is very welcome! I'll put a 'thank you' plaque with your name by a component of the facility that you pay for: a gorge-view window, the main entrance, or will even dedicate the building to you or a cause close to you for specific contribution levels.  You can also 'pay it forward' and fund one of our programs for an individual who otherwise couldn't afford to participate.
Another perk is first access for my upcoming yoga-for-the-overweight video online learning series, so you can practice and share these powerful tools from the comfort of your own home, and take your first step back to wellness.
Ready to support our mission?  Take a look at the perks on the right. 


funding requirements
Here's our current status: We are half-way through our Center construction project, with a grand opening planned end of June and new programs launching July.  We are converting an antique, well-constructed barn into a 'Yoga Barn', well-lit with spacious windows overlooking the gorge, a hardwood floor in the main studio, a bathroom, and kitchen.  The second level is huge and will remain open for larger gatherings and talks.

About half of the funds have been committed and our construction is well underway. The week before launch of this campaign we completed our framing, roughed in plumbing and electric, and created an inviting entrance into the new Center.
Here are the specifics of what I require funding for by the end of May to launch Yoga Farm and bring our innovative body/ mind healing programs to those who need it this summer:



Heating / Cooling system: $6,000


Develop, print, distribute marketing materials for the new programs and promote summer launch: $2,500


Fixtures for kitchen and bath: $1,500


Insulation on all sides of Center: $10,000


Cover the outside of the barn with long-lasting, barn-red steel: $8,000


Painting the inside of the studio: $1,500

Double-door main entrance: $2,450
Sustainable Bamboo hardwood floor: $5,000
Ceiling fans: $600

All funds raised in this campaign will go towards our mission of developing a retreat center, starting with completing this barn conversion.
Here is a walk-through of the barn where it is now, about 1/2 done:

Stretch goals:
I've set our initial goal at $25,000, which will take us through the next major phase of work.  Working together we can surely reach $50,000.  With the next $25,000, the facility will be complete and ready for us.  I'll be able to paint the roof of the barn, sealing leaks, so it will last many more years, and bring my program out to groups such as Overeater's anonymous.
I'll develop facilitator training programs so that others can use the effective yoga adaptations that I've been honing for the last 5 years in their local area.
I'll be able to fund scholarships for those who apply for financial aid.  
I will landscape the outside of the barn with 2 retaining walls to create an outdoor, flat yoga space and meeting area, and I'll create a large all-season parking area.
The Impact
Together, we will be able to support thousands as they integrate body and mind and open their hearts in service to the world.  When we care for ourselves we are able to care for others. If each person cares for just one other person, then EVERYONE will be taken care of.   Our programs will be offered at reduced costs on a sliding scale to those in financial hardship.  
Will you look into your heart and see to support this crucial next step of expansion for this shared vision: All people living in nature's harmony with peace of mind, ease of body and joy of spirit.


Your funds will go a long ways to easing the suffering of many as these potent wellness tools, programs, courses, and offerings become available to a broad audience.
Thank you.
Christopher
  
  Other Ways You Can Help 

Share this campaign on Facebook, Google+, Instagram and Twitter.  There are easy share buttons right on this page.


Visit our website to learn more about us: http://www.YogaFarm.us

Like our Facebook page: http://www.Facebook.com/YogaFarmLansing
Read my blog article about my new summer programs for the overweight: http://yogafarm.us/2015/04/22/come-take-my-hand-lets-walk-together-to-wellness-take-that-first-step-with-me/

Connect us with an agency in the area who also serves the overweight and obese so that we can explore bringing our programs to them
Make a donation of any amount directly to us.  Your gift will be used wisely.
Think of who you know in our area who could benefit from effective mind-body work in a caring, non-judgmental environment, and tell them about Yoga Farm and this campaign!

story:
Indiegogo campaign for $10,000 Anna’s Oatcakes Start-up fund:

Anna’s Oatcakes are so different from anything else out there and yet the flavor of oats and maple is pleasing and familiar. The texture is usually the biggest surprise and sampling is the best way to overcome the general perception that healthy food has to sacrifice taste and texture.

Hello. My name is Anna Jordan. I have over fifteen years of experience in the food and hospitality industry. I've been a server, dishwasher, cook, barista, host, manager, bookkeeper, general manager, business manager, innkeeper and event coordinator. I am currently working towards an Accounting Certificate at Champlain College.

I’m a Wesleyan graduate, mother of three nearly grown children, artist, animal lover, local food advocate & the creator of this original recipe snack. I developed this recipe at a time when I was busy caring for my young children. I needed a healthy, energizing snack that would go with my morning coffee, keep the kids happy in the car, and give us all a boost any time of day. I used what I had in my kitchen working from an apple crisp recipe to create something simple and delicious.

The result was something entirely different from anything out there, Anna's Oatcakes, sweetened only with maple syrup. The thing that makes them so unique is the texture. They are more dense than a cookie or muffin, softer than a granola bar, healthier than a doughnut, and the maple flavor is complemented perfectly by carefully selected additions. The recipe is simple, but the process of creating the melt-in-your-mouth, almost creamy, texture is a closely guarded trade secret.

They were so popular with my family and friends I was encouraged to start selling them to local stores and within three years built a business that was very close to supporting my family. I ran a test market for Anna’s Oatcakes from 2000-2003, gaining and servicing retail accounts throughout Vermont. Some of our most successful accounts were Sugarbush (Mt. Ellen), Hunger Mountain Co-op, Healthy Living, Gillinghams in Woodstock, and Bromley Mountain. The brand was well on its way to becoming a phenomenon, but life with three kids got busy and took us in another direction.

I’d always planned to come back to the oatcakes and finish what I’d started using some of the lessons learned in those early years, ie. weekly deliveries --driving throughout a rural state in all sorts of harsh weather was not necessarily the most cost-effective way to run the business. I've since come to the conclusion that Anna’s Oatcakes are a good candidate for online sales. I've chosen to reopen my shop on Etsy and start a campaign on Indiegogo to promote Anna’s Oatcakes and make them more widely available.

My ultimate vision for Anna’s Oatcakes is that they become a snack staple throughout North America. The most important element of this plan is to let as many people as possible try them.  My target market is active people, outdoor sports enthusiasts, busy health conscious mothers, travelers, and coffee drinkers. 

The major investment is in product for sampling and the labor required to get out there and sell. Anna’s Oatcakes basically sell themselves once people try them. Sampling is the best way to spread the word and I've built that principle into my business plan. Your contribution will help pay for raw goods, production facility rental fees, labor and packaging throughout the first three months. I intend to make producing and selling Anna’s Oatcakes my full time job for those three months (April-June 2015). After that, I will evaluate their reception and hopefully have the momentum to build the business from there.


Perks!

  • If you contribute $100 or more to my campaign, you will receive 2 dozen mini variety packs and one dozen regular sized variety pack. Please enjoy and share.

  • If you can’t contribute at this time, there is another way (in 5 steps) that you can help…

1)  Visit my Etsy shop: https://www.etsy.com/shop/PeasantFoodRules?ref=hdr_shop_menu

2) Purchase any Anna’s Oatcakes product

3) Message me that you are a grassroots campaigner

4) Share the oatcakes..

5) You’ll receive a complimentary dozen minis of your choice for everyone who shops at my store and mentions your name between now and May 15th, 2015.

  • “Like” and Share Anna’s Oatcakes on facebook

( https://www.facebook.com/annasoatcakes?ref=hl ).

  • Share this Indiegogo campaign.

You can make a difference by getting the word out. Thank you!


Here’s a breakdown of my start-up needs:

Start-up plan:

  • Attorney fees for incorporation $450

  • Develop logo and print labels/cards/packaging $400

  • Incorporate as Peasant Food Rules, Inc. $125

  • Obtain nutritional analysis & barcodes $3000

  • Liability insurance $125

  • Procure reliable sources for raw goods especially Vermont Maple Syrup. $1340

  • Purchase uniform sized tins and food storage/mixing bins $200

  • Secure a baking and packaging facility (Vermont Food Venture Center) $1700

  • Build online sales by utilizing Etsy and Facebook $60 covers 3-6 months.

  • Set up local product demos and sampling opportunities $500 in product.

  • Obtain a limited number of targeted placement accounts = labor budget of $2100/mo for first 3 months


Total funding requested: $10,000


Projected Net Income:

☞Each dozen of Anna’s Oatcake has a 68% gross profit margin for regular sized ☜ and 75% for mini dozens.

With projected sales in the first month of 100 doz regular sized and 300 doz minis, at the current retail price of $18.95 and $9.95 respectively, net sales is expected to be $3,500 in the first month with a net operating income of $450/mo.


Contingency plan:

Anna’s Oatcakes are easy to make. I've been baking them out of my kitchen for friends and family for over fifteen years. If I don’t reach my Indiegogo funding goal, I would continue to share Anna’s Oatcakes on a smaller scale, gaining local accounts and building the lore at a slow-grow pace. All funds from this campaign will go into raw goods, facilities rental, and packaging costs. I intend to boot-strap my way to my ultimate goal: Anna’s Oatcakes for everyone! 

Some Exciting ideas:

Here are some ideas for promotion that I’d like to implement as soon as possible:

  • Partner with Vermont Coffee Company, VT Maple Association and other targeted organizations.

  • Sign up to be a food vendor for marathons, VT Maple Association events, and Food shows.

  • Create Breakfast Club subscription program: Weekly/Biweekly custom shipments with Vermont Coffee Company includes oatcake storage container, friends coffee mug and a complimentary mini variety pack.

The Impact:

A successful funding campaign will immediately impact my capacity to produce, market, and grow Anna’s Oatcakes into a profitable business.  The funds requested are earmarked for an intensive three month cushion during which I will plan to devote at least 40hrs/week to producing and promoting Anna's Oatcakes, and developing the brand by building relationships with partner organizations. I have found that partnering with associations and products that compliment the oatcakes helps to build the market. As previously stated, the most important element to building this business is to have a presence at events where people can try the product. Turning tasters into buyers will entail handing out cards and stickers that direct them to the online shop and Facebook page; keeping up a regular online presence and encouraging customers to share; and expanding the market through active promotion.

Risks & Challenges:

  • Distribution: Currently, shipping cost is added to the retail price of my product and is 75%-80% cost of the purchase. I’m working on finding a way to make shipping costs more reasonable through more compact and lightweight packaging.

  • Maple supply and pricing. Pure Vermont Maple syrup is called “liquid gold” and the price may as well be. I buy syrup locally and in large quantities. The price of syrup is subject to fluctuation year to year based on the success of the season. Sugaring season in Vermont is about 4-6 weeks long and is very dependent on the weather during those weeks. So far, I have never witnessed a shortage of bulk syrup, but as Anna’s Oatcakes grow, I do have concerns that the maple industry will not want to sacrifice it’s lucrative retail sales to supply in bulk at wholesale prices. I intend to initiate a conversation with the Maple producers and the Vermont Dept of Agriculture to work out ways to keep the maple for my value-added product affordable.

story:
Overview

Contamination of drinking water with arsenic is a significant global health problem, affecting an estimated 150 million people worldwide, with as many as 70 million of those people living in rural Bangladesh. Indeed, as many as one in five deaths in Bangladesh can be attributed to chronic arsenic poisoning resulting from long-term exposure through their drinking water in what the WHO has called “the largest mass poisoning of a population in history.”

Bio Nano Consulting (BNC) is developing the AquAffirm™ test as a simple, rapid, affordable test to precisely measure arsenic contamination. Utilizing a design based on the well-known diabetes test, AquAffirm™ will revolutionize management of this problem, empowering local communities to address this issue directly at the point of use.

Background

Arsenic was first detected in Bangladesh about 20 years ago following a program to dig millions of tube wells as a solution to people drinking bacteria-contaminated surface water.

Groundwater arsenic levels in Bangladesh (courtesy of the British Geological Survey)

Unfortunately, the bacteria-free drinking water proved no less safe, as it often contained dangerous levels of arsenic, which is colourless, tasteless and odourless, but highly toxic; it went undetected until the health consequences were observed on a massive scale. Long-term exposure to arsenic leads to numerous health issues, including skin lesions & cancers and affects brain growth & learning in children.

Rural villager displaying symptoms of arsenic poisoning.

There is no cure: the only solution is to prevent excessive exposure through affordable testing, filtration and the supply of arsenic-free water. BNC’s AquAffirm™ test represents a significant breakthrough in arsenic testing, being the first simple, rapid, affordable point-of-use test for quantitatively measuring arsenic in drinking water.

Our solution

The is the first test that provides a rapid quantitative measurement of arsenic levels using low-cost disposable test strips similar to those used in well-known diabetes tests. Unlike previous tests, this test requires no toxic chemicals and is simple to administer, meaning it is ideal for use in the rural communities most affected.

Our affordable easy-to-use test will transform life in rural villages affected by arsenic.

We have already developed prototype test strips that we can manufacture in small batches and which have been shown to work in laboratory conditions. The next step is to test these in real-world conditions in field trials which are planned for 2017. At the same time we are continuing to develop the test strips and the electronic reader as part of our product development program.

Renderings of electronic reader and disposable test strips.

History

Development of the AquAffirm™ test began as an academic collaboration in London between UCL microbiologist Dr Joanne Santini and Imperial College chemist Prof Tony Cass (one of the original inventors of the diabetes test). The drinksafe project involved use of a proprietary recombinant enzyme isolated from a peculiar naturally-occurring bacterium discovered by Jo in a gold mine in the Northern Territories of Australia. Putting this together with Tony's world-leading expertise on enzyme electrochemistry led to creation of this exciting technology.

Our partners

We are fortunate to have met some amazing collaborators along the way and are working with great teams at the University of Dhaka (Bangladesh), IIT-Madras (India) and the Centre for Advanced Materials (Mexico) on this project.  A portion of this work is funded by grants from the UK's Newton Fund (which supports British companies with cool technologies to help them work with partners in developing countries) and the REACH Fund. However, grants will never fully cover the costs of this development program and your support is vital.

The future

With your support our AquAffirm™ product will be rolled out first to affected parts of Bangladesh through non-government agencies (NGOs) with whom we have already been in contact. We will then roll out it out to other affected parts of the world, including India, Mexico, China, Australia and even parts of America.

 

The importance of your contributions

Your support for this campaign will help us complete development of the initial AquAffirm™ prototypes and commence field trials in Bangladesh and West Bengal (India).

Specifically, we will:

1. Develop and improve the prototype AquAffirm™ test strips and the handheld electronic reader,

2. Plan and conduct field trials with our local collaborators in affected areas of Bangladesh and India, working with rural villagers in affected communities to optimise the simplicity and usability of our system,

3. Continue to raise awareness among NGOs and other relevant agencies which will be instrumental in distributing the tests within affected regions,

4. Establish and extend a worldwide online community who will attest to the AquAffirm™ benefits and extend the story as AquAffirm™ progresses.

This crucial work will only possible with your generous support. The Perks for the AquAffirm campaign are designed to focus on addressing this massive issue:

All supporters contributing over $25 to this important campaign will receive a specially-designed “Thank You” Poster which will be downloadable from the AquAffirm team and which you will be able to print on your home/office computer.

For individual donations of $100 or more five wells in Bangladesh will be tested and the results will be reported to organisations working on the problem there. Your name will also be added to our webpage of official AquAffirm contributors. 

For individual donations of $1000 or more fifty wells in Bangladesh will be tested and the results will be reported to organisations working on the problem there and your name will be added to our webpage as an official "AquAffirm Hero". 

For each individual donation of $10,000 or more BNC will support the drilling of a new safe deep well in an affected area of Bangladesh, working with relevant organisations there to ensure its safety and your name will be added to our webpage as an official "AquAffirm Angel".

AquAffirm™ FAQs:

Q - Does the AquAffirm prototype exist, or are these just concepts? 

A - AquAffirm prototype test strips have been developed, manufactured in small batches and lab-tested so far. Results have been excellent; the test strips can reproducibly detect differences in arsenic concentration, as expected. The next step is to evaluate the tests in the real-world conditions of a field trial which we will do in conjunction with our partners at University of Dhaka and Indian Institute of Technology-Madras. Find out more at our website: http://www.bio-nano-consulting.com. Your contributions will help us test and finalize the test strip design so that we can move forward with the best possible product.

Q - When will AquAffirm field trials be occurring?
A - Our current schedule is to test the new prototype test strips in the field over the next 9 – 12 months in both India (West Bengal) and Bangladesh.

Q – What kind of tests are currently used to measure arsenic in drinking water?
A – Current field tests to measure arsenic in water are either too complicated (requiring a range of toxic chemicals), too expensive or too slow. AquAffirm is the first test that addresses all these issues and will be the FIRST test to enable villagers in rural settings to measure the quality of this most important resource. With your support we will continue developing the product - we never stop making improvements; indeed, continuous improvement is a core competency. Your contribution will help us achieve that goal!

Q – What role are your partners playing in this project?
A – Current partners include UCL and Imperial College in London where the drinksafe project originated. We are also working with an arsenic expert at the University of Dhaka, a well-known chemist at IIT-Madras and a water contamination expert in Mexico. Having such excellent partners is helping BNC to develop this technology much faster than it otherwise would have been able to.

story:
I intensely studied Checcetti ballet technique for seven years at the; The School of Dance in Ottawa, Ontario. Later in my teens I joined the Royal Netherlands Conservatory in The Hague for a year as a student and then joined a contemporary school for dance in Rotterdam; HAVO for Dance&Music. I returned to my birth land, America, and trained in the Washington school of ballet’s Release Time Program. I performed productions such as; The Nutcracker and Romeo and Juliet with The Washington Ballet. I danced in Washington Ballet‘s artistic director Septime Webber’s The Nutcracker for four consecutive years. For College; I achieved the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Dance&Choreography at Virginia Commonwealth University. My training continues as I take open adult and master classes in multiple dance studios in the city.

Demonstrating the delicate subject of Jewish conversion, with dance, is what is driving me to create a new choreography.

With your help, I hope to share my new work and participate in dance festivals, like NACHMO (National Choreography Month in Brooklyn) and many more. 

Producing a new work, can be costly. Your contribution with give me the ability to fully express my art.

story:
Summary

My name is BlackIce Bell and I've done a variety of creative projects over the past decade. I am known mostly for my conceptual photography work and projects. I am also a published author and I serve as Editor-in-Chief of INSPIRE Magazine, which is an art magazine I created six years ago. To date, I have published over 30 issues of my magazine. I am Executive Producer of the INSPIRE Magazine Podcast. We have just launched our fourth season. I am also owner of INSPIRE Studios in Stone Mountain, GA. It is a photography studio where we photograph clients and support their multimedia needs.

Most creators are stuck between two standard options: creating art or living a "regular" life. Therefore, many hours are required each week just to make ends meet and sometimes that's not even enough. Most creators either don't have time or too drained to work on their craft and innermost desires. So that's why I created NEKKED. A sweet, sexy product that's affordable and also help fellow creatives to empower themselves by earning additional income without needing a business loan.

By supporting NEKKED, you'll be helping me finance dope, creative projects and helping me, help others, which is something I always strived to do with my work. With the successful launch of NEKKED air freshener, we can expand the brand into other aroma-related products such as incense, soaps, and more! Can you just imagine NEKKED bodywash? We can!
 

What the Money Will Be Used For:

  • Launch our website to sell products nationwide
  • To minimize costs and streamline operations by buying materials in bulk, such as bottles and oils
  • Labeling and packaging

 

The Impact

I'm really excited about NEKKED, because this is a great opportunity to help others to start their own business for as low as $30 with a 50% profit margin. People love NEKKED, it's a great product!

Pursuing ideas is nothing new to me. I have a proven track record of bringing ideas to life. Within the past ten years alone, I successfully published books, magazines, completed artistic photography projects, produced shows, and more! I love coming up with ideas and bringing them to life! 

 

Risks & Challenges

This project is low risk because I already have a relationship with a distributor and begun selling NEKKED in small batches. After the campaign, contributors can expect a quick turnaround on product. 

Money will be required for marketing, but most of it is done in-house. I created the branding and designed the bottles for NEKKED.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this project! Share on whichever Social Media platform you choose or all of them. :D

Tell your friends, enemies and families. Any help is much appreciated!

story:
Background: Neurological disorders affect one billion people worldwide (i.e., 1 in 6 people), 65 million suffer from epilepsy, 24 million from Alzheimer’s and other dementias, 2.5 million from multiple sclerosis, and about 1% of the world population has been diagnosed with autism. Neurological disorders affect people in all countries, irrespective of age, sex, education or income.  A key problem is the lack of patient input in the therapy and device development process.  Neurology Patient Initiative will provide patients with a voice and the ability to direct neuroscience research objectives facilitating more effective therapies to reach patients quicker.  Neurology Patient Initiative will accelerate therapy and device development by offering award incentives to a network of solvers to develop solutions to patient-driven challenges.  Our global, open-innovation platform will securely manage patient entries and solver registrations, and will collate solutions during each competition phase.

Our goal is to find solutions to neurology patient challenges through a network of professional or aspiring scientists, engineers, programmers, students, and makers.  We use a variety of funding sources including charitable gifts, competitive grants, crowdfunding, private investors, venture philanthropists, and biomedical business partnerships to reward the problem solvers and advance ideas down the development pipeline to patients.  All ideas submitted, be they out of the box, long shots, or unconventional, will be explored because your life and your ideas matter, nothing is off the table (e.g., a smart phone apps, data analytics, wearable tech, biomarkers, assistive devices, or any useful tool/invention to help make life work).  Please fill out a patient proposal and share your ideas (http://www.patientinitiative.org).  Together we will bring science up to the speed of life.

Development: Patients and caregivers are our partners and collaborators at Neurology Patient Initiative, and the benefactors of the NPI open-innovation platform include academics and clinicians, but also innovators outside of academia rich with ideas of how to help treat and improve the lives of people with neurologic disorders but lacking the funding to making their product or treatment a reality. We are currently testing the idea with neurology patient groups in the greater Denver area.  A paramount step towards reaching both the customers and the benefactors of NPI, however, is to build the minimum viable product (i.e., an open-innovation website) and test its efficacy against the solver populations.  Prototype websites will simultaneously be built in collaboration with the Computer Science Department at University of Colorado Boulder and at the Galvanize site in Boulder.  Each prototype will be launched in beta format to local/national neuroscience and technology communities for feedback (i.e., content, features, user-interface) regarding how the product can be improved.  Maintenance of the site will require a staff of Web developers, at least one good database person, and a small group of business personnel (operations, marketing, sales, finance, etc.).  We hope to recruit volunteer scientist reviewers, but may have to offer consultant fees.  Early stage cash flow is dependent on fundraising, grants, and investors/donors. NPI can seek to collaborate with winning submitters, or proceed independently to reduce solution to practice.  Therefore, until we are established, have a consistent donor base, and regular patient-driven challenges, our revenue will depend entirely on fundraising and grant submissions.  Therefore, the $250,000 will be directed towards prototype development, startup, legal costs, and fundraising.  Most importantly, we will use the funds raised here to catalyze patient-driven prize challenges.

If you can’t contribute in dollars, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please help us make some noise about Neurology Patient Initiative and its potential impact! 

  • Let your friends on Facebook and twitter know about our campaign and share our website www.patientinitiative.org
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your contribution,

Heidi

story:
Brightstems Inc specializes in bringing innovative ways to offer customized mindfulness practices through mobile-app, online webinars, one on one sessions and many more. Our practices are simple, easy to use, have proven to help thousands such as engineers at IBM, practitioners at Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital and kids at Marlborough Montessori Academy to name a few. Our practices are backed by "Eastern wisdom".

Eastern wisdom aims at optimum level of well-being, performance, creativity, peace and happiness in human life. It is 6000 years old, supported by 3000 texts and teachers. It aims at discovering the true nature, allowing the powers of true nature to express itself in daily living.

The mobile-app is designed to offer "5 minutes a practice, 5 times a day" practices that are customized to meet your individual needs.

The practices help
• Managing day-to-day challenges of anxiety, sleep disturbances, and stress.
• Prevent the onset of challenges and promotes well-being and
• Discover inner peace and happiness
The goal of mobile App and our programs is to help and maximize the benefits to end user by • To identify the challenges and introduce simple and easy practices
• To bring about evidence based changes in personal and professional lives and
• To guide people to continue to work towards inner prosperity leading to outer prosperity

Balaji Thirugnanam is a management professional with sales, business & technology acumen and a Co-founder of Brightstems Inc. For the past 20 years, he has been developing Information Technology products, manage projects & programs for leading organizations, define product roadmap for multi-million dollar programs and consulted for several organizations. 

Girish Jha is a life coach & mindfulness expert and a Co-founder of Brightstems Inc. He has been practicing mindfulness and healthy living practices for the past 38 years. He is an expert in "Eastern Wisdom" concepts. He has helped thousands of individuals and employees of corporations to overcome stress, anxiety, fatigue, opioid & drug addiction and numerous other personal & professional challenges.

 

We have initiated a campaign to

  • update our mobileapp with features to help our consumers to get a pulse of their progress in taking the mindfulness practices
  • enhance our algorithm to deliver additional and robust practices
  • add fun features for kids to embrace the application.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have estimated the work to complete the updates and redesign the mobileapp screens will cost us $200,000. The funding will be distributed to develop additional video practices, develop technology programs & reports and measure application performance using automated tools.

At present, the mobileapp monthly subscription starts at $9.99.  To match your contribution, we will double your contribution and apply this towards the monthly subscription for the mobileapp. If the contribution is significant, we will invite you to participate in a discussion to share a part of our success(equity).​

Even if we cant reach the goal, we will still honor your contribution with subscription perks.

The Impact

Being a part of our campaign,

  • You will be part of an initiative that will help thousands of individuals with professional and personal challenges
  • You will be part of the project backed by executives who have tremendous experience in delivering technology projects and mindfulness practices for several years.

Risks & Challenges

While our practices - has helped thousands, our matured process - proven by the mobileapp that is in the market, our leadership - with several years of experience, we are confident that the product will be developed with ultimate quality and delivered on time. The compounding return of investment is purely based on the reception of the product by end consumers. At minimum, we can guarantee that the practices will help you but we bet on the consumer market to match the return of investment.

The founders will be investing time and money to heavily market the product to mitigate the risk

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are short of a reason to pitch money, we will really appreciate the following,

  • download our mobile app 'Surface for Mindfulness' from Apple/Google stores and try the practices
  • Spread the work in your circle about the mobile app and have them signup.
  • Use the indiegogo share tools to maximize the visibility.

Our practices are backed by "Eastern wisdom".
Eastern wisdom aims at optimum level of well-being, performance, creativity, peace and happiness in human life. It is 6000 years old, supported by 3000 texts and teachers. It aims at discovering the true nature, allowing the powers of true nature to express itself in daily living.
The mobile-app is designed to offer "5 minutes a practice, 5 times a day" practices that are customized to meet your individual needs.The practices help• Managing day-to-day challenges of anxiety, sleep disturbances, and stress.• Prevent the onset of challenges and promotes well-being and• Discover inner peace and happinessThe goal of mobile App and our programs is to help and maximize the benefits to end user by • To identify the challenges and introduce simple and easy practices• To bring about evidence based changes in personal and professional lives and• To guide people to continue to work towards inner prosperity leading to outer prosperity
Balaji Thirugnanam is a management professional with sales, business & technology acumen and a Co-founder of Brightstems Inc. For the past 20 years, he has been developing Information Technology products, manage projects & programs for leading organizations, define product roadmap for multi-million dollar programs and consulted for several organizations. 
Girish Jha is a life coach & mindfulness expert and a Co-founder of Brightstems Inc. He has been practicing mindfulness and healthy living practices for the past 38 years. He is an expert in "Eastern Wisdom" concepts. He has helped thousands of individuals and employees of corporations to overcome stress, anxiety, fatigue, opioid & drug addiction and numerous other personal & professional challenges.
 
We have initiated a campaign to

update our mobileapp with features to help our consumers to get a pulse of their progress in taking the mindfulness practices
enhance our algorithm to deliver additional and robust practices
add fun features for kids to embrace the application.

 

What We Need & What You Get
We have estimated the work to complete the updates and redesign the mobileapp screens will cost us $200,000. The funding will be distributed to develop additional video practices, develop technology programs & reports and measure application performance using automated tools.
At present, the mobileapp monthly subscription starts at $9.99.  To match your contribution, we will double your contribution and apply this towards the monthly subscription for the mobileapp. If the contribution is significant, we will invite you to participate in a discussion to share a part of our success(equity).​
Even if we cant reach the goal, we will still honor your contribution with subscription perks.

The Impact
Being a part of our campaign,

You will be part of an initiative that will help thousands of individuals with professional and personal challenges
You will be part of the project backed by executives who have tremendous experience in delivering technology projects and mindfulness practices for several years.


Risks & Challenges
While our practices - has helped thousands, our matured process - proven by the mobileapp that is in the market, our leadership - with several years of experience, we are confident that the product will be developed with ultimate quality and delivered on time. The compounding return of investment is purely based on the reception of the product by end consumers. At minimum, we can guarantee that the practices will help you but we bet on the consumer market to match the return of investment.
The founders will be investing time and money to heavily market the product to mitigate the risk

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you are short of a reason to pitch money, we will really appreciate the following,

download our mobile app 'Surface for Mindfulness' from Apple/Google stores and try the practices
Spread the work in your circle about the mobile app and have them signup.
Use the indiegogo share tools to maximize the visibility.

story:
Help host a training camp for those who are doing good for the kids in Brazil.


BJJ 4 Change is a travel documentary film initiative created by Neverending Light Productions.  The purpose is to provide outstanding BJJ training while helping the children in the Brazilian favelas. ​NEL's two-time Emmy Award winning team will capture the trip and create one heartfelt short video and one longer documentary that showcases each of the celebrity coaches alongside the participants. This film will be distributed widely on Netflix and ESPN Int'l.  Proceeds from the film will go to the kids of struggle from each of the participating schools.   

In order to make this happen for low enough costs, we need your help --- please consider buying a Gi patch, t-shirt, or any other items to give these guys a pat on the back.  


Proceeds go to the kids in the favelas for gi's, mats, scholarships, and visa sponsorships.  




 Patches:

story:
Geri G. We Make Products That Improve 

I started Geri G. after years of frustration of not being able to recommend a healthy makeup for my clients.  As a skin expert and makeup artist, I knew there was something missing on the market when it came to protecting women's skin and making makeup less harmful to the skin.  So I decided to try and make a skin care product that would also work with makeup to ensure that the skin was protected and nourished.  What I created was the first ever 4-1 skin supplement that  nourished the skin and instantly transformed makeup once it came in contact with the skin.  Transceutical® Canvas works on all skins and works with all makeup to instantly boost it's performance, making it more blend-able. water resistant and long lasting.  Transceutical Canvas is the only product that can be used both day and night as an anti aging moisturizer as well.


Our proprietary ingredient Nanomarine-5® is another exclusive formula the is part of the uniqueness in our products.  Key nutrients found in organic marine and land botanicals slowly feed the skin nourishment.  The extracts are chosen for their ability to maintain natural resources of skin supporting nutrients like Vitamins, A,C and E as well as omega's, proteins and minerals.

                            


Our campaign is driven with our passion to make Geri G. available to women everywhere.  Our brand expansion will help bring the signature Geri G. skin therapies and beauty line available to mainstream. We have chosen New York because it is an international city that has the potential for us to reach more people as well as having a retail outlet for those who wish to experience the Geri G. difference first hand.


By helping us reach our goal, you are helping us change lives. There is nothing more gratifying than seeing a smile on a young girl's face after she realizes how beautiful and healthy her skin can become with the right products.  And there is nothing more gratifying than helping women who feel that their skin and body have let them down with age. Geri G. uses scientifically proven treatments and therapies that will be available to those who visit our New York location. We can make a difference and change how women of all ages address taking care of themselves from the inside-out, all under one roof.


Geri G.® the brand is a brand that is addressing the WHY behind the symptoms of skincare and health issues. Educating clients that in order to treat and prevent what is happening on the outside, you must address the body on the health of the inside at the same time. Products can help or hinder the skin and the same goes for nutrition.

Geri G.® is a brand that goes deeper than the surface and connects with helping clients understand how their bodies work which lead to achieving visual results in their appearance and physical results in how their bodies look.

Our Promise

Geri G.® Beauty products are proudly made in the USA and are NOT tested on animals.

All cosmetics contain Geri’s signature trademark ingredient Nanomarine-5® A proprietary blend of organic botanical and marine extracts that deliver nutrients to the skin via nanotechnology.

Free of: Siloxanes, BHA &BHT, Petrolatum, Coaltar Dyes, P-phenylenediamine, DMDM hydrating, Diazolidinyl, Imidazolidinyl Urea, Methenomine, Quartering-15, Parabens, PEG compound, Propylene Glycol. Animal & Cruelty Free.

We use all recycled packaging for all our goods. All manufactured and produced in the USA.

The Geri G.® “classic”collection is timeless. Every women’s wish for just the essentials in her makeup bag that do the trick of giving her natural radiant skin while improving the vitality and health of her skin at the same time. Developed to make your makeup look its best, perform at its best and be the best each and every time you put it on. 

Our Mission:

Geri G.® offers nutrition-based skin care services and products that treat the body as a whole with one goal to achieve; a young, lean and healthy body.

Our Vision:

Geri G.® will change the way you think about your body from the inside-out.

Our Values:

Natural Process, Beneficial Trust, Integrity, Caring, Respect, Dignity, Fresh, Simplicity. 


What We Need & What You Get

$50k of the funds we raise will go  towards manufacturing  REVOLUTIONARY products for Geri G.

Risks & Challenges

We know that trying to compete with the "big boys" in our category is not easy.  That is why we need YOUR help to overcome the obvious obstacles we face as a small business with a different attitude and approach to one of the oldest and most competitive industries in the world.  We are so passionate about making a difference in people's lives and we are determined to continue until Geri G is a household name, synonymous with skin, health and beauty. Geri G is a "do good" company that aims to change lives and make a stand for better standards and practices in our industry.


Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for you to help us spread the word about Geri G and our story with friends, family and social media buds. Find GeriGLA on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Pinterest. You can always  email us to just say "Hi". We love hearing from new fans!

story:
Short Summary

StandWatch.org is a non-profit organization that is being built from the ground up to provide free medical care to veterans who live in small towns and out of the way places.  Over 300,000 veterans have died waiting for healthcare services.  StandWatch wants to put an end to that.

Our goal is to build mobile medical units that can go to rural areas and small towns and provide healthcare to veterans.  We are not trying to replace the VA.  We want to fill the geographic space between the veterans and the care they deserve.

In order to accomplish this goal, StandWatch needs to raise $150,000 to purchase a vehicle, a cargo trailer, and some medical supplies.  

We have a great management team in place with over twenty years experience as physicians. Our board members and managers have the same amount of experience in finance, government auditing, banking, small business management, or the military. We know what its like to start, run, and manage businesses and medical practices.

As a nation, we owe this to each and every veteran.  We cannot allow one more to die while waiting for the care they were promised. Not one more.

What We Need & What You Get

NOTE:  A detailed explanation of our use of proceeds statement can be found on our website at www.standwatch.org under the "How Will We Use Donations?" tab.

Our goal for this campaign is to raise enough money to literally get the wheels rolling.  With the first $150,000, we will be able to purchase an SUV, a cargo trailer, medical diagnostic equipment, and some expendables.  With this, we will be able to set up mobile care site and begin having an impact on veterans and their families.

What happen’s at a care site?  StandWatch’s doctors and nurses will:

  • Provide basic care for problems that can be addressed onsite
  • Identify problems that require a specialist’s opinion
  • Schedule an appointment with the appropriate specialist, including psychiatric care
  • Provide a voucher that will cover the cost of the initial specialist consult

 This is a big problem that requires a big solution.  StandWatch is the first step.

The Impact

We can begin having an impact within just a few weeks after reaching our goal. StandWatch is all about caring for people.  We are not a political advocacy group, and we don’t care about government reform, insurance, the Affordable Care Act, or photo-ops with politicians.  We will NEVER take one dime of government money, and everything we do is focused on the single goal of putting boots on the ground to help save lives.  Your donation will help us do that.  It's that simple.

Risks & Challenges

As was mentioned above, this is a big challenge.  As with anything of this nature, there are always risks related to operations, equipment, and people.  That said, our management team has been dealing with these types of problems for 20 years in their various practices and businesses, and we're confident that we can solve any crises that develop.  

The only risk we cannot manage is one of resources.  If we cannot raise enough money, we can't build the mobile medical teams.  If we can't build the teams, we can't provide care.  We are betting though that there are thousands of Americans like us who feel that we owe our veterans the care they were promised. If we're correct, the money will come. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give, you can help us by spreading the word to your friends and family.  Go to our website at www.standwatch.org and follow us on social media.  With your help, we can make a difference. We can help save those who risked everything for us.

story:
Hi! I'm Hanna, I am an entrepreneur from Turku, Finland. I have spent most of my time in West-Africa during the past 6 years. Ghana is a second home to me. I love Ghana, her people, its nature, rhythms and colors.

BUT................

This BUT is mostly illustrated to us and the world as photos and videos of impoverished  mothers and children with round bellies and flies in their eyes. That's not what I see. I see a beautiful opportunity of all of us working together for common good. To improve all of our lives. To make an direct impact on people's lives.

It is because of this opportunity that I put together a great team and created Finneco Solutions. We design and build composting toilets for developing countries, especially for locations where water supply is an issue. Our first focus area is Ghana where we've set up a franchise, Finneco Solutions Ghana. Believe me, a lot of people there dream of having a proper toilet. Actually, the country was recently ranked as second in Africa with open defecation (DailyGude, 2015). 

Many Ghanaian's cannot afford to buy a toilet at one time. For that reason public shared toilets become option, where people pay every time per every use, or worse open defecate. This behavior is unsanitary, unsafe and dangerous as the spread of contagious diseases cause massive health issues for the men, women and children of Ghana. 

Now, let me get to the point! I'm calling on you or your company to get involved in our Toilet Dream Campaign. To make an impact and do something that is important in so many ways. I'm asking you or your business to purchase 50% of a Finneco Solutions toilet for a Ghanaian family, school or community.

Every penny of your purchase goes to the construction and installation of the toilet facility; for real people with real need. The qualified recipient will pay for the other half in accordance with an affordable payment plan chosen by them. My idea is; that the customer's monthly payment for the toilet is similar to the amount spent for public toilets.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach an amount of 20 000€ from this campaign. That will be 100% used for building the Finneco composting toilets to serve a total of 700 Ghanaians in need. The recipients will be selected by our team. Each will pay us the remaining half of the toilet in installments and that will cover the rest of the building & labor expenses.

In the event we do not reach our goal of 20 000€, we will use the money raised to build as many toilets as possible.

Then what will you get? 

You or your business gets a special opportunity to make a straight, concrete impact into real needs of real people.

Once the composting toilet facility purchased by you / your business has been built and installed, we will send you a certificate and a photo or video of the dream that you have made come true! Additionally, depending on the product purchased you can get your/ the name of your company on our website!

This is a unique chance for your business to get novel marketing value for accomplishing CSR of great worth.


The Impact

So why do people dream of toilets?

What is the impact of making the Toilet Dream come true?

Could you imagine a day at school or work without a toilet? What about a home without toilet? I've seen these realities behind the happy, easy-going scenes in Ghana. People dream of having a proper toilet, because it offers:

- Health. Different contagious, air- and waterborne diseases (e.g. cholera) can be significantly reduced by using and maintaining a hygienic toilet. Bad sanitation is the second common cause of death after malaria in developing countries.

- Safety and privacy, especially for girls and women who often experience sexual harassment when practicing open defecation or using public toilets.

- Gender equality for education. When girls and boys have safe, separate toilets and the menstrual management for girls is taken into consideration girls have much greater opportunities for education.

- Cost-effective way to reduce poverty. Improved sanitation saves time, increases production and reduces health costs.

Then why buy only half of a toilet? 

We believe that by involving the customer to cover half of the toilet cost will create truly sustainable solutions for sanitation. The customers can feel proud and responsible when carrying out their part for their basic needs and common good for their living area. They will use and maintain the facilities with better care, which will extend the lifespan of the toilet.

Generally, this system will also help change "the getting for free" attitude. In several cases poor areas get help and donations from many organizations and NGOs and at some point this will not encourage the people to be initiative and responsible to help themselves and improve their lives and living conditions.

And why composting toilets?

Composting toilets fit excellently to the climate conditions of most developing countries.

The composting takes place efficiently and fast.

Our composting toilets run water-free. That's a great advantage in countries where there's water shortage and the sewage systems are undeveloped like Ghana.

Commonly used pit latrines with poor underground structures cause leakage of the waste into water tables and the heavy rains and floods during the raining season spread severe diseases from the open sewers. Such problems have been taken into consideration with our products.

The underground structures of the composting toilets are waterproof and there's a flood proof solution of one-half meter in most of our models.

When the facility is used and maintained all the waste breaks down into natural compost manure. This is a very affordable and Eco-friendly waste treatment solution. The compost manure collection from our facilities is easy and there's no need for trucks to zigzag on the bad, narrow roads of overpopulated urban areas.

In the capital of Ghana, Accra, 120 trucks of untreated waste is dumped into the Atlantic Ocean every day because of insufficient waste treatment plants for the highly populated city. Instead of creating waste, our toilets provide compost manure as an end product. It is an affordable natural fertilizer to be used by farmers. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the Toilet Dreams to your family, friends and work place or other potential businesses to join this project!

Also use the Indiegogo share tools to share Toilet Dreams on your social media channels. Make an impact with us. Thank you.
